Title: Staff Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Change the way the world travels

Be part of the GetYourGuide journey and connect people with unforgettable travel experiences worldwide. Since 2009, millions of travelers have booked unique activities with us in over 12,000 cities. Our headquarters in Berlin is supported by 16 other local offices across the globe.

Ready to join a diverse community of over 850 fellow explorers dedicated to revolutionizing the travel experience industry? Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department‚Äôs mission is to enable the Marketing organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics team whose objective is to help our marketing scale our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. This is a very strategic position within the team as the Analyst will look at solving cross-channel problems in order to accelerate our growth. This means for example addressing the best strategy to grow our mid-funnel spend and understanding the behaviour of our repeat audiences.

Your mission


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Propose and defend strategic recommendations to our top marketing leads
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value‚Ä¶)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Setup and analyse marketing experiments to drive strategic decision making
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Your toolkit


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing, especially data-driven platforms such as Google Ads and Meta.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


What Sets You Apart


A track record in solving marketing and growth challenges and influencing decisions/driving business results
Experience in understanding and modelling marketing journeys
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


We want your journey with us to be extraordinary


Here‚Äôs how you can expect us to commit to you and your growth.
Annual personal growth budget and mentorship programs for continuous learning and development
Work from anywhere in the world for 40 days per year
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Opportunities to collaborate and socialize with team members through quarterly team events and yearly company-wide events
Monthly transportation and fitness budget
Discounts for you, your friends, and family on GetYourGuide activities
Language reimbursement program
Health and wellness benefits


And more‚Ä¶

How to apply

Submit your CV/resume in English using the form below. For tips and insights into our hiring process and culture, check out ‚Äòhow we hire‚Äô and ‚Äòlife at GetYourGuide‚Äô. If you have any further questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch at jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Junior or Senior Power BI Analyst
Description:
Sustainability that means business

What We Do

Our innovative SaaS solutions increase efficiency and boost sustainability in resource-intensive industries. Over 5,000 customers across 23 countries already benefit from our Performance Sustainability software, ensuring we deliver practical solutions for improved profitability and environmental resilience across the globe.

Who We Are

Sustainability software specialist, AMCS, is headquartered in Ireland, with offices in Europe, USA, Canada and Australasia. With over 1,300 highly-skilled employees across 22 countries, we specialize in delivering technology solutions to facilitate a carbon neutral future.

Our people

AMCS offers team members more than just a job, but an opportunity to map out a career with a company that is growing, evolving and setting out new ways of working that are having a positive impact on the world around us. AMCS was established in Ireland and holds onto those local roots and ‚Äòstart-up‚Äô mentality with a culture of connection. Connection to our work, our customers, our colleagues and our community that creates a working environment that fosters openness, collaboration and creativity.

We are seeking a skilled Junior or Senior Power BI Analyst to join our Analytics team, with a particular focus on Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing dashboards that help our customers leverage data-driven insights for optimization and decision-making in EHS and ESG areas. You will collaborate closely with customer stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and deliver actionable insights through data visualization.

Key Responsibilities


Managing projects with customers.
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Apache Superset or Power BI focused on EHS and ESG performance metrics.
Collaborate with the customer¬¥s EHS and ESG teams to gather requirements and understand specific data needs for compliance, reporting, and sustainability initiatives.
Work with our ESG & EHS data models to create dashboards customized for our customers in Apache Superset or Power BI.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across all reports and dashboards, particularly in relation to EHS compliance and ESG disclosures.
Train and support end-users in the use of our Analytics solutions
Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in business intelligence technologies, especially those related to EHS and ESG reporting.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Environmental Science, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, Business Administration or a related educational training or experience from another context.
Junior: first experience in an internship or as a working student in a data analysis or reporting role in customer contact with specific experience using Power BI.


OR


Senior: 2+ years of experience in a data analysis or reporting role with customer interaction including project management. Specific experience using in Apache Superset and Power BI are a plus.
Experience in data modelling, DAX language and Power Query.
Strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis and visualization.
Junior: Basic understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.


OR


Senior: Proficient understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with databases (SQL Server, Maria DB etc.) and data warehousing concepts.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.


Desirable Qualifications


Knowledge of Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics and related reporting requirements. (e.g., GRI, SASB, TCFD).
Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques.
Experience with other BI tools (Apache Superset, Sisense, etc.)

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Environmental Science, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, Business Administration or a related educational training or experience from another context.
  • Junior: first experience in an internship or as a working student in a data analysis or reporting role in customer contact with specific experience using Power BI.

OR

  • Senior: 2+ years of experience in a data analysis or reporting role with customer interaction including project management. Specific experience using in Apache Superset and Power BI are a plus.
  • Experience in data modelling, DAX language and Power Query.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis and visualization.
  • Junior: Basic understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.

OR

  • Senior: Proficient understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
  • Familiarity with databases (SQL Server, Maria DB etc.) and data warehousing concepts.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Desirable Qualifications

  • Knowledge of Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics and related reporting requirements. (e.g., GRI, SASB, TCFD).
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques.
  • Experience with other BI tools (Apache Superset, Sisense, etc.)

Description:
_

Unsere Kultur und Grunds√§tze. Was wir tun, muss uns Freude machen - zu jedem Zeitpunkt. Wir nehmen nur Projekte an, die uns im positiven Sinne herausfordern und weiterbringen. Jede Zusammenarbeit ist von einem Miteinander auf Augenh√∂he gepr√§gt - im internen wie externen Team. Kompetenz schl√§gt Hierarchie - immer. Wir gehen offen miteinander um und leben Transparenz.

Das macht Deinen Job aus

Deine Aufgaben. Du erfasst und entwickelst gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden und Beratern das, was unsere Kunden in den Bereichen Business Analysis/ Business Intelligence/ Controlling/ Data Analysis/ Data Analytics/ Data Engineering/ Data Intelligence/ Data Management/ Data Science/ Data Warehouse ben√∂tigen.

Deine Aufgaben im Einzelnen. Erfassen der Ausgangssituation/ von Use Cases. Zusammen mit Entwicklern Daten-/ ETL-Pipelines bauen. Datenverarbeitung. Datenmodellierung und Data Relations definieren. Abstimmen und Erstellen von Dashboards/ Reports. Training und Support von Key-Usern, Auswerten und Interpretieren von Daten.

Dein Bereich. Die Position ist dem Bereich ‚ÄûConsulting‚Äú zugeordnet. Deine F√ºhrungskraft ist vom Fach. Sie kann Dir fachkompetent R√ºckmeldung und Unterst√ºtzung geben.

Ber√ºhrungs- und Kontaktpunkte. Du hast regelm√§√üig Kontakt zu Kunden sowie zu Kolleginnen und Kollegen aus anderen Bereichen. Die Kollegen aus dem Bereich Softwareentwicklung unterst√ºtzen Dich gerne beim Entwickeln und Anbinden notwendiger Schnittstellen.

Reiset√§tigkeit. Du kannst viele Aufgaben virtuell machen. Du arbeitest rund 1 Tag/ Monat vor Ort bei Kunden.

_

Das bringst Du mit

Fachlich/ methodisch. Erfahrung als IT-Berater/ Dienstleister f√ºr externe Kunden, idealerweise externe Kunden in den Funktionen GF, Controlling/ kaufm√§nnische Bereiche. Erfahrung im Bereich Automatisierung, Analyse und Visualisierung von Gesch√§ftsdaten. Erfahrung mit einem Tool zur Gesch√§ftsanalyse und zur Darstellung von Gesch√§ftsdaten aus verschiedenen Datenquellen, z.B. MS Power BI, Grafana, Qlik, Tableau. Erfahrung mit Datenbanksystemen, z.B. MySQL, MS SQL.

Qualifikation. Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbare Qualifikation. Quereinsteiger, Fachfremde und Autodidakten mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung willkommen.

Pers√∂nlich/ sozial. Hohes Ma√ü an Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Selbstst√§ndigkeit. Interdisziplin√§res und agiles Mindset. Einsatzbereitschaft und Teamf√§higkeit.

Deutschkenntnisse. C2 oder muttersprachliches Niveau in Wort und Schrift.

_

Das bieten wir Dir

Wir m√∂chten Dir gerne ein individuelles Angebot machen. Dies k√∂nnen wir erst, wenn wir Dich kennengelernt haben. Bis dahin teilen wir gerne unsere Angebots-Standards mit Dir.

Unternehmen. Wir sind ein etabliertes und wachsendes Unternehmen. Du kannst die Entwicklung des Unternehmens mitgestalten und miterleben.

Aufgaben. Du hast vielf√§ltige M√∂glichkeiten, bei unseren Kunden und uns einen Unterschied zu machen und Wirkung zu erzielen.

Standort, Lage und Infrastruktur. Du kannst unsere B√ºros gut mit dem Auto, √∂V und dem Fahrrad erreichen. F√ºr den √∂V bekommst Du ein Jobticket. Superm√§rkte, Restaurants, Fitness-Studio etc. sind fu√ül√§ufig erreichbar.

B√ºror√§ume. Du kannst in 2er-/ 4er-B√ºros oder Co-Working Spaces mit moderner Innenarchitektur arbeiten.

Remote Arbeiten. Du kannst - in Absprache mit dem Team Lead - 1 d/ Wo remote arbeiten. Beim Arbeitsmodell "Remote" arbeitest Du √ºberwiegend remote und bist alle 4-6 Wochen f√ºr ein paar Tage im Office.

Technische Ausstattung. Wir statten Dich im B√ºro als auch f√ºr Remote Arbeiten top aus und gehen auf Deine W√ºnsche ein.

Weiterentwicklung. Du hast bei uns viele M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr fachliche Entwicklung und personelle Verantwortung. Gemeinsam sprechen wir √ºber Deine Laufbahn bei uns, Dein Onboarding, Feedback und Personalentwicklung.

Verg√ºtung und Benefits. Du erh√§ltst bei uns ein √ºberdurchschnittliches Gehalt und attraktive Corporate Benefits, z.B. BAV, Mitarbeitervorteilsprogramm, ...

Kultur. Wir haben eine offene Kultur mit Raum f√ºr Deine Ideen. Weitere Informationen zu unserer Kultur sowie Mitarbeiterstimmen findest Du auf unserer Karriereseite https://www.anders-ganz.de/karriere/.

_

Kontakt aufnehmen/ Bewerben

Wir freuen uns, wenn Du Kontakt zu uns aufnimmst, Dein Interesse an der Stelle bekundest oder Dich bewirbst! Lasse uns einfach Deine Kontaktdaten, Deinen Lebenslauf oder einen Link zu Deinem Profil zukommen. Wir verzichten auf ein Anschreiben. Title: Data Analyst, Client Onboarding
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics
Conduct A/B tests to evaluate and optimize business decisions
Perform deep-dives into socio-economic factors and distribution channels to uncover actionable insights


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Solid statistical & technical foundation (e.g., A/B Testing, hypothesis testing) with a self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What We Offer


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About Us

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

Title: Analytics Consultant | DACH
Description:
At Biztory, we empower businesses to become truly data-driven. As one of Europe's leading data consultancies, we help our clients design, build, and scale modern data stacks that deliver actionable insights faster. Now, we're looking for an Analytics Engineer to help us shape the future of data self-service and modeling across the DACH region.

Your Mission

As an Analytics Consultant at Biztory, you'll guide clients through their data journey‚Äîfrom insight generation to impactful decision-making. You'll use your expertise in Tableau and the Salesforce ecosystem to craft dashboards that tell meaningful stories and help businesses take action. You'll work closely with stakeholders to translate business questions into clear, visual answers.

If you enjoy blending technical skills with business understanding, this role is for you.

What You'll Do


Design and build impactful dashboards using Tableau Software
Connect data sources, including Salesforce (Marketing Cloud and beyond), to uncover actionable insights
Work directly with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into tailored analytical solutions
Apply data modeling techniques to support effective self-service analytics
Lead workshops and enablement sessions to empower end users
Collaborate with cross-functional Biztory teams across Europe
Travel as needed to support client engagements within the DACH region


Requirements

What You Bring


3+ years of hands-on experience with Tableau in a professional setting
Solid understanding of the Salesforce ecosystem
Strong data modeling capabilities and experience working with business stakeholders
Excellent communication and storytelling skills - you're comfortable interfacing with both technical and business stakeholders
Fluent in German and English, additional languages are a plus
Based in DACH, preferably around D√ºsseldorf, Cologne, or Berlin, and ready to travel


Nice to Have


Prior consulting experience or other customer-facing roles
Experience with other BI tools
Interest in team leadership or mentoring


Benefits

Why Join Biztory?

We're not your typical consultancy. At Biztory, you'll:


Work with modern tools and industry-leading partners
Be part of an international, collaborative, and ambitious team
Have opportunities for career growth, including in AI and leadership tracks
Home set-up with laptop, screen, docking station, headset, keyboard, and mouse
Multiple team events and get-togethers per year
Company Pension Plan (if desired)
Company car, bike, or train subscription (if desired)
Reimbursement of phone and internet costs
Corporate Benefits Program


Ready to help businesses turn data into insight?

Let's chat.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

They heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission


Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
Mentorship & Alignment: Manage and upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company‚Äôs vision and goals.
Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.


What we are looking for?


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with dbt is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.


Why heyData?


Your growth matters: Clear development paths, an annual & flexible learning budget, and real trust in your ideas.
Work the way that works for you: Remote, from our Berlin office, or hybrid - you decide where you‚Äôre most productive.
Time for yourself: 30 vacation days, flexible working hours, and a work culture that values focus time and supports your productivity.
State-of-the-art equipment : A MacBook & Co. to help you get started quickly
On top of that, we support in your Benefits: Urban Sports Club membership, the Deutschlandticket, a company pension plan, and more.
Team spirit that sticks: Offsites, regular team events, and honest, transparent communication on equal footing.
Be yourself: Diversity makes us stronger ‚Äì no matter where you‚Äôre from, how you identify, or where you are in life.


About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker ‚Äì you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.

HTML:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

They heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission

  • Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
  • Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
  • Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
  • Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
  • Mentorship & Alignment: Manage and upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company‚Äôs vision and goals.
  • Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.

What we are looking for?

  • 5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
  • Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
  • Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience with dbt is a plus.
  • Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
  • Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.

Why heyData?

  • Your growth matters: Clear development paths, an annual & flexible learning budget, and real trust in your ideas.
  • Work the way that works for you: Remote, from our Berlin office, or hybrid - you decide where you‚Äôre most productive.
  • Time for yourself: 30 vacation days, flexible working hours, and a work culture that values focus time and supports your productivity.
  • State-of-the-art equipment : A MacBook & Co. to help you get started quickly
  • On top of that, we support in your Benefits: Urban Sports Club membership, the Deutschlandticket, a company pension plan, and more.
  • Team spirit that sticks: Offsites, regular team events, and honest, transparent communication on equal footing.
  • Be yourself: Diversity makes us stronger ‚Äì no matter where you‚Äôre from, how you identify, or where you are in life.

About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker ‚Äì you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. Your role will involve developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations, collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and meet their data needs, and conducting advanced statistical analyses. You will ensure data integrity and accuracy, communicate findings effectively, and contribute to the strategic direction of our data division within the engineering department. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.




YOUR CHALLENGE:

Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to track key metrics.
Own part of our data transformation layer where we apply data modeling techniques (via dbt) to transform raw data into analytics-friendly data assets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Conduct advanced statistical analyses and predictive modeling to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Develop domain expertise in a set of business domains (e.g. Product, Marketing, Operations or Sales) to become a valuable partner to our business stakeholders
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.

ABOUT YOU:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Experience in data modeling using DBT
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.







About Blacklane

Our mission is simple but powerful: to become the world‚Äôs leading premium, global chauffeur service. Operating in 50+ countries, we reimagine chauffeur-driven rides by prioritizing reliability, innovation, and first-class service at every step. Blacklane is also at the forefront of sustainable mobility efforts, continuously working to reduce our operational impact on the planet.




Our Company Culture

Blacklane has grown from a two-person startup in Berlin to a global team of over 300 people representing 54+ nationalities. Powered by our commitment to care, inclusion, innovation, and collaboration, we support employees through initiatives like Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), mentorship programs, and more.




Here are just a few examples of the ERGs fostering connection:

LGBTQIA+ Network ‚Äì Advocating for inclusivity and championing allyship.
Bookclub ‚Äì Encouraging cultural exchange, fostering discussion, critical thinking, and team engagement through shared reading and analysis.
Blacklane Cares Leave ‚Äì Spend up to eight paid hours annually volunteering for causes meaningful to you.

We welcome‚Äîand actively support‚Äîemployees to create or join the communities that are important to them.




Why join us in a Blacklane on the fast lane?

Fair Pay & Shared Success ‚Üí We provide good salaries and automatically enroll all employees in our Virtual Stock Options Plan (VSOP). Your shares vest over four years, with full transparency on their value growth through Ledgy.
Blacklane Mystery Rides ‚Üí As a valued contributor to our success and growth, we are pleased to offer you one complimentary ride per quarter to experience and evaluate our chauffeur services firsthand.
Learning & Development at Blacklane ‚Üí We value the person beyond the CV, which is why we are committed to your continuous growth‚Äînot just for the company‚Äôs success, but for your own professional development. We believe that when our employees stay ahead, so does Blacklane. That‚Äôs why you have free access to thousands of online courses on LinkedIn Learning, tailored to your career aspirations, along with a unique learning experience designed for those stepping into leadership roles.
The way to your heart goes through your stomach? ‚Üí If so, we‚Äôve got something special for you, in Berlin: our weekly homecooked, quality office lunches. Not only do they fuel your mind and body, but they also provide the perfect opportunity to connect with colleagues from all departments, fostering stronger bonds beyond your own division.
Your Health, No Compromise ‚Üí with Nilo Health & WHOOP
We prioritize both your mental and physical well-being because a healthy team creates a thriving culture. That‚Äôs why we offer access to the Nilo Health platform for mental wellness and the WHOOP bracelet, after one year to support your fitness‚Äîavailable for you to use as you choose.
Social responsibility ‚Üí We Care: Learn more about Miracle flights and the meaningful impact behind our commitment to making a difference.
Share your ideas with Blacklane‚Äôs C-Level ‚Üí Our approachable C-Level team values your insights. Once a month, they host a consultation day where you‚Äôre invited to share your ideas, feedback, and constructive criticism‚Äîbecause your voice shapes our future.
Thrive Together ‚Üí Our Hybrid Office Culture: At Blacklane, we believe in the power of in-person collaboration and connection. That‚Äôs why we follow a hybrid, 3 office day focused approach. This supports both our fast-paced growth and the building of strong, engaged teams. We know everyone‚Äôs situation is unique, so our hybrid setup still allows for flexibility when needed. If you‚Äôre excited about contributing in a dynamic, people-driven environment and value both teamwork and personal accountability, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




Do you have any questions or want to know more about our way of working? Feel free to contact us. We‚Äôre happy to connect!

We place great value on equal opportunities. Therefore, we welcome everyone to apply!




Curious to see us in action? Let‚Äôs go!

‚Üí Watch us on Amazon Prime‚Üí Listen to our CEO in Startup insider episode #1643

‚Üí Blacklane is backed by investors who share our vision: Mercedes-Benz Mobility, Tasaru, Sixt, the Al Fahim Group, Alstin Capital, RI Digital Ventures, and b2venture

Show more

Title: Intern, Data Labeler (Arabic Speaker) - (Global Discovery, Consumer)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an Intern, Data Labeler (Arabic Speaker) to join the Discovery team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

At the center of our marketplace is the Discovery organization. This team is currently building Search, Recommendation, and intent collection systems to power our brands like Foodpanda, Glovo, Pedidos Ya, Talabat - serving millions of requests every day. The systems we build are critical for our online marketplaces with high availability and performance requirements and drive meaningful commercial value. They require crafting control loops through data, machine learning, and online serving systems to serve millions of consumers worldwide.

In this role you will


Accurately label and annotate various types of data, including images, text, audio, and video.
Helping us in maintaining data quality and consistency, which directly impacts users' search experience, by adhering to established guidelines.
Collaborate with the team to identify and resolve labeling discrepancies.
Provide feedback on labeling guidelines and suggest improvements.


Qualifications


Currently doing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field: Business/Finance/Accounting/Engineering or recently graduated.
Ability to deal with lots of data resources and documents
Fluency in spoken and written English & Arabic.
Availability of 20 hours per week for 6 months.


Nice to have:


interest in machine learning concepts.
Experience with specific data labeling tools.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Consumer product tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by leveraging data to provide actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Singapore and Berlin, working closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise. This particular role is based in Berlin.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Experimentation: Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests with a strong emphasis on statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation and accurate impact measurement. A deep understanding of statistical techniques is required for all our experiment analyses.
Product OKRs & Metrics: Define what 'good' looks like by setting up a product metric framework and quarterly OKRs.
Tracking & QA: Own the tracking definition and work with various delivery hero brands to improve the reliability of user behaviour tracking for our discovery tools
ETL & Reporting: Building data pipelines and self-service dashboards.
Exploratory Analysis: Drawing insights from data to drive product strategy & roadmap.
Contribute to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge shares, workflow optimisations, hiring, onboarding of talent etc


Qualifications


7+ years experience in the analytics space in rapidly growing and dynamic environments, ideally with a broad mission scope or several stakeholders
Strong experience in leveraging SQL for analytics (BigQuery experience is a plus)
Proficient with at least one data visualization tool, including but not limited to looker studio (data studio), Tableau, Qlikview, power BI, matplotlib etc.
Experience working with large scale user data (transactional, click stream etc.)
Background in statistics, knowledge about statistical test design and analysis preferably hands on experience in designing and running A/B tests at scale
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
Experience of working with multiple stakeholders, ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to them and successfully driving mid scale analytics projects end to end (e.g. establishing a performance metric for a squad - exploring, aligning on metric definition, creating data pipelines and dashboard visualization to allow self serve).


Nice to have:


Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT
Experience or knowledge of machine learning, recommender system, ranking algorithm.
Experience working in a rapidly growing and dynamic product development team


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by leveraging data to provide actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Singapore and Berlin, working closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise. This particular role is based in Berlin.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:

  • Experimentation: Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests with a strong emphasis on statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation and accurate impact measurement. A deep understanding of statistical techniques is required for all our experiment analyses.
  • Product OKRs & Metrics: Define what 'good' looks like by setting up a product metric framework and quarterly OKRs.
  • Tracking & QA: Own the tracking definition and work with various delivery hero brands to improve the reliability of user behaviour tracking for our discovery tools
  • ETL & Reporting: Building data pipelines and self-service dashboards.
  • Exploratory Analysis: Drawing insights from data to drive product strategy & roadmap.
  • Contribute to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge shares, workflow optimisations, hiring, onboarding of talent etc

Qualifications

  • 7+ years experience in the analytics space in rapidly growing and dynamic environments, ideally with a broad mission scope or several stakeholders
  • Strong experience in leveraging SQL for analytics (BigQuery experience is a plus)
  • Proficient with at least one data visualization tool, including but not limited to looker studio (data studio), Tableau, Qlikview, power BI, matplotlib etc.
  • Experience working with large scale user data (transactional, click stream etc.)
  • Background in statistics, knowledge about statistical test design and analysis preferably hands on experience in designing and running A/B tests at scale
  • Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
  • Experience of working with multiple stakeholders, ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to them and successfully driving mid scale analytics projects end to end (e.g. establishing a performance metric for a squad - exploring, aligning on metric definition, creating data pipelines and dashboard visualization to allow self serve).

Nice to have:

  • Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT
  • Experience or knowledge of machine learning, recommender system, ranking algorithm.
  • Experience working in a rapidly growing and dynamic product development team

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer) to join the Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-10 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalogue for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs


Qualifications


4+ years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for Internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject, (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL and Python skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Experience with data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus) and version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects; proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes. Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Nice to have: Experience with Airflow, experience with A/B testings and applied statistics and experience with using data lakes/data marts


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Title: Data Analyst / Datenmanager (m/w/d) im Bereich Erstattungsprozesse
Description:
Wer wir sind ‚Äì Sicherheit f√ºr Reisende, Stabilit√§t f√ºr die Reisebranche

Der Deutsche Reisesicherungsfonds (DRSF) wurde 2021 gegr√ºndet, um Pauschalreisende vor den finanziellen Folgen einer Insolvenz ihres Reiseveranstalters zu sch√ºtzen und gleichzeitig die Stabilit√§t und das Vertrauen in die Reisebranche zu sichern, indem wir Marktteilnehmer entlasten, gesetzliche Vorgaben erf√ºllen und ein effizientes Krisenmanagement im Insolvenzfall gew√§hrleisten.

Unsere Mission: Sicherstellen, dass im Falle einer Insolvenz eines Reiseanbieters Urlauber ihr Geld zur√ºckerhalten und sicher nach Hause kommen.

Aufgaben

Du verantwortest die Datenqualit√§t, steuerst ETL-Prozesse, entwickelst aussagekr√§ftige Reports und unterst√ºtzt datenbasierte Entscheidungen ‚Äì an der Schnittstelle von Datenmanagement, Reporting und Prozessoptimierung in einem Umfeld mit hoher gesellschaftlicher Relevanz.

Deine Mission


Du pflegst, strukturierst und analysierst Stamm-, Zahlungs- und Buchungsdaten in enger Abstimmung mit IT und Fachbereichen.
Du entwickelst, optimierst und dokumentierst ETL-Prozesse zur strukturierten Datenintegration aus unterschiedlichen Quellsystemen.
Du √ºberwachst Datenfl√ºsse und Schnittstellen (z.‚ÄØB. ERP-, Buchungs- oder CRM-Systeme) und definierst Anforderungen an Datenprozesse.
Du erstellst Dashboards, KPIs und automatisierte Reports mit Power BI, Excel, SQL oder Python ‚Äì verst√§ndlich und adressatengerecht.
Du sicherst Datenqualit√§t, Konsistenz und Nachvollziehbarkeit und entwickelst Standards weiter ‚Äì auch mit Blick auf Data Governance.
Du begleitest datengetriebene Prozessverbesserungen und gestaltest die Grundlage f√ºr strategische Entscheidungen


Profil


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Datenmanagement, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber mehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst, Datenmanager oder Reporting Specialist ‚Äì idealerweise im Finanz- oder Prozessumfeld.
Du arbeitest sicher mit Power BI, Excel und hast fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL oder Python.
Du hast Erfahrung mit ETL-Strecken, Datenintegration und Datenmodellierung ‚Äì auch in komplexen Systemlandschaften.
Du denkst analytisch, dokumentierst strukturiert und verstehst es, Daten verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten und zu visualisieren.
Du bringst idealerweise Kenntnisse in agilen Methoden (Scrum, Kanban) oder Prozessmodellierung mit.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie gute Englischkenntnisse


Pers√∂nlich √úberzeugst Du Mit


Deiner sorgf√§ltigen, eigenverantwortlichen und strukturierten Arbeitsweise.
Deiner F√§higkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verst√§ndlich zu analysieren, zu kommunizieren und L√∂sungen abzuleiten.
Deinem analytischen Blick, deinem Organisationsgeschick und deinem Wunsch, Daten wirklich nutzbar zu machen.
Deiner Offenheit f√ºr interdisziplin√§re Zusammenarbeit ‚Äì mit IT, Fachbereichen und externen Partnern.
Deiner Verl√§sslichkeit und deinem Qualit√§tsanspruch ‚Äì in Daten wie im Ergebnis.


Wir bieten


Bei uns findest du mehr als nur einen Job ‚Äì du √ºbernimmst Verantwortung in einem engagierten Team.
Ein stabiler Arbeitsplatz mit langfristigen Perspektiven
Neben einem wettbewerbsf√§higen Gehalt bieten wir auch umfangreiche Sozialleistungen.
Ob Homeoffice, flexible Arbeitszeiten oder individuelle L√∂sungen - wir wissen, dass Beruf und Privatleben vereinbar sein muss.
Deine Ideen z√§hlen ‚Äì wir f√∂rdern Eigeninitiative, Weiterentwicklung und ein respektvolles Miteinander auf Augenh√∂he.

Dann bewirb dich hier!

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Product) | AI-Powered Learning | Berlin (Onsite)

Join One of Europe‚Äôs Fastest-Growing EdTech Scaleups




We're on a mission to build the #1 AI learning companion for 1 billion students globally.

Founded by students in 2020, this fast-growing EdTech startup is redefining how young people learn‚Äîusing AI to create truly personalized, engaging learning experiences. Already trusted by millions of students weekly, the company recently raised ‚Ç¨27M in Europe‚Äôs largest EdTech funding round in the past three years.




With a world-class team and a bold vision, they're building something generational‚Äîand this is your chance to be part of it.




Your Mission: Use Data to Shape the Future of Learning

As a Product Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the core of how this company builds world-class AI learning experiences. Your insights will guide what gets built, how it gets built, and why it matters.




What You'll Own

Partner with Product & Leadership to embed data into every product decision
Lead deep-dive analyses that shape personalization, feature design, and strategy
Build tools and dashboards that enable every team to move faster and smarter
Own the reliability and scalability of the data stack (BigQuery, dbt)
Ensure marketing and growth teams have clean, actionable data
Proactively monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines




Your Background

Experience in data, BI, or product analytics (startup or fast-paced environment a big plus)
Strong SQL and BI tool knowledge; Python a bonus
Familiarity with modern data stacks (e.g., dbt, BigQuery)
Clear communicator with strong critical thinking skills
Fluent in English (German a bonus)
Available to work onsite in Berlin (5 days/week with flexibility)




Why Join?

Shape a category-defining AI product that impacts students around the world
Join a mission-driven team of 60+ high-calibre builders
Be part of one of Europe‚Äôs most exciting AI startups
Work in an environment where data is at the heart of everything

Title: Intern, Data Labeler (Spanish Speaker) - (Global Discovery, Consumer)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an Intern, Data Labeler (Spanish Speaker) to join the Discovery team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

At the center of our marketplace is the Discovery organization. This team is currently building Search, Recommendation, and intent collection systems to power our brands like Foodpanda, Glovo, Pedidos Ya, Talabat - serving millions of requests every day. The systems we build are critical for our online marketplaces with high availability and performance requirements and drive meaningful commercial value. They require crafting control loops through data, machine learning, and online serving systems to serve millions of consumers worldwide.

In this role you will


Accurately label and annotate various types of data, including images, text, audio, and video.
Helping us in maintaining data quality and consistency, which directly impacts users' search experience, by adhering to established guidelines.
Collaborate with the team to identify and resolve labeling discrepancies.
Provide feedback on labeling guidelines and suggest improvements.


Qualifications


Currently doing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field: Business/Finance/Accounting/Engineering or recently graduated.
Ability to deal with lots of data resources and documents
Fluency in spoken and written English & Spanish
Availability of 20 hours per week for 6 months.


Nice to have:


interest in machine learning concepts.
Experience with specific data labeling tools.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: For Life Produktions- und Vertriebsgesellschaft f√ºr Heil- und Hilfsmittel mbH
Description:
We are FORLIFE! We are passionate about developing, manufacturing, and distributing stoma, incontinence, and wound care products, as well as supportive products for enteral nutrition. Our ambitious goals have helped us become one of the leading suppliers of medical devices in Europe. At our modern production site in Berlin-Adlershof, over 150 employees work to identify and meet the needs of patients and healthcare professionals.




Your Tasks:

Direct to Consumer(DtC) project support: Contribute to the development and execution of our DtC initiative ‚Äî including setup, insights on consumer behavior, and performance tracking
CRM data cleansing & consistency: Ensure high-quality customer and device data by identifying and resolving duplicates or gaps in our CRM system
Customer segmentation & analysis: Deliver targeted segmentation and behavioral insights to support commercial, marketing, and clinical strategy
Master data quality assurance: Maintain and improve product and customer master data across internal systems, hospitals, and patient portals
Dashboard & report creation: Build intuitive dashboards (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making with relevant KPIs, trends, and user metrics
Process improvement: Collaborate with Sales, R&D, and Support to optimize CRM workflows and ensure data governance and compliance
Go-to data resource: Serve as the central contact point for business stakeholders who need analysis, reporting, and structured data support
Support strategic and clinical initiatives: Provide data and insights for product launches, service evaluations, compliance reporting, and patient-focused initiatives




Your Profile:

2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally in healthcare, pharma, or another regulated industry
Proven ability to manage projects and drive deliverables independently across multiple functions
Strong stakeholder management skills ‚Äî able to collaborate with commercial, clinical, technical, and leadership teams
Hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, SAP, Dynamics, or similar)
Strong skills in Power BI, Excel, SQL, and Python
Experience or interest in DtC analytics, customer behavior, or e-commerce tracking
Interest in AI tools such as Microsoft Fabric ‚Äî Microsoft‚Äôs unified platform for analytics and BI
Strong analytical mindset and confident communicator
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related field
Being Fluent in English is a must, German a plus




Our Benefits:

Meaningful work ‚Äì Your work contributes to the reliable manufacture and use of vital medical devices.
Great team: A motivated and helpful environment that supports you.
Company pension plan with a 20% employer contribution for a secure future.
Special payments in accordance with the company agreement.
Individual training opportunities to promote your professional and personal development.
Business bike leasing for environmentally friendly and healthy mobility
Regular team events to promote strong and collegial cooperation
Mobility or sports subsidy: Choice of subsidy for BVG ticket or Urban Sports Club

Teil des Traineeprogramms werden z.B. fachliche und technologische Trainings, Schulungen und Arbeitsmethoden sein, welche mit einer SAP-Zertifizierung abschlie√üen.

Beratungsfunktion¬†‚Äì Wir beraten unsere Kunden in den Themen rund um SAP Business and Analytics, SAP Business Intelligence, SAP S/4HANA (Embedded Analytics) und SAP HANA Cloud.

¬†

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics Customer, Seamless)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an experienced Product Analyst to join the Customer Product Line, Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. The role is for Seamless domain in the Customer Product Line. In the Seamless Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, work closely with the product, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-7 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and Backend Engineers and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests


In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

Qualifications


2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
Good English communication skills
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Was erwartet dich bei uns als Marketing Data Analyst? Axel Springer Corporate Solutions ist die Agentur-Unit von Europas f√ºhrendem digitalen Medienhaus. Wir verbinden die Geschwindigkeit und Kreativit√§t einer Agentur mit der Sicherheit und Innovationskraft eines gro√üen Medienunternehmens.

Mit Ideen, die bewegen, bringen wir unsere Kunden voran ‚Äì in externer und interner Kommunikation, Content Marketing und Consulting. Wir helfen namhaften Auftraggebern wie Bosch, BASF, Lufthansa, Deichmann, CLAAS und vielen mehr, ihre Zielgruppen mit dem passenden Content zu erreichen.

Wir glauben an die Zukunft von Journalismus als Gesch√§ftsmodell und investieren in zukunftsweisende Technologien. Unsere f√ºnf Essentials sind die Werte, die uns verbinden, und unser Kompass bei unserem Engagement f√ºr die Freiheit.

Was du bei uns bewegst:



verwende Analysetools, um Einblicke in Zielgruppen, Inhalte, Marken, Kommunikationskan√§le und Branchen zu bekommen ‚Äì f√ºr die Entwicklung von Contentstrategien und f√ºr die laufende Verbesserung unserer Projekte
arbeite an Markt-Media-Studien (AWA, b4p,‚Ä¶), Social-Listening-Tools (Talkwalker), Google Analytics etc. mit, um Daten zu ziehen, diese aufzubereiten und zu interpretieren
du entwickelst und pflegst Berichte und Dashboards, einschlie√ülich Automatisierung
bearbeite Ad-hoc-Anfragen nach brauchbaren Daten, visualisiere Ergebnisse und erstelle Handlungsempfehlungen
