Du wirst Teil unseres Entwicklungs-Teams und unterst√ºtzt uns dabei, neue Datenquellen zu erschlie√üen, unsere Datenmodelle und Pipelines weiterzuentwickeln sowie komplexe Nachhaltigkeitsthemen zu recherchieren. Deine Vielseitigkeit ist gefragt: Du findest neue Datenquellen, bindest sie an, optimierst bestehende Prozesse und hilfst dabei, datenbasierte Erkenntnisse klar und verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten ‚Äì sei es f√ºr unsere Produkte, technische Dokumentationen oder f√ºr Kundenprojekte. Du arbeitest mit SQL, Python (oder R) und bringst ein gutes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr Datenarchitekturen und Automatisierung mit. Und was du davon noch nicht kannst ‚Äì lernst du bei uns schnell.


Aufgaben

  • Vielfaltige Aufgaben, die Dich nicht auf eine Deiner F√§higkeiten beschr√§nken, sondern wo Du von den Ingenieursfragen der Energieeffizienz √ºber die √ñkonometrie des Welthandels bis ins datenwissenschaftliche Data Crunching eintauchst.

  • Gestaltungsspielraum in einem jungen Unternehmen, das Deine Perspektive sch√§tzt

  • Belastbare Nachhaltigkeitsexpertise ‚Äì Du willst helfen anhand echter Daten Unternehmen Richtung net-zero zu f√ºhren.

  • Kund:innen, die wirklich einen Unterschied machen, weil sie einen gro√üen Hebel haben, CO2 zu sparen ‚Äì wie z.B. Siemens, Bosch, Bayer, EY und Capgemini


Qualifikation

  • Berufseinsteiger:innen oder junge Berufst√§tige mit maximal einem Jahr Berufserfahrung

  • Generalist:innen, die Freude daran haben, sich vielf√§tig einzubringen.

  • Die F√§higkeit, bestehende Datenarchitekturen weiterzuentwickeln und neue Datenpipelines aufzubauen.

  • Lust sich innerhalb kurzer Zeit in ESG-Themen einzuarbeiten, relevante datenbasierte Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und diese verst√§ndlich sowie visuell ansprechend aufzubereiten.

  • Studium im MINT Bereich.

  • Erste Erfahrungen mit SQL und R oder Python ‚Äì Kenntnisse in git sind hilfreich. Wichtig ist vor allem ein sicherer Umgang mit Daten.

  • Akribie - sowohl bei der Entwicklung von L√∂sungen als auch in der Dokumentation f√ºrs Team.

  • Interesse an unternehmerischen Umweltbelastungen und Sozialrisiken.

  • Die Bereitschaft Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen und den Drang Themen und Projekte auch eigenst√§ndig umzusetzen.

  • Deutschkenntnisse auf B1- Niveau


Gestalte gemeinsam mit uns ctrl+s!


Wir suche ab sofort und freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung bis zum 25.08.2025. unter Nennung Deiner Gehaltserwartung und fr√ºhestm√∂glichem Startdatum.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Platforms (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

The Senior Data Analyst position is a position within our broader International Data Science organization. The Data Science team is a diverse and talented group of individuals with strong expertise in discovering and understanding customer needs, making data-driven decisions within an ambiguous problem space, and rapidly prototyping and iterating on data products.

Building on 10 years of experience in the US, Flatiron‚Äôs international team is scaling Flatiron‚Äôs approach in new countries. Streamlined teams in each market are establishing partnerships with local cancer providers, and developing high-quality real-world data for researchers around the world. Data Scientists and Data Analysts are embedded on those teams and their work touches every aspect of Flatiron‚Äôs international product and strategy. This position specifically will be embedded on one of our Data Platforms teams which is focussed on developing tooling for curating unstructured data.

Specifically, you‚Äôll:



Collaborate with cross-functional partners to track metrics and support decision-making for clinical data processing operations
Build dashboards for internal use cases; support users by conducting ad-hoc analyses and taking action on user feedback.
Conduct analyses to provide insight into user behavior for our internal tools to help inform product decisions.
Immerse yourself in business and technical context to help your team identify opportunities for optimizing our processes and unlocking new value from our unique datasets.



Who You Are

You're a kind, collaborative and analytic problem solver and value the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition,



You have 3+ years of industry experience in relevant roles or have completed a PhD in a relevant field.
You‚Äôre impact-oriented, and care deeply about creating real change for customers, users, and ultimately patients. You choose the right, rather than the flashiest, method available to reach your goals.
You have a strong background in analytics and can fit the appropriate analysis approach to complex business or research problems.
You are a clear and confident communicator who can explain technical concepts to business and clinical partners.
You are versatile and can easily pick up new programming languages and tools, but come with strong experience in Python.
You have a record of success driving initiatives forward by generating buy-in, managing complexity, and continuously delivering business impact.
You are proficient in English.



Optional



You have experience working with healthcare-related data.



Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.

Title: Visiting Founders Associate - Excel Power User
Description:
We (Jan, Fernando & Claire) are building kontext21 as the Berlin tech startup we always wanted: fast moving, best idea wins, bold & fearless, massive learning environment, challenging.




kontext21 is building the infrastructure for contextual intelligence. Our SDK lets developers access what users see and do ‚Äî enabling deeply personalized, AI-powered software. Now we‚Äôre building our own apps on top of it to show what‚Äôs possible.




Our bold vision is backed by some great Investors: Antler, VR Ventures and Angels.


Tasks



Work directly with the founders on validating our first product for Excel power users


Build and test AI-powered features that supercharge Excel ‚Äî turning spreadsheets into intelligent assistants


Become the ‚Äúvoice of the spreadsheet user‚Äù in product and design conversations


Research real-world use cases and help shape product features from the ground up


Be part of early outreach: talk to users, design experiments, analyze workflows


Launch your own side-project or automation, codenamed ‚ÄúExcel‚Äù, powered by our SDK ‚Äî a ‚Äústartup within‚Äù


Bonus: use your Excel skills to hack internal ops, tracking, and dashboards



Requirements



You have used Excel for 20+ hours per week ‚Äî professionally or obsessively


You can build and debug complex formulas or have built complex financial models or other analytical models before


Bonus: experience with Power Query, VBA, or Google Sheets scripting


Passion for tech startups and excitement to be at the earliest stage


Sharp analytical thinking and a relentless drive to make things better


You love to ship, test, learn, and iterate ‚Äî not sit on ideas





Why you shouldn't join:





You are not comfortable working without a clear structure.


You have >3 years of experience and look for that to be reflected in the pay. Our budget can not support that.


You are not ready for a career opportunity with risks. Despite our growth, we are still an early-stage startup. If you need something more predictable, this is not the right fit.



Benefits



Flexible working hours


Sport membership


Learn from us. Check out our profiles, we are experienced founders and happy to teach.





Come as you are, let's build together.

Title: Junior or Senior Power BI Analyst
Description:
Sustainability that means business

What We Do

Our innovative SaaS solutions increase efficiency and boost sustainability in resource-intensive industries. Over 5,000 customers across 23 countries already benefit from our Performance Sustainability software, ensuring we deliver practical solutions for improved profitability and environmental resilience across the globe.

Who We Are

Sustainability software specialist, AMCS, is headquartered in Ireland, with offices in Europe, USA, Canada and Australasia. With over 1,300 highly-skilled employees across 22 countries, we specialize in delivering technology solutions to facilitate a carbon neutral future.

Our people

AMCS offers team members more than just a job, but an opportunity to map out a career with a company that is growing, evolving and setting out new ways of working that are having a positive impact on the world around us. AMCS was established in Ireland and holds onto those local roots and ‚Äòstart-up‚Äô mentality with a culture of connection. Connection to our work, our customers, our colleagues and our community that creates a working environment that fosters openness, collaboration and creativity.

We are seeking a skilled Junior or Senior Power BI Analyst to join our Analytics team, with a particular focus on Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing dashboards that help our customers leverage data-driven insights for optimization and decision-making in EHS and ESG areas. You will collaborate closely with customer stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and deliver actionable insights through data visualization.

Key Responsibilities


Managing projects with customers.
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Apache Superset or Power BI focused on EHS and ESG performance metrics.
Collaborate with the customer¬¥s EHS and ESG teams to gather requirements and understand specific data needs for compliance, reporting, and sustainability initiatives.
Work with our ESG & EHS data models to create dashboards customized for our customers in Apache Superset or Power BI.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across all reports and dashboards, particularly in relation to EHS compliance and ESG disclosures.
Train and support end-users in the use of our Analytics solutions
Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in business intelligence technologies, especially those related to EHS and ESG reporting.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Environmental Science, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, Business Administration or a related educational training or experience from another context.
Junior: first experience in an internship or as a working student in a data analysis or reporting role in customer contact with specific experience using Power BI.


OR


Senior: 2+ years of experience in a data analysis or reporting role with customer interaction including project management. Specific experience using in Apache Superset and Power BI are a plus.
Experience in data modelling, DAX language and Power Query.
Strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis and visualization.
Junior: Basic understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.


OR


Senior: Proficient understanding of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with databases (SQL Server, Maria DB etc.) and data warehousing concepts.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.


Desirable Qualifications


Knowledge of Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics and related reporting requirements. (e.g., GRI, SASB, TCFD).
Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques.
Experience with other BI tools (Apache Superset, Sisense, etc.)

Our innovative SaaS solutions increase efficiency and boost sustainability in resource-intensive industries. Who We Are

Our people

Title: Data & AI Consultant (m/f/d)
Description:
Brief description

Dataciders, a dynamically growing group of companies in the upper midmarket, is a leading service provider in the IT service environment with a focus on data and AI in German-speaking countries. Our success is confirmed by our 1st place in the renowned L√ºnendonk list for data & analytics services.

We are characterized by our flexibility and enthusiasm for technological trends and innovations. We live change and shape the future.

At ixto, you will work in an interdisciplinary team from IT, economics, data science and other exciting disciplines - united by a passion for turning ideas into real solutions. You will not only be given room for your expertise, but also the freedom to actively shape our projects, processes and culture. Innovation is not a department for us - it is our everyday life.

What you can expect in your new job


Projects in state-of-the-art data & AI technologies
Challenges along the entire data value chain: from the cloud platform to the data loading route to the BI report and ML model
Varied activities between customer workshops and coding sessions
Exciting customers in the DACH region from a wide range of industries


Your profile


You have a high ability to learn and enthusiasm for current developments in the field of data & AI
You are self-confident and customer-oriented - both in workshops and in long-term customer projects
You have experience with current AI/ML technologies such as OpenAI's GPT models, Microsoft Azure AI Foundry or Databricks Mosaic AI
You have experience in current data technologies such as Microsoft Fabric or Databricks
You are proficient in Python; we would like to see knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. Java, C#, TypeScript)
Ideally, you have experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP
You are characterized by strong communication skills, ability to work in a team and willingness to travel
You are proficient in German (C1) and English (C1)


What we offer you

We are a leading provider of customized data solutions that form the basis for important decisions for our customers. Join us in designing projects that work!


A well-coordinated team of inquisitive talents and experienced consultants
A working environment that promotes personal responsibility, trust and real participation
Personal development with learning time budgets and knowledge transfer within the team
Regular team and sports events - from online lunches to annual retreats
Projects with real added value: our solutions create transparency and decision-making security for our customers
flexible working hours
Further training
modern hardware
Extensive sports & wellness flat rate via leading company fitness providers
Support for your mental fitness via OpenUp, a strong offer for mental health and resilience promotion
Fruit and drinks in the office


We are looking forward to your application!

Have we piqued your interest? Then apply now!

Take your chance and send your complete application with CV, cover letter and references, stating your salary expectations and availability, as a PDF document.

You are also welcome to send an e-mail to: jobs@dataciders.com

Title: Analytics Consultant | DACH
Description:
At Biztory, we empower businesses to become truly data-driven. As one of Europe's leading data consultancies, we help our clients design, build, and scale modern data stacks that deliver actionable insights faster. Now, we're looking for an Analytics Engineer to help us shape the future of data self-service and modeling across the DACH region.

Your Mission

As an Analytics Consultant at Biztory, you'll guide clients through their data journey‚Äîfrom insight generation to impactful decision-making. You'll use your expertise in Tableau and the Salesforce ecosystem to craft dashboards that tell meaningful stories and help businesses take action. You'll work closely with stakeholders to translate business questions into clear, visual answers.

If you enjoy blending technical skills with business understanding, this role is for you.

What You'll Do


Design and build impactful dashboards using Tableau Software
Connect data sources, including Salesforce (Marketing Cloud and beyond), to uncover actionable insights
Work directly with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into tailored analytical solutions
Apply data modeling techniques to support effective self-service analytics
Lead workshops and enablement sessions to empower end users
Collaborate with cross-functional Biztory teams across Europe
Travel as needed to support client engagements within the DACH region


Requirements

What You Bring


3+ years of hands-on experience with Tableau in a professional setting
Solid understanding of the Salesforce ecosystem
Strong data modeling capabilities and experience working with business stakeholders
Excellent communication and storytelling skills - you're comfortable interfacing with both technical and business stakeholders
Fluent in German and English, additional languages are a plus
Based in DACH, preferably around D√ºsseldorf, Cologne, or Berlin, and ready to travel


Nice to Have


Prior consulting experience or other customer-facing roles
Experience with other BI tools
Interest in team leadership or mentoring


Benefits

Why Join Biztory?

We're not your typical consultancy. At Biztory, you'll:


Work with modern tools and industry-leading partners
Be part of an international, collaborative, and ambitious team
Have opportunities for career growth, including in AI and leadership tracks
Home set-up with laptop, screen, docking station, headset, keyboard, and mouse
Multiple team events and get-togethers per year
Company Pension Plan (if desired)
Company car, bike, or train subscription (if desired)
Reimbursement of phone and internet costs
Corporate Benefits Program


Ready to help businesses turn data into insight?

Let's chat.
Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer | DACH
Description:
At Biztory, we empower businesses to become truly data-driven. As one of Europe's leading data consultancies, we help our clients design, build, and scale modern data stacks that deliver actionable insights faster. Now, we're looking for an Analytics Engineer to help us shape the future of data self-service and modeling across the DACH region.

Your Mission

As an Analytics Engineer at Biztory, you'll sit at the intersection of data modeling, engineering, and client enablement. You'll work closely with stakeholders to design intuitive and scalable data models that unlock insights through self-service analytics.

Whether you're collaborating with clients to align on requirements or optimizing data pipelines, your work will directly influence how data is consumed across organizations.

What You'll Do


Design and implement scalable data models
Translate business requirements into data models that support self-service analytics
Build and maintain reliable ETL pipelines and transform raw data into clean datasets
Collaborate with internal teams and client stakeholders to ensure data is usable, trustworthy, and well-documented
Contribute to CI/CD processes
Support clients across the DACH region (travel expected)
Stay up to date with best practices in data modeling, governance, and future-facing tech like AI


Requirements

What You Bring


3+ years of relevant experience in data or analytics engineering
Strong SQL skills and experience with ETL tools
Solid understanding of data warehouse architecture (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, etc.)
Experience with data modeling methodologies - bonus if you know Data Vault
Hands-on experience with dbt (or similar tools)
Familiarity with CI/CD workflows and Git
Excellent communication skills - you're comfortable interfacing with both technical and business stakeholders
Fluent in German and English, additional languages are a plus
Based in DACH, preferably around D√ºsseldorf, Cologne, or Berlin, and ready to travel


Nice to Have


Prior consulting experience
Exposure to AI/ML tools and use cases
Interest in team leadership or mentoring


Benefits

Work with modern tools and industry-leading partners
Be part of an international, collaborative, and ambitious team

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Size & Fit (all genders)
Description:
At Zalando, we believe that an article that doesn‚Äôt fit well is the wrong article for our customers. As a Senior Data Analyst in the Size & Fit team, you will play a key role in addressing the challenge of finding the right fit in online shopping. Our mission involves gaining a deep understanding of customers‚Äô preferences related to size and fit, as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the assortment attributes and measurements from our brands. The real magic happens when we successfully match both.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Engineering and Applied Science team and act as a bridge to Product, Business. You will measure and analyze how the solutions we provide to our customers are impacting our business, and your insights will enable strategic commercial decisions at Zalando. Would you like to bring in your skills to shape a great experience for millions of customers when buying clothes online?

About Size & Fit

At Zalando, we deeply understand that Size Matters . We are excited to use our unique and large article and customer datasets to tackle this challenge using ML and Computer Vision techniques.

You will join our multidisciplinary Zurich & Berlin-based Size and Fit Team, composed of Machine Learning Researchers, Software Engineers, Designers, Product and Business Managers from 30+ different nationalities. We provide advice on customer size and fit choices and conduct focused experiments using emerging technologies to solve the challenges.

You will take on this complex and important topic working side by side with our Product Specialists and Applied Scientists. We have great problems to solve, a huge customer base to impact, and we are a team that loves to have fun. 'Size and Fit' is a human topic. We use machines to help solve our customers‚Äô challenges. But we never forget‚Äîsize and fit success is defined by how customers feel when they wear fashion.


WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Bring your business data-driven analytical approach to the Size & Fit Team; you generate hypotheses and try to test them by performing descriptive, exploratory and quantitative analyses. You can translate metrics from algorithmic and data products into actionable business insights. You know when a hypothesis can only be tested by an experiment, and you can help create and drive them.
You are the connector between the Engineering team and the Product team. You can translate the Size and Fit benefits to answer complex business questions and identify and measure commercial opportunities.
Be a reliable partner for the Size & Fit Team when related to commercial reporting and analytics, and support the Team with more complex analysis.
Avoid working in silos by collaborating with cross-functional leaders from Engineering, Applied Science, Product, Content and Customer Analytics to drive innovation. You incorporate data from different sources within and outside of Zalando to drive projects.




WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You have a proven track record of 5+ experience as a Data Analyst or sim ilar role. A university degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative social science, or a comparable subject.
Strong technical background with advanced SQL skills and programming background, including, but not limited to, Python, Spark, and Google Big Query. Excellent knowledge in coding for data retrieval, processing, exploration and analysis. Constant drive and tenacity to learn new techniques and tools are a must.
Understanding of the economics of online platforms and/or online fashion retailers, as well as the commercial KPIs governing their success.
Strong communication to convince technical and non-technical audiences with the insights you generate and compelling data-driven storytelling that enables decision-making.
Enjoy working cross-functionally; you have great stakeholder management skills to work with different levels of management to support, challenge, and bring solutions.
Hands-on mentality, a person who always finds solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes, and always remain focused on our quality objectives.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description:
Unsere Features


Bombastisch & bezaubernd: das IT-Team, das gemeinsam mit dir spannende Missionen antreten m√∂chte
Abwechslungsreich & vielversprechend: die Zukunft der Dussmann Group, die wir mit dir gestalten werden
Vertrauensvoll & flexibel: deine Arbeitszeiten
Sehenswert & reizvoll: dein Desksharing-Arbeitsplatz in der Friedrichstra√üe sowie inklusive 25% Rabatt auf alle deine Eink√§ufe im Dussmann KulturKaufhaus
Sicher & unbefristet: dein Arbeitsvertrag in einem krisenfesten Konzern
Langfristig & nachhaltig: deine Fort- und Weiterbildungsoptionen z.B. auf unserem Campus in Zeuthen
Gr√ºn & gesund: deine verg√ºnstigte Mittagspause in unserem PLANET!BASED-Restaurant im Untergeschoss
Sensationell & am√ºsant: unsere Mitarbeiterevents wie Stammtisch, After-Work, Sommer- und Weihnachtsfeste, Teamfr√ºhst√ºck etc.
Attraktiv & lukrativ: deine Verg√ºtung


Deine Mission

Du musst kein Superheld sein, um Gro√ües zu bewirken. In der Welt der Daten reicht oft ein klarer Kopf, ein gutes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr komplexe Zusammenh√§nge - und ein bisschen Freude am Coden. Wenn du gerne Strukturen schaffst, wo andere nur Daten sehen, und du dich in modernen Cloud-Technologien genauso wohlf√ºhlst wie im Austausch mit Kolleg:innen aus verschiedenen Bereichen, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig. Wir suchen jemanden, der mit technischem Know-how, Teamgeist und einem Blick f√ºrs Wesentliche unsere Datenplattform weiterentwickelt - und dabei vielleicht sogar ein bisschen Spa√ü hat.


Du baust Datentransformationsstrecken, die nicht nur funktionieren, sondern auch bei Nacht deployt werden k√∂nnen, ohne dass du schwei√ügebadet aufwachst - mit Tools wie Azure Databricks, Apache Airflow oder Azure Data Factory.
Du unterst√ºtzt F√ºhrungskr√§fte, indem du technische Klarheit schaffst - und manchmal auch emotionale Stabilit√§t, wenn das Deployment mal wieder zickt.
Du modellierst Daten, als w√§ren sie Lego-Steine: strukturiert, durchdacht und mit dem gewissen ‚ÄûKlick‚Äú.
Du f√ºhrst Deployments durch, dokumentierst gewissenhaft und sorgst daf√ºr, dass deine Datenqualit√§t nicht nur ‚Äûokay‚Äú, sondern ‚Äûwow‚Äú ist.
Du bist Ansprechpartner:in f√ºr System Owner - also der Mensch, der komplexe Anforderungen in verst√§ndliche L√∂sungen √ºbersetzt (und dabei nicht die Geduld verliert).
Du arbeitest mit dem AI Lab zusammen, wo du daf√ºr sorgst, dass aus fancy Algorithmen auch tats√§chlich funktionierende Produkte werden.
Du kooperierst mit BI Engineers, damit Dashboards nicht nur h√ºbsch aussehen, sondern auch die Wahrheit sagen.
Du bringst dich in Projekte ein, diskutierst Datenarchitektur mit Kolleg:innen und hast dabei sogar gelegentlich Spa√ü.
Du arbeitest mit Fachbereichen und IT, als w√§rst du ein diplomatischer Datenbotschafter - mit technischem Tiefgang und einem offenen Ohr.


Deine Skills


Du hast ein Studium in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Statistik oder etwas √§hnlich Nerdigem abgeschlossen - oder dir das Wissen auf anderem Weg draufgeschafft.
Du verstehst Datenmodellierung und Softwarearchitektur - und wei√üt, dass ‚ÄûBig Data‚Äú nicht nur ein Buzzword ist.
Du kennst dich mit Azure aus (Data Factory, Databricks, Data Lake) - oder mit anderen Cloud-Werkzeugen, die mindestens genauso cool sind.
SQL, Python, Spark und GIT sind f√ºr dich keine Fremdw√∂rter, sondern deine t√§glichen Begleiter - fast wie Kaffee.
Du arbeitest selbstst√§ndig, sorgf√§ltig und mit einem Auge f√ºrs Detail - auch wenn‚Äôs mal stressig wird.
Du kannst zwischen Business, IT und deinem Team vermitteln - und bleibst dabei meistens freundlich.
Dein Englisch ist verhandlungssicher - dein Humor optional, aber willkommen

Title: Founders Associate
Description:
Founder Associate ‚Äì AI-first Company

Location: Berlin, Germany (Hybrid)

Salary: ‚Ç¨80-90k




An AI-first company at the intersection of data, technology, and private equity is seeking a Founder Associate to work directly with its leadership team in building, optimising, and scaling the business. Partnering with US-based private equity funds, the company delivers practical, high-impact AI solutions that transform business operations.




This is a unique opportunity for a truly entrepreneurial individual to gain deep, hands-on experience in the AI sector while observing first-hand how a high-growth business is built from the ground up.




Key Responsibilities

Build and optimise core company processes with an AI-first approach (e.g., knowledge management, recruiting, finance, business development)
Research AI tools, strategies, and technologies
Support and lead AI projects for US-based private equity funds
Prepare tailored sales pitches and business development materials for PE clients
Develop functional prototypes using no-code AI tools




Candidate Profile

Minimum of 2 years‚Äô experience in a high-growth scale-up (Series A+) or top-tier management consulting
Aspiration to pursue an entrepreneurial career in the future
Strong passion for data, technology, and artificial intelligence
Hands-on, pragmatic, and results-focused approach
Ability to adapt quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Highly structured and an excellent communicator




Benefits and Opportunities

Direct collaboration with the founders and exposure to scaling a successful business
First-hand insight into how AI is shaping the future of work
Access to the US private equity market through high-impact projects
Opportunity to join a small but fast-growing company, with plans to expand from 10 to 30 team members within the next year
Experience working in an AI-first environment with practical applications

Wir sind alle verschieden und gerade deshalb ein tolles Team! Jeden Tag mit Herz und Hand ‚Äì gemeinsam f√ºr unsere Kund:innen, Patient:innen und Kolleg:innen.

F√ºr unseren Gesch√§ftsbereich Prozess-, Projekt- und Servicesteuerung suchen wir ab sofort einen engagierten Datenanalyst/in unbefristeter Anstellung mit einer w√∂chentlichen Arbeitszeit von durchschnittlich 39 Stunden.

Prozessarchitektur: Sie begleiten Ver√§nderungsprozesse innerhalb der CFM, indem Sie Kolleg:innen einbinden und bei der Umsetzung neuer Prozesse unterst√ºtzen
Datengetriebenes Prozessmanagement: Sie setzen geeignete Kennzahlen zur Messung und Bewertung der Effektivit√§t und Effizienz ein
Stakeholder-Management: Sie kommunizieren mit verschiedenen internen und externen Stakeholdern, um deren Anforderungen und Erwartungen zu verstehen und in die Prozessgestaltung einzubeziehen


Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation, alternativ entsprechende Berufserfahrung in diesem Aufgabenfeld
Erhebliche, einschl√§gige Berufserfahrung (mind. 2 Jahre) im Bereich Datenanalyse, Controlling oder anderen datennahen Bereichen
Idealerweise haben Sie Erfahrung mit Python und/oder BITools, BPMN und/oder Process Mining
Ihr Skill Set umfasst exzellente analytische und konzeptionelle F√§higkeiten
Sehr gute Kommunikations¬≠f√§higkeiten, Durchsetzungs¬≠verm√∂gen, Teamf√§higkeit und eine ausge¬≠pr√§gte Handson-Mentalit√§t
F√§higkeit komplexe Sachverhalte schnell zu erfassen und Stakeholdergerecht aufzubereiten
Selbstst√§ndige, strukturierte, qualit√§ts und l√∂sungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
Sie sind aufgeschlossen gegen√ºber nichttraditionellen Methoden und Ans√§tzen


Einstellungsvoraussetzung: vor Aufnahme der T√§tigkeit - Nachweis der Masernimmunit√§t / Masernschutzimpfungen f√ºr nach 1970 Geborene.

Wir bieten

Sie erwartet ein sicherer, abwechslungsreicher Arbeitsplatz in einem vielseitigen Dienstleistungsunternehmen in Berlin. Neben Kitapl√§tzen, Jobticket, Jobrad, Corporate Benefits, Zusch√ºssen zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge, einer Jahressonderzahlung gestaffelt nach Betriebszugeh√∂rigkeit oder unseren vielf√§ltigen Sportangeboten erwarten Sie weitere interessante Arbeitgeberleistungen. Soweit Arbeitsorganisation, betriebliche Abl√§ufe und die Sicherheit im Betrieb nicht entgegenstehen, wird auch eine Teilzeitbesch√§ftigung in dieser Funktion erm√∂glicht.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Business Analyst (d/m/w) Banking / Data Analytics Personalisierung
Description:
Die Sparkassen Rating und Risikosysteme (SR) ist der zentrale Dienstleister f√ºr Verfahren des Risikomanagements in der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe. Wir unterst√ºtzen die Institute mit Standardl√∂sungen in den Bereichen der Risikomessung und -steuerung, der regulatorischen Banksteuerung sowie im Vertrieb mit Data-Analytics-L√∂sungen. Gemeinsam mit unseren Partnern bieten wir den Instituten, von der Konzeption der Verfahren, √ºber deren Weiterentwicklung, IT-Umsetzung und Umsetzungsunterst√ºtzung, zentrale und standardisierte L√∂sungen an.

Business Analyst (d/m/w) ‚Äì Banking | Data Analytics Personalisierung

ab sofort suchen wir im Fachbereich Data Analytics Kundenansprache

Du treibst Projekte unerm√ºdlich von der Idee bis zur Umsetzung, um den Vertrieb in der Sparkassen Finanzgruppe zu unterst√ºtzen
Du ermittelst Kundenbed√ºrfnisse, gestaltest L√∂sungen und setzt Prototypen um
Du erstellst bankfachliche Kennzahlen, Personas und Kundensegmentierungen f√ºr Kunden aus dem privaten und gewerblichen Gesch√§ftsfeld
Du trainierst Modelle mit einer bestehenden Modell-pipeline und erschlie√üt neue Anwendungsfelder f√ºr Machine Learning
Du strukturierst Deine Arbeit in JIRA und dokumentierst Ergebnisse in Confluence


Das bringst Du mit:
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Informatik, Mathematik, Physik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder durch Berufserfahrung und Fortbildungsma√ünahmen erworbene gleichwertige Kenntnisse
Berufserfahrung im Bankenumfeld, idealerweise im Firmenkundengesch√§ft
Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL, Python und Machine Learning
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift auf C1-Niveau
Ausgepr√§gtes teamorientiertes Handeln mit einem Schuss Humor

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Status: 6 month Fixed Term Contract

Reports to: Global Payroll Manager

Works with: Finance Team

Job Purpose

Finance team: The role is to support the payroll team in managing and improving data quality, reconciliation and reporting during a period of high operational demand. The role is essential for ensuring accurate payroll reporting, supporting the rollout of a Global Payroll Provider and preparing for upcoming compliance requirements.




Principal accountabilities

Data Cleansing & Validation

Clean, structure, and validate large payroll data to ensure accuracy and consistency (both for current operations and during the roll out of the Global Payroll provider).
Identify and correct anomalies in payroll and accounting data
Collaborate with Payroll, HR and Finance teams to ensure data alignment, particularly within the HiBob platform.

Reconciliations

Perform regular reconciliations between payroll records and general ledger accounts.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies in payroll transactions and accounting entries.

Budget & Variance Analysis, Reporting

Assist in preparing payroll-related budget forecasts.
Analyse actual payroll costs against budgeted figures and explain variances.
Provide monthly variance reports with actionable insights.
Maintain year-to-date payroll reports and audit packs.
Support audits and compliance checks with accurate data and documentation.
Respond to ad hoc data requests from senior management and external auditors.
Assist in preparing data and reports for the mandatory payrolling of Benefits in Kind (BiKs) starting April 2026.
Process optimisation - Identify inefficiencies in workflows and streamline payroll processes

UAT Testing ‚Äì Global Payroll Project

Lead testing and reconciliation during parallel runs for the Global Payroll Provider rollout.

Skills And Attributes

Proven experience in data analysis within payroll or finance.
Strong Excel and data manipulation skills; experience with HiBob is a plus.
Familiarity with payroll systems, accounting principles, and compliance requirements.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments.
Experience supporting audits and compliance processes is desirable.
Strong communication and documentation skills.




Essential

Qualifications and experience

Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions (e.g. pivot tables, lookups, data validation).
Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleansing, transformation and validation.
Solid understanding of payroll processes, accounting principles, and financial reconciliations.
Familiarity with HRIS and payroll systems (e.g. HiBob, Moorepay, Papaya, Justworks or similar platforms).
Demonstrated ability to produce clear, accurate and insightful reports for stakeholders.
Experience supporting audits and compliance reporting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred

Experience working within a global or multi-country payroll environment.
Experience participating in system implementations or UAT testing phases.
Ability to document processes and create user-friendly guides




Application Closing Date: 22nd August 2025

Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date.




Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets

The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide.

We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we‚Äôve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we‚Äôve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we‚Äôre trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we‚Äôre expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you‚Äôll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You‚Äôll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do


Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima‚Äôs data-driven culture.
Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.


What We're Looking For


A minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.


Nice to Have


Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance


Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

ü§∏Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

üèÅ Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

üåà Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you‚Äôre a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don‚Äôt meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.
Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let‚Äôs build the future of insurance, together.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

Title: Assistant Skills Data Analyst
Description:
Salary: Circa ¬£25,000 to ¬£35,500 depending on skills, knowledge and experience

Grade: Band 1

Contract type: TfL

Reference: 2007

Contract details: Permanent

Location: Baker Street, will be required to travel across the network on a regular basis

Application closing date: 22 August 2025 at 23:59

Overview Of Role

We are looking for a customer-focused Assistant Skills Data Analyst with a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to managing competence-based training data and systems within the Operations Training and Skills Development (OTSD) team. This role supports the day-to-day operation of learning and licensing systems, helps maintain accurate records, and produces clear and reliable data reports that meet business and legal requirements.

You will work closely with internal teams and stakeholders, helping them understand their data needs, generating dashboards and reports, and ensuring processes are followed and documented correctly.

Accountabilities Include


Supporting the management of competence, learning, and licensing data using established systems and processes.
Triage incoming support requests by managing a shared email inbox, using prioritisation techniques to escalate appropriately within a multi-level support model.
Create and maintain clear and simple Power BI dashboards and reports using data from a single source.
Work with stakeholders to agree reporting needs, especially where users may be unfamiliar with the data available.
Use and maintain systems for staff competence, health, licensing, or other records where the sequence of actions matters.
Keep and create SharePoint pages and maintain lists, ensuring correct permissions and controls are in place to protect personal data (GDPR).
Identify patterns in data, such as trends or outliers, that may require further investigation.
Communicate insights clearly and explain the meaning behind the data to non-technical audiences.
Follow standard processes with precision, flagging when support is needed to maintain data quality and consistency.


Your Skills And Knowledge Should Include


Confident use of Power BI to build reports and dashboards. (Essential)
Solid understanding of Excel and using formulas to manipulate data. (Essential)
Experience using administrative systems to track processes and records (e.g., competence or licensing platforms). (Essential)
Experience updating and managing content and permissions in SharePoint. (Desirable)
Ability to interpret data and communicate findings in a clear and approachable way. (Essential)


Your Experience Should Include


Familiarity with the Microsoft Power Platform (e.g., Power Automate, Power Apps). (Essential)
Exposure to Learning Management Systems (LMS), Competence Management Systems (CMS) or Licencing systems such as Sentinel. (Desirable)


We are looking for


A willingness to learn, operate, and adapt to new systems and processes.
Someone who values accuracy, consistency, and clarity.
A strong communicator who can support others in understanding their data and reporting needs.


Application Process


Please apply using your CV
Think carefully about the skills, knowledge and experience in the advert and cover this in your CV
PDF format preferred and do not include any photographs or images
You might be invited to a pre-screening interview or to answer some questions prior to an interview.


Equality, diversity and inclusion

We are committed to equality, diversity and inclusion. We want to represent the city we serve, which will help us become a more innovative and efficient organisation. Our goal is to make our recruitment as inclusive as possible. We are a disability confident employer who guarantee an interview to any disabled candidate who meets all of the essential criteria.

Benefits

In return for your commitment and expertise, you will enjoy excellent benefits and scope to grow. Rewards vary according to the level of role but mostly include the below:


Final salary pension scheme
Free travel for you on the TfL network
Reimbursement of 75% of the cost of a standard class Ticket for National Rail travel from home or 75% reimbursement on a 28-day flexi ticket
30 days annual leave plus public and bank holidays
TfL is committed to work-life balance, operating a hybrid working approach where business and role requirements allow
Private healthcare discounted scheme (optional)
Tax-efficient cycle-to-work programme
Retail, health, leisure and travel offers
Discounted Eurostar travel

Title: Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI

Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI




The location of the role is Paddington, London (hybrid working).

The duration of the contract is 8 months.

The pay rate on offer is ¬£300 - ¬£350 per day (via Umbrella agency).




The client is a multinational high-street retailer.

Business area: Food Packaging




Key accountabilities and measures

Provide analytical support and reports based on data research and analysis to the Compliance Team to drive data consistency and accuracy
Resolve commercial and technical queries for all stakeholders and provide appropriate commentary to ensure clarity on root cause and avoid any reoccurrence
Deliver efficient analytical reports and insights through data research and analysis to support the Compliance Team in driving data submissions accuracy
Effective co-ordination of data gathering processes to ensure alignment with external and internal reporting requirements
Collate and maintain data reports within agreed standards
Liaise internally and externally with departments, suppliers, and compliance agencies
Ensure timely transfer of raw sales data and packaging information from different business areas
Assist compliance team with data verification for reporting and ensuring data declarations completed and submitted to schedule
Monitor and audit data quality and report any issues to key stakeholders
Identify problems and recommend solutions to improve the processes and ways or working.
Ongoing training to confidently work with the business‚Äô systems GMOR, SAP, PLM, FIND, Business objects, etc.
Resolve administrative problems and inquiries with reporting from the compliance agencies
Prepare written responses to routine enquiries
Raise any system issue logs with Tech support and ensure resolution the completion
Raise Purchase Orders and maintain the Compliance Invoicing tracker for the function.




Key skills and experience

Excellent knowledge and practical skills of Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) and other Microsoft Office programs - Power BI
Ability to simultaneously manage, prioritise and deliver multiple projects/priorities on time
Strong delivery focus with great attention to detail, routine process, and completion of tasks.
Commitment to continuous improvement of digital and data skills
Confident and professional verbal and written communication skills
Takes initiative and comfortable working autonomously
Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with own team, across functions and channels

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst (Power BI / SQL)

Location: London (Hybrid ‚Äì 2 days onsite)

Salary: ¬£45,000 + Benefits

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent




Are you a data-driven thinker using Power BI and SQL?

Looking for a collaborative environment where you can make a real impact while continuing to grow your skills?




We‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join a growing team within a dynamic and forward-thinking Insurance services company with a global footprint. Reporting directly to the Group Data Lead, you‚Äôll play a hands-on role in developing high-quality dashboards, reporting tools, and data solutions used by internal stakeholders and external clients.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

Build and maintain Power BI dashboards, including externally-facing reports for clients and underwriting teams
Write SQL queries to extract, transform and support backend reporting
Collaborate with internal teams to gather requirements and translate them into insightful visualisations
Develop KPI dashboards and static reports (Excel, PowerPoint) for strategic insights
Support client rollouts and help onboard data-driven solutions




Tech Stack & Tools:

Power BI (including Paginated Reports)
SQL
Excel & PowerPoint
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

1 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Reporting Analyst role
Solid experience with Power BI and confident using SQL
Strong communication skills ‚Äì able to work with both technical and non-technical teams
A proactive, delivery-focused mindset ‚Äì someone who takes ownership of tasks
Keen to learn and develop in a non-hierarchical, supportive environment
Comfortable working with small to mid-sized datasets (this is not a big data role)




What‚Äôs on Offer:

Competitive salary (up to ¬£45K)
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days per week in a central London office
A supportive team with mentorship from senior data professionals
Exposure to global teams across Europe, the US, and Asia
An inclusive, values-led culture with strong ethical foundations




If you're excited about leveraging your Power BI and SQL skills in a meaningful way and want to be part of a forward-thinking, global environment ‚Äî apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Migration Analyst, UK (6-month Fixed Term Contract)

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Migration Analyst to join our ApotheCom team on a 6-month fixed term contract basis.

ApotheCom is an exciting leader in the field of medical communications. Drawn together from several backgrounds including the pharmaceutical industry, research, marketing, medical and regulatory writing, sales, publishing, digital media and design, we have the experience and all-round ability to conceive and deliver the best quality medical communications programmes.

About The Role

Reporting to the Finance Director, the Data Migration Analyst supports the seamless and accurate migration of data from Deltek Maconomy into Oracle ERP systems. This role requires a strong understanding of financial data structures, experience in ERP systems (ideally in Maconomy and Oracle), and a methodical approach to data extraction, transformation, validation, and loading (ETL). The Data Migration Analyst will play a crucial role in ensuring data integrity, consistency, and minimal business disruption during the transition.

Key responsibilities will include:


Leading and executing data migration activities from Maconomy to Oracle Fusion.
Collaborating with functional and technical teams to define data migration strategy, scope, and timelines.
Extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from Maconomy, ensuring alignment with Oracle data structures.
Collaborating with key stakeholders to cleanse, map, and validate data to meet Oracle standards and project requirements.
Developing and maintaining detailed documentation of data migration processes, mapping logic, and validation scripts.
Conducting data quality checks, performing reconciliation between systems, and resolving discrepancies.
Working with stakeholders to identify legacy data to be migrated and defining data retention policies.
Supporting testing cycles (System Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing) with relevant data sets.
Ensuring compliance with data governance, security, and privacy policies.
Providing regular updates and status reports to the project team and senior stakeholders.


About you:

To succeed in this role, you will have:


Proven experience with data migration projects in a similar role. Experience with data migration from Maconomy to Oracle ERP is desirable, but not essential. .
Strong understanding of ERP data models, especially in finance, projects, HR, and procurement modules.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a deadline-driven environment.


Don't meet every job requirement? That's okay! Our company is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role, but your experience doesn't perfectly fit every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this role or others.

Title: Insights Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Role: Business Insights Analyst

Role Type: Temporary ‚Äì 6 Months ‚Äì Full Time

Location: London ‚Äì St. Pancras ‚Äì x3 Days On-Site per week / x2 days Working Remote







Your New Company




As a Business Insights Analyst you will be working within the UK Oncology Insights and Analytics team to provide relevant insights and analysis to enable an optimal diagnosis of our business performance.




In this regard, the Business Insights Analyst will be responsible for analysing different data sources (sales data, competitive insights, activity, etc.) to generate insights aimed at delivering competitive advantage. In addition, the incumbent will also contribute to critical business processes connected to data automation, brand planning and financial planning.







Your New Role




Generate insights on patients, customers and NHS as well as brands, markets and TA by analysing multiple data sources to inform and influence business decisions
Deliver performance analytics on priority brands by (1) identifying patterns within the data, (2) uncovering insights / brand opportunities and (3) articulate useful recommendations
Support strategic planning and financial planning processes
Support data and analytics automation processes
Working closely with the BUs, develop a thorough understanding of current key business issues and provide solutions to support BU decision making
Proactively identifies blind spots and opportunities in terms of unanswered business questions and insights
Drive compliant processes according to AZ SoPs and Code of conduct




Essential Skills




3 to 5 years of experience in analytical or insights generation roles
Analytical skills, strong excel + power point skills
Knowledge of NHS and the pharma industry ‚Äì Oncology advantageous
Ability to distil impactful insights out of different data
Proven track record of working with senior stakeholders in a complex environment
Self-starter who can face challenges with positive attitude




Desirable Skills




Oncology knowledge / experience
Experience with PowerBI
Pharma Sales & Marketing experience







WHY ASTRAZENECA?




It's an exciting time to join AstraZeneca, a global business that's rapidly growing - there's a lot happening and even more to come. And we are a valued part of this journey. Respected partners across the business, we provide the platform that's going to power us to achieve more.




So, what's next?




Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it's yours. Please apply with a copy of your CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Data Migration to Workday HCM / Freelance (Inside IR35)




You‚Äôll be working closely with our colleagues across the ERP Transformation Team alongside our Finance, IT, Data & Tech teams and other broader functions to support our global employee data collection, reporting and updating. We are undergoing a large transformation across our People function and the ERP Transformation team has a vast array of projects with touchpoints across multiple projects. We need a data analyst to help us deliver accurate and timely global employee data reports whenever and however needed.




We are building a holistic, sustainable and scalable People Operating Model enabled by Workday HCM and other technology solutions, alongside new ways of working in our service delivery model, including payroll harmonization.




What you'll do




Reporting into the People Transformation Data Lead, you will:




¬∑ Become the company's subject matter expert in all things related to global employee data with curiosity and a willingness to dive into the details to understand the data, it sources and definitions.

¬∑ Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing validation reports.

¬∑ Update data within various source systems, which will require an understanding of our data lineage.

¬∑ Identify opportunities to establish and/or improve operational processes to update and maintain our data, improving quality and implementing scalable solutions for our employee data lifecycle.

¬∑ Document end to end data entry, update, and reporting processes.

¬∑ Assist with communications notifying stakeholders of new/improved processes.

¬∑ Responsible for stakeholder issue resolution.

¬∑ Assist with future upgrades and system enhancements which may include new software.

¬∑ Interpret stakeholder data reporting requirements, analyse data and provide outgoing reports.

¬∑ Scope out and support projects related to our data that span functions.

¬∑ Implement metrics and timelines with any data project required.

¬∑ Manage multiple data-related projects at one time, identifying and raising risks, dependencies, and prioritization concerns.




What you'll need:




¬∑ Analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills

¬∑ HCM / People Data Experience; Workday HCM a plus

¬∑ Workday Enterprise Interface Builder experience

¬∑ Experience of Data visualization tools

¬∑ Willingness to learn new tools and systems

¬∑ Ability to effectively communicate across a global community which requires an openness to diversity of thought, backgrounds and cultures

¬∑ Technology experience or interest

¬∑ Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills

¬∑ Comfortable in dealing with all levels of company leadership

¬∑ Team player but also able to determine workload and be self-motivated

¬∑ General enthusiasm for growth and a willingness to be hands on




Start date: 4th August

Duration: 12 month contract

Location: London (some days on-site required)

Rate: ¬£550-575 per day ** INSIDE IR35 **

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: ¬£35k‚Äì¬£40k (DOE)




Are you a detail-driven analyst with a passion for data and automation? Join a specialist investment firm that partners with some of the most exciting high-growth software companies across Europe and the US. In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll play a critical part in streamlining data-driven workflows and powering smarter investment decisions through innovative tech.




This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career analyst to join a growing Data & Research function that sits at the heart of the firm‚Äôs investment strategy. You'll be part of a high-impact team driving digital transformation and working with modern tools to improve processes, insights, and decision-making.




Your Responsibilities:

Build and enhance data pipelines: Help design and maintain proprietary automation systems that support investment strategy.
Improve internal platforms: Collaborate on projects to streamline workflows and eliminate manual processes using modern tooling.
Deliver high-quality insights: Monitor key data metrics and trends to support investment research and decision-making.
Ensure data integrity: Validate and enrich datasets to maintain accuracy, completeness, and consistency across internal platforms.
Evaluate tools and vendors: Assist in reviewing and optimising external data providers and technical solutions.
Contribute to innovation: Continuously explore opportunities to improve systems through experimentation, automation, and modern engineering practices.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM or data-oriented field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics.
A meticulous attention to detail and passion for accurate, high-quality data.
Interest in data automation and how technology enables smarter decision-making.
Exposure to or willingness to learn tools like Python, SQL, Zapier, n8n, or similar.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while delivering at pace.
Strong communication skills to collaborate across teams and share insights clearly with non-technical stakeholders.
A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and data tools.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience with Google Cloud Platform, APIs, or GitHub.
Familiarity with structured data entry, validation processes, or workflow automation.
A genuine interest in private equity, venture capital, or financial technology.




The Benefits:

Join a mission-driven firm focused on supporting exceptional software companies.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects that shape investment outcomes.
Hybrid work model with a collaborative London-based team.
Mentorship and growth opportunities tailored to early-career talent.
Competitive salary and long-term progression within a growing data function.




If you're a motivated Junior Data Analyst eager to apply your skills in a fast-paced, tech-enabled environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team turning data into competitive advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MI Analyst - Speciality Insurance - London - Hybrid - Reinsurance - ¬£60,000




We are seeking a skilled MI Analyst to join a dynamic team where you will play a crucial role in delivering management information and business intelligence solutions. The successful candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to understand reporting and data requirements, transforming these into insightful, accurate, and timely MI reports and dashboards.




This role requires expertise in Power BI, SQL, and DAX to develop, maintain, and optimise reporting solutions that support decision-making across insurance and reinsurance functions. You will be responsible for data analysis, report creation, and ensuring data integrity while collaborating with technical teams to enhance data platforms and reporting capabilities. A strong understanding of the insurance industry, particularly insurance and reinsurance processes, is essential to effectively translate business needs into actionable insights.




Required Skills:




Strong and proven proficiency in Power BI, SQL and DAX
Data analysis and reporting
Management Information (MI) development
Insurance and reinsurance domain knowledge
Data visualisation best practices
Stakeholder engagement and communication




This is a fantastic opportunity for anyone looking to take their next step in their career in Speciality Insurance with a reputable organisation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Frive - Data Analyst

Reporting to - Senior Data and Analytics Manager

Location - Canary Wharf




About us

Frive (formerly Lions Prep) is the UK‚Äôs highest-rated ready-to-eat meal delivery subscription, delivering tens of thousands of fresh, natural, chef-prepared meals to customers‚Äô doors across the UK each week.




We are committed to our vision of creating 100% organic meals without the hefty price tag, freeing us from a food system that compromises our health for profit




We work with people from all different backgrounds and communities and recognise our own biases. We strive to create a strong sense of belonging and believe we will be better equipped to achieve our goals by building a team that approaches problems from different angles, using different perspectives and experiences to solve problems. All qualified applicants will be considered and we have no regard for age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion, or sexual orientation the more the merrier, and together we can achieve greatness




Mission:

We help busy people enjoy natural, healthy eating with ready-to-eat meals delivered to their door, proven to support their health goals.




Vision:

To transform health by revolutionising eating habits and restoring food to its natural form.

Values:

Empowerment: We empower our people to make strong, independent decisions with confidence

Transparency: We share information openly and with intention

Open Communication: We communicate directly and honestly

High Performance: We foster an environment that attracts, retains, and rewards high performance

Agility: We encourage flexibility in our people by reducing blockers and prioritising their creativity and productivity




Your impact

You'll play a key role in building and scaling our Looker instance, ensuring teams across Frive have the tools and data they need to make informed decisions. By delivering high-quality analysis and actionable insights to teams like Marketing, Finance, and Operations, you‚Äôll help drive strategic initiatives and accelerate business growth. Your work will directly support a data-driven culture across the company.




Responsibilities:

Build and scale our Looker instance to support a self-serve analytics culture
Deliver clear, reliable dashboards and reports for Marketing, Finance, and Operations
Partner with teams to define metrics that track performance and unlock growth opportunities
Investigate trends, surface insights, and guide decisions with data-backed recommendations
Support company-wide analytical initiatives, from campaign reviews to financial forecasting
Improve data quality and structure to make analysis faster and more effective
Communicate findings in a way that's actionable‚Äîno data dumps, just answers that drive impact




About you

We‚Äôre a fast-moving, collaborative team, and things can change quickly‚Äîif that excites you, you‚Äôll feel right at home. You don‚Äôt need a specific degree or a perfect CV. We care more about your mindset, your skills, and your willingness to learn.

You write solid SQL and feel confident working with large datasets
You‚Äôve used a BI tool like Looker or Tableau to build dashboards that people actually use
You‚Äôre great at turning data into insights and helping others make informed decisions
You enjoy working with non-technical teams and explaining things clearly and simply
You‚Äôre proactive, curious, and excited to help shape how we use data across the business
Bonus: you‚Äôve worked with Looker or helped build a BI setup before
Bonus: you‚Äôve touched tools like dbt, BigQuery or Git‚Äîor you‚Äôre keen to learn them here




Staff Benefits:

Private Medical Insurance
25 days Holiday + Public
Salary Sacrifice Pension
Bonus (paid out twice a year)
50% Discount off our amazing food
Hybrid working pattern (2 days in our Canary Wharf office)
Enhanced mat/pat leave
Vitality PMI
Mintago Financial Wellbeing Platform ‚Äì includes workplace mental health support via MIND, Free Financial Service Advice and LOTS more




What's next?

If you are interested in learning more about the role and think this could be for you, then don't hesitate and apply now. We look forward to hearing from you and love hearing from people who are passionate about our purpose and vision.

The Process:

Initial conversation via Teams with our Head of Talent ‚Äì you will learn about our story so far, ambitions for the future and of course have a chance to showcase your experience and talk through your own motivations
Teams meeting with our Senior Data & Analytics Manager ‚Äì getting more under the skin of what the expectations are in the role and some competency-based interview questions
Task ‚Äì presented in person in our Canary Wharf office to our Senior Data & Analytics Manager and Head Of Product ‚Äì this will be a real insight how you‚Äôd approach some of the challenges on our roadmap, leveraging your existing experience, whilst adapting to our specific needs

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & Insights Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Type: Full-time

Salary: ¬£55,000‚Äì¬£65,000 (DOE)




About the Company

We‚Äôre working with a London-based luxury fashion brand that‚Äôs integrating data at the core of their operations. As the business scales, they‚Äôre developing a bespoke ERP platform to drive better decision-making across production, inventory, and sales.




The Opportunity

This is a great opportunity for a skilled Data & Insights Analyst to join a growing team and help shape how data is used across the business. You‚Äôll be responsible for designing pipelines, building dashboards, and delivering insight to support product and operational excellence.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain ETL processes using Python and Power Query M
Create clear, insightful dashboards in Power BI using DAX
Work closely with engineering and product teams to embed analytics into the ERP platform
Analyse large datasets to support operational efficiency and continuous improvement
Contribute to forecasting and inventory optimisation initiatives
Present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Help establish and maintain best practices in data governance




What We‚Äôre Looking For

A STEM degree from a Russell Group university or equivalent
At least 2 years‚Äô experience using Python for data analysis
Advanced Power BI skills, including DAX and Power Query M
Solid SQL experience and comfort working with relational databases
Strong analytical and communication skills
Experience working with product teams to implement data-driven solutions
Familiarity with forecasting or inventory planning is a plus




Why Apply?

Play a key role in shaping a data-first approach at a high-end fashion brand
Work in a hybrid environment with flexibility and autonomy
Competitive salary in a growing, innovation-focused business

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data & Information

Location: Greenford (UB6 0HE) or Bow Road (E3 2SE) Campus - (On-site)

Type of Contract: Permanent

GBS is a higher education provider offering a range of sector-relevant courses across ten campuses in London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Working in partnership with several of the UK‚Äôs leading higher education providers, we deliver vocational, undergraduate and postgraduate programmes in finance, accounting, business, construction, tourism, healthcare, and more.

Our Vision: Changing lives through education.

What We Do: Developing and writing quality reports both internally for GBS and for GBS partner organisations and other external agencies. To contribute to preparations for degree awarding powers.

The role: Working with internal stakeholders, you will use your expertise to gather existing and/or new data (where identified) and undertake analysis to provide data insights across GBS. Applying appropriate analytical techniques, you will present your findings appropriately through written reports or through intuitive, self-serve dashboards that will empower colleagues to understand the key metrics that drive performance throughout the organisation.

Please note, we are unable to offer sponsorship for this position.

Main Responsibilities

What the role involves:


Work within a team to manage new data projects from end-to-end, gathering requirements through to developing and implementing new reports.
Engage with stakeholders to validate their requirements, review policies/procedures and present solution options in a manner that can be evaluated to meet needs.
Extract, prepare and collate raw data from multiple sources and provide analysing and manipulating data to produce customised reports and insights.
Lead and/or work within a team to design and implement surveys across the organisation, analysis of survey outcomes.
Analyse and interpret data to assist in providing solutions to deliver improved service delivery/performance and an optimal student experience.
Recognise erroneous data and escalate to the appropriate individual, in line with company procedures.
Monitor and assist in audits for data quality, data integrity and data governance.
Prepare reports for internal and external audiences using appropriate reporting tools, including Excel and Power BI.
Provide sector benchmarking through analysis of outcomes of NSS, TEF and Graduate Outcome Surveys.



Requirements

What Experience/Skills are required:


A good degree in a numerate subject
Prior use and understanding of Power BI or Tableau is essential.
Previous experience with data analysis.
Detailed knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
Experience in presenting data and providing insights via interactive dashboards or presentations.
Experience with R/Python/SPSS or SQL.
Confidence in building relations with internal and external stakeholders, with the ability to communicate complex data capability in a simple way.
Excellent knowledge of analytical tools, including Microsoft Power BI.
A good understanding of data and model design.



Desirable Experience:


Work experience in Higher Education or Public Sector.



Other Information

What We Offer


25 days annual leave, plus 8 public holidays
1-day extra leave per year of service, up to a maximum of 5 days
Workplace pension scheme
Tuition reimbursement for career development courses
Flexible Benefits: Cycle to Work, Workplace Nursery, Techscheme and much more
Perks@Work discounts platform, wellbeing centre and much more
Reward and recognition programme
¬£500 award employee referral scheme
Discretionary annual performance bonus



‚ÄúGBS has been a good place for professional growth. I have received great support from managers and colleagues who have encouraged me to develop new skills and take on more senior roles. Their mentorship has been invaluable to help me advance in my career.‚Äù

‚Äî Barbara Vargas (Professional Services Employee)

GBS is committed to equality, diversity and inclusion and providing a workplace free from discrimination or harassment. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and communities. We take our core values seriously and work hard to create an environment where everyone feels welcomed.

#indeedjune
