HTML:
Data Analyst


Who We Are


Teranet is Canada‚Äôs leader in the delivery and transformation of statutory registry services with extensive expertise in land and commercial registries. We also market insightful property and data solutions, as well as practice management automation to thousands of customers in the real estate, financial services, government, utilities, and legal markets.


Connect. Grow. Thrive Together.


To learn more about who we are visit our website: www.teranet.ca


About the Role


The Data & Analytics team within the Commercial Solutions line of business has an ambitious mandate, where we are accountable for leveraging Data & Analytics to deliver business value both internally as well as to external clients through the following:


  • Enhance existing or create new products and services with proprietary data assets and partnering with external data providers, through the application of data science
  • Design and deliver cutting-edge reporting solutions to bring data to life
  • Conduct advanced data analysis to generate business insights that drive strategic decision-making
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in the ecosystem in which we operate
  • Provide actionable recommendations to improve overall organizational efficiencies


In addition, this team will play an important role in evangelizing and educating the value of Data & Analytics to the rest of the organization, in support of cultivating a data-driven culture.

You will support these ambitious goals primarily through ensuring seamless data integration, maintaining high quality data standards, collaborating with cross functional teams, and delivering comprehensive analyses and innovative visualization using business intelligence tools.


What You‚Äôll Be Doing


The Data Analyst supports the team in the design, development, and implementation of data & analytics use cases through the following responsibilities:


Data Exploration (30%)

  • Collaborate across marketing, product, finance, partner solutions, data engineering and other teams to deeply understand business objectives
  • Translate business questions into technical data needs, ensuring alignment with project goals
  • Gather internal and external datasets creatively, ensuring relevance to business use cases
  • Exhibit strong attention to detail while working with large datasets to ensure accuracy, completeness and high-quality standards
  • Present insights clearly through reports and presentations tailored to diverse audiences


Data Processing and Engineering Support (30%)

  • Partner closely with data engineers and data scientists to ensure data pipelines and models align with organizational goal
  • Diagnose and enhance data quality across diverse sources
  • Recommend ways to integrate disparate data sources into a usable data model to meet business requirements
  • Present business insights in a meaningful and intuitive manner, in accordance with the target audience, using Tableau, Excel, and other BI tools


Data Analytics and Visualization (40%)

  • Create interactive dashboards and reports that guide business decisions
  • Demonstrate curiosity by exploring datasets, conducting exploratory data analysis to uncover hidden trends, outliers, anomalies, and identify insights that might not be obvious
  • Provide detailed analysis of customer behavior, market trends, and competitive landscape to support product, sales and marketing strategies
  • Use visualization techniques to communicate insights effectively and intuitively


About You


What will you need to be successful?


You are someone who:


  • Is keen to understand the business ‚Äì data analytics cannot be done in a vacuum ‚Äì we need to be close to the business so that we understand what we are trying to solve for and what the data means
  • Tells stories from data ‚Äì data analytics is not data dump ‚Äì it needs to be meaningful and intuitive to the end user in order to realize the inherent business value
  • Challenges the status quo ‚Äì the state of business and the field of data analytics are constantly evolving, and we need to as well.Assumptions and old ways of doing things are open season, as long as you bring along workable and relevant solutions articulated in a professional manner. Proactively pursue and learn about new data sets, analytical tools and methodologies to solve problems in new and innovative ways.
  • Is good at problem solving ‚Äì someone who can ‚Äúconnect the dots‚Äù, and have a logical and methodical way to tackle new and complex problems
  • Takes pride in your work ‚Äì your work is diligent and thorough, and you are proud of your reputation for high-quality and reliable work
  • Is a quick study ‚Äì the successful candidate must be curious, resourceful, and dig into the weeds to ask the right questions and figure things out independently
  • Is a good communicator ‚Äì someone who is polished and can communicate effectively with internal and external parties to ensure alignment on data analysis and reporting needs


Technical qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in quantitative field: Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering
  • Minimum 2 years of work experience as a Data Analyst
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python and Excel
  • Advanced expertise in Tableau, or other BI tools
  • Knowledge of Big Data Technologies (HDFS, Spark, etc.) and Cloud platforms (AWS and/or Azure)
  • Understanding of spatial data concepts, including geospatial data formats (e.g., GeoJSON, Shapefiles), spatial analysis, and tools like ArcGIS


Why Teranet


We may be a global innovator in electronic services and solutions who operate one of the most advanced and secure registration systems in the world, but we‚Äôre so much more than that!


Our Extraordinary People.

Together, we are passionate, driven, resourceful, and authentic. We continue to thrive because of our people and their powerful ideas, strong team spirit, ‚Äòcan-do attitude, and unwavering dedication to our business and our clients.


Growth Opportunities.

Our people are smart, ambitious, and have big career goals. We not only encourage a culture of openly talking about our career aspirations but one where we truly invest in the continuous learning, development, and growth of our people.


Our Work Environment.

Let‚Äôs face it. We spend a lot of our time working, so the atmosphere is everything! We believe in cultivating a work environment that makes our people feel comfortable, engaged, appreciated, and happy.


Company Culture & Core Values.

Our company culture and core values are the core of our identity. They define who we are, how we engage with each other and our clients, and how we conduct business every day.


What We Offer


  • Market-competitive pay structure s
  • Paid Vacation & Sick Leaves
  • Maternity, Parental and/or Adoption Leave Top-Up Program
  • 100% Employer-Paid Health Benefit Plan
  • Retirement Savings Plans with Employer Matching Scheme
  • Ongoing Financial Wellness Seminars
  • Corporate Discounted Programs + Wellness Program
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for our employees and their families!


At Teranet, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we live and serve. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.


Come As You Are. We Like You that Way!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Level Up Your Career with Zynga!

At Zynga, we bring people together through the power of play. As a global leader in interactive entertainment and a proud label of Take-Two Interactive, our games have been downloaded over 6 billion times‚Äîconnecting players in 175+ countries through fun, strategy, and a little friendly competition.

From thrilling casino spins to epic strategy battles, mind-bending puzzles, and social word challenges, our diverse game portfolio has something for everyone. Fan-favorites and latest hits include FarmVille‚Ñ¢, Words With Friends‚Ñ¢, Zynga Poker‚Ñ¢, Game of Thrones Slots Casino‚Ñ¢, Wizard of Oz Slots‚Ñ¢, Hit it Rich! Slots‚Ñ¢, Wonka Slots‚Ñ¢, Top Eleven‚Ñ¢, Toon Blast‚Ñ¢, Empires & Puzzles‚Ñ¢, Merge Dragons!‚Ñ¢, CSR Racing‚Ñ¢, Harry Potter: Puzzles & Spells‚Ñ¢, Match Factory‚Ñ¢, and Color Block Jam‚Ñ¢‚Äîplus many more!

Founded in 2007 and headquartered in California, our teams span North America, Europe, and Asia, working together to craft unforgettable gaming experiences. Whether you're spinning, strategizing, matching, or competing, Zynga is where fun meets innovation‚Äîand where you can take your career to the next level.

Join us and be part of the play!

Position Overview

Zynga‚Äôs mission is to connect the world through games. Its vision was that gaming would become a mass market activity, and "play" would be an important verb in our daily lives. As a part of this vision, Zynga Analytics partners with studios to release and grow multiple games, while also owning the analytics stack and central tools.

Zynga‚Äôs Data Science and Analytics team uses our unique and expansive data to model and predict user behavior, making our games more personalized and more fun to play! We continually strive to better understand our players and provide them with experiences that surprise and delight.

Here‚Äôs where you would come in: A successful candidate will be passionate about analytics and data science and ability to impact game performance through customer-centric, data-driven initiatives. As a member of the Central Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to build end-to-end, scalable data-driven solutions to generate impactful insights and work on exciting, large-scale projects. You will collaborate with Product Managers, Game Analysts, and Engineers to deliver business impact.

Be innovative, be creative, use every bit of that key commodity ‚Äì data. Millions of people play Zynga games every day, so our data is tremendously rich, and we have a lot of it!

What You'll Do


Work with large amounts of data to find opportunities to improve the experience that Zynga provides to its players
Use our modern tech stack, Redshift, Databricks and PySpark, DBT, Airflow, and Tableau to develop innovative tools
Analyze performance metrics to provide statistical insights that support data-driven decision-making
Build and maintain centralized data assets
Develop clear narratives from data using visualization tools such as Tableau.
Work closely with game teams and product managers to craft, test, verify, and implement end-to-end data pipelines that ingest data from multiple sources and output meaningful insights to optimize Zynga audience growth


What You Bring


Proficient in SQL; Intermediate experience with programming in Python
Adept in at least one visualization tool such as Tableau
Adept in at least one visualization tool such as Tableau.
Understanding of B2C app metrics and KPIs, performance monitoring, and insights.
Demonstrated experience with some or all of the following: data mining, optimization, experimental design, computational analytics, econometric modeling.
2+ years of work experience in data analytics or data science roles
BS in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field; Master's, MBA, or PhD preferred


What We Offer You

Zynga offers a world-class benefits package that helps support and balance the needs of our teams. To find out more about our benefits, visit the Zynga Benefits site

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment with us is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic ‚Äì not an individual‚Äôs race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at accommodationrequest@zynga.com to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Zynga does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Zynga also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Zynga‚Äôs in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
Description:
About Fusemachines

Fusemachines is a leading AI strategy, talent, and education services provider. Founded by Sameer Maskey Ph.D., Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, Fusemachines has a core mission of democratizing AI. With a presence in 4 countries (Nepal, United States, Canada, and Dominican Republic and more than 350 full-time employees). Fusemachines' AI educational program has made world-class AI education available, accessible and affordable to students around the world. Fusemachines seeks to bring its global expertise in AI to transform companies around the world.

About the role:

Location: Remote (Full-time)

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and enhance operational efficiency. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining PowerBI dashboards and reports that provide valuable insights to various stakeholders across the organization. Your work will directly contribute to optimizing business processes and improving customer experiences.

Qualification & Experience


Bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science
At least 4 years of experience in data analytics, with a focus on business intelligence and data visualization in cybersecurity


Required Skills/Competencies


Proven experience as a PowerBI Developer, with a strong portfolio showcasing impactful dashboards and reports
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation
Solid understanding of data modeling concepts and experience in designing efficient data models
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Must have experience with Snowflake as EDWH and AWS
Must have Python experience and have worked in Pipelines, from source to representation of the data
Familiar with cybersecurity KPIs, and
Experience in the Financial Sector


Roles And Responsibilities


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable insights using Python, SQL, Snowflake, AWS and PowerBI
Develop visually appealing and interactive dashboards and reports to effectively communicate key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and anomalies, focus on cybersecurity
Optimize data models and queries to ensure efficient performance and scalability of PowerBI solutions
Implement best practices for data visualization, ensuring clarity, consistency, and usability for end users
Work closely with data engineers to integrate data from various sources and maintain data accuracy and integrity
Provide training and support to end users to maximize adoption and utilization of PowerBI tools
Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in data visualization and analytics technologies, recommending improvements and innovations as appropriate
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure compliance with data security and governance policies


Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Reporting to the Manager, Occupational Health, Safety and Wellness (OHSW), the Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting data to support evidence-based decision making, improve workplace health and safety outcomes, and enhance wellness initiatives. Designing, develop and maintain interactive dashboards to monitor and report Occupational Health, Safety & Wellness metrics. Working closely with internal and external partners, the Data Analyst will identify trends, measure program effectiveness, and develop actionable insights to reduce workplace risks, optimize resources and promote a healthy, safe and engaged workforce. The Data Analyst will have strong analytical skills, a collaborative mindset and a passion for leveraging data to promote a culture of health, safety and wellbeing amongst the MGH community.

Primary Responsibilities


Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, clean, and analyze occupational health, safety, and wellness data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Data Reporting & Communication: Design and create automated reports anddashboards to provide ongoing visibility into performance metrics, quality outcomes, and OHSW KPIs. Prepare clear, visually engaging reports and presentations that communicate findings, trends, and recommendations to leadership, committees, and other stakeholders to support informed decision-making.
Dashboard Development: Build and maintain interactive dashboards to monitor program performance, track trends, and enable real-time data access for stakeholders.
Program Evaluation: Measure and assess the effectiveness of safety, health, and wellness initiatives, providing data-driven insights and recommendations for improvement.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with OHSW leaders, operational teams, and other partners to define data needs, establish reporting standards, and ensure alignment with organizational priorities.
Data Governance: Maintain data integrity, security, and compliance with relevant privacy and health information regulations.


EDUCATION


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Public Health, or a related field; an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.


Qualifications


Minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in data analysis, preferably within occupational health, safety, wellness, or a related healthcare/organizational setting.


Technical Skills


Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, and other data manipulation tools.
Experience with automated reporting and dashboard development.


Analytical Skills: Proven ability to analyze complex datasets, identify trends, and translate findings into actionable insights.


Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present data clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work effectively withcross-functional teams and build strong stakeholder relationships.


Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and commitment to data quality, integrity, and security.


Knowledge: Familiarity with occupational health, safety, wellness principles, and relevant privacy legislation (e.g., PHIPA, HIPAA) is an asset.


Good work and attendance record required.
All employees of Michael Garron Hospital (MGH), a division of Toronto East Health Network (TEHN) [formerly Toronto EastGeneral Hospital (TEGH)] agree to work within the legislated practices of the Occupational Health and Safety Act of Ontario.
All employees of MGH are responsible to contribute to a transparent culture of patient and staff safety by adhering to and abiding by patientand staff safety policies and procedures set by MGH.
All employees are accountable for protecting the psychological health and safety of themselves and their co-workers through adherence to MGH's policies and practices.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Company: C.S.T. Savings Inc.

Industry: Financial Services

Reports to: Manager, Sales Data Analytics

Location: Flexible Work Location Arrangements Available

Application Deadline: August 21, 2025




Job Summary:




The Data Analyst will be responsible for maintaining high service standards to CST customers by utilizing their data manipulation, dashboard/report building, structured problem solving and analysis skills to ensure the effectiveness and efficiency. This role will be responsible for providing ancillary support to continuous improvement and performance management initiatives through historical data analysis and performance metrics reporting. The Data Analyst will proactively look for opportunities through the analysis of data and information and provide feedback and recommendations to management that will lead to improved performance. A talented data analyst with strong analytical skills, attention to detail, experience with requirements management and expertise with industry-standard analytical/reporting tools is crucial to this role. Candidates with strong computer analytical skills, good communication and presentation skills, experience with cost/benefit analyses and modeling techniques are desirable.




Maintain, Develop, and generate dashboards, and daily/weekly/monthly reports




Maintain existing data models/dashboards/reports developed in Power BI/Excel and update source data in database server
Maintain existing data warehouse and ETL pipelines on Azure
Gather requirements, develop and roll-out reporting for all metrics/KPIs used to support management decision-making and provide value added analysis
Utilize available tools and/or work with the IT department to automate reports, build models and perform complex data analysis to identify key insights
Maintain and ensure the integrity of historical departmental data to build a strong base for forecasting, team performance management, and continuous improvement
Generate strategic/operational reports and share immediate business insights and key findings in the report with the audience
Answer any deliverable related questions from the audience in a timely manner and continuously improve deliverables based on improvement suggestions provided




Analyze and make recommendations to improve the performance




Analyze all metrics, KPIs, and trends forecasts across different departments to identify root causes for issues/variances, make recommendations, and identify opportunities for improvements
Communicate and provide feedback regarding Departmental performance metrics to Management and Executives




Other Functions and Responsibilities




Support the departments with the implementation of any initiatives, tools and projects that will improve performance or reporting
Keep existing processes and procedures well documented
Other duties as assigned




What you bring:




3+ years data analyst experience; have demonstrated analytical and problem-solving ability with a track record of results
A post-secondary education, preferably in a business or engineering related discipline, or equivalent work experience
Expertise in Excel, SQL and Power BI is a must
Advanced knowledge in DAX / Python / Azure / Fabric / ETL tools is an asset
Self-motivated, innovative, and solutions-oriented
Strong team player
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
Business presentation skill
Strong people & relationship building skills; team player; able to work with all levels
Personable, energetic, positive with "can-do" attitude




What‚Äôs in it for you?




Below are examples of some of the things you can take advantage of from this opportunity:




Be part of a growing innovative company that‚Äôs a leader in the industry ‚Äì all of us roll up our sleeves to get the work done
Work with a highly motivated, collaborative, and fun team
Flexible Work Arrangements
Competitive salary and annual discretionary bonus program
Company paid benefits that start on your first day
Group Pension Plan with company contribution matching
Great vacation package, plus additional paid days off
Education reimbursement program to encourage continuous learning
Organization and team celebration events
Wellness Program, Employee and Family Assistance Program, Employee Recognition Programs and much more!




About CST:




The We‚Äôre the creators of Education Savings Plans in Canada. Our founders pioneered a movement to create and deliver solutions to make higher education accessible for all. Over 65 years later, our dedication to our mission is stronger than ever:




Almost 700,000 families have saved with CST
Almost 900,000+ students helped
$4.8 billion+ in total assets
$4 billion+ paid to Canadian families




Through our expert guidance and powerful investment options, we help Canadian‚Äôs invest in our children‚Äôs future with Registered Education Savings Plans (RESPs). With big dreams, anything is possible!




CST Spark is the latest chapter from the ongoing story of innovative education savings. Today, we continue to inspire and revolutionize education savings with CST Spark ‚Äì the simple, modern RESP that combines top investment expertise with the latest technology. For additional information, please visit www.cst.org & www.cstspark.ca




Come grow with us!




CST is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. CST sincerely thanks all applicants for their expressed interest in this opportunity; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the hiring process. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted. To request accommodation, please contact HR at careers@cst.org. Thank you for your interest in a career at CST.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location Address: Toronto, ON

Work Mode : Hybrid ‚Äì 3 days

Duration: 7+ months




The opportunity

We are on a journey to become a customer centered digital leader. We are looking for lead and motivated person who can deliver on our strategic priorities, passionate about customers, and are excited to see the successful implementation of the projects/products they deliver




Responsibilities / Individual Accountabilities:

Leads sessions with the business to gather requirements and get sign-off.
Produces and maintains Business Requirement Document (BRD), source to target mappings (STM) and other DA related documentation.
Ensures that project team delivers a data asset that meets business requirements.
Liaises with various teams and stakeholders to get alignment.
Data analysis, data profiling and metadata collection
Leads UAT activities with business and obtains sign-off




How will you create impact:

Reporting to the Lead Data Analyst within the GWAM Data Office/ Engineering team, the Senior Data Analyst is responsible for working with the Data Management and Delivery team, as well as other project teams, to ensure the data components of solutions provide the appropriate value to the business users, and are aligned with the organization‚Äôs data strategy.




What motivates you?

You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit.
You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes.
You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together.
You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.
You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up.
You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone.




Must have Requirements:

7 ‚Äì 10years experience as a Data Analyst preferably in the Wealth Management (.i.e.Retail, Retirement, Institutional or General Accounts) domain
2 - 3 years of Gen AI working experience, Azure cloud.
Experience with data-centric projects delivering the following (preferably within a capital markets or investment banking domain): Master data management, Data integration, Data warehousing and reporting. Big Data environment for analytics 4. Hands-on writing complex SQL queries to analyze data and provide results to business users or project team members.
Hands-on delivering data documentation artifacts in organizations of similar size and complexity within project deadlines.
Able to communicate clearly, both verbally and in written form at various levels within the project teams
Experience in major trading platforms, book of record systems, performance management platforms, such as Bloomberg Polar Lake, SimCorp Dimension, Findur, Apex, Eagle, Charles River, Sylvan, Calypso.
Intermediate to senior hands-on business analyst experience in building data infrastructure or developing data in a data lake or data warehouse.
Hands-on knowledge of data modeling, data loading, data profiling, and data validation using SQL scripts.
Deep knowledge of integrating new data sources into a data lake or data warehouse




Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.

Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit https://dexian.com/ to learn more. Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst




Who We Are




Teranet is Canada‚Äôs leader in the delivery and transformation of statutory registry services with extensive expertise in land and commercial registries. We also market insightful property and data solutions, as well as practice management automation to thousands of customers in the real estate, financial services, government, utilities, and legal markets.




Connect. Grow. Thrive Together.




To learn more about who we are visit our website: www.teranet.ca




About the Role




The Data & Analytics team within the Commercial Solutions line of business has an ambitious mandate, where we are accountable for leveraging Data & Analytics to deliver business value both internally as well as to external clients through the following:

Enhance existing or create new products and services with proprietary data assets and partnering with external data providers, through the application of data science
Design and deliver cutting-edge reporting solutions to bring data to life
Conduct advanced data analysis to generate business insights that drive strategic decision-making
Demonstrate thought leadership in the ecosystem in which we operate
Provide actionable recommendations to improve overall organizational efficiencies




In addition, this team will play an important role in evangelizing and educating the value of Data & Analytics to the rest of the organization, in support of cultivating a data-driven culture.

You will support these ambitious goals primarily through ensuring seamless data integration, maintaining high quality data standards, collaborating with cross functional teams, and delivering comprehensive analyses and innovative visualization using business intelligence tools.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing




The Senior Data Analyst plays a pivotal role in driving data-informed decisions across our organization. Operating at the intersection of business strategy and data expertise, this hands-on role brings clarity to complex problems and empowers teams with actionable insights:




Business Data Consultation (35%)

Collaborate across marketing, product, finance, partner solutions, data engineering and other teams to deeply understand business objectives
Translate business questions into technical data needs, ensuring alignment with project goals
Research, identify and then collect / extract the external data sets required for the use case. Creativity, thinking outside of the box, and resourcefulness is required to find new and relevant data sources to meet business requirements
Exhibit strong attention to detail while working with large datasets to ensure accuracy, completeness and high-quality standards
Translate technical findings into clear recommendations for non-technical stakeholders, ensuring alignment with business use cases




Data Processing and Engineering Support (30%)

Partner closely with data engineers and data scientists to ensure data pipelines and models align with organizational goal
Diagnose and enhance data quality across diverse sources
Recommend ways to integrate disparate data sources into a usable data model to meet business requirements
Present business insights in a meaningful and intuitive manner, in accordance with the target audience, using Tableau, Excel, and other BI tools




Data Analytics and Visualization (35%)

Implement segmentation and categorization techniques to build dynamic solutions tailored to use case
Demonstrate curiosity by exploring datasets, conducting exploratory data analysis to uncover hidden trends, outliers, anomalies, and identify insights that might not be obvious
Provide detailed analysis of customer behavior, market trends, and competitive landscape to support product, sales and marketing strategies
Build advanced dashboards and visualizations that turn data into compelling narratives







About You




What will you need to be successful?




You are someone who:




Is keen to understand the business ‚Äì data analytics cannot be done in a vacuum ‚Äì we need to be close to the business so that we understand what we are trying to solve for and what the data means.
Tells stories from data ‚Äì data analytics is not data dump ‚Äì it needs to be meaningful and intuitive to the end user to realize the inherent business value.
Challenges the status quo ‚Äì the state of business and the field of data analytics are constantly evolving, and we need to as well.Assumptions and old ways of doing things are open season, as long as you bring along workable and relevant solutions articulated in a professional manner. Proactively pursue and learn about new data sets, analytical tools, and methodologies to solve problems in new and innovative ways.
Is good at problem solving ‚Äì someone who can ‚Äúconnect the dots‚Äù, and have a logical and methodical way to tackle new and complex problems.
Takes pride in your work ‚Äì your work is diligent and thorough and you are proud of your reputation for high-quality and reliable work.
Is a quick study ‚Äì the successful candidate must be curious, resourceful, and dig into the weeds to ask the right questions and figure things out independently.
Is a good communicator ‚Äì someone who is polished and can communicate effectively with internal and external parties to ensure alignment on data analysis and reporting needs.




Technical qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in quantitative field: Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience as a Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst
Proficiency in SQL, Python and Excel
Advanced expertise in Tableau, or other BI tools
Knowledge of Big Data Technologies (HDFS, Spark, etc.) and Cloud platforms (AWS and/or Azure)
Understanding of spatial data concepts, including geospatial data formats (e.g., GeoJSON, Shapefiles), spatial analysis, and tools like ArcGIS




Why Teranet




We may be a global innovator in electronic services and solutions who operate one of the most advanced and secure registration systems in the world, but we‚Äôre so much more than that!




Our Extraordinary People.

Together, we are passionate, driven, resourceful, and authentic. We continue to thrive because of our people and their powerful ideas, strong team spirit, ‚Äòcan-do attitude, and unwavering dedication to our business and our clients.




Growth Opportunities.

Our people are smart, ambitious, and have big career goals. We not only encourage a culture of openly talking about our career aspirations but one where we truly invest in the continuous learning, development, and growth of our people.




Our Work Environment.

Let‚Äôs face it. We spend a lot of our time working, so the atmosphere is everything! We believe in cultivating a work environment that makes our people feel comfortable, engaged, appreciated, and happy.




Company Culture & Core Values.

Our company culture and core values are the core of our identity. They define who we are, how we engage with each other and our clients, and how we conduct business every day.




What We Offer




Market-competitive pay structure s
Paid Vacation & Sick Leaves
Maternity, Parental and/or Adoption Leave Top-Up Program
100% Employer-Paid Health Benefit Plan
Retirement Savings Plans with Employer Matching Scheme
Ongoing Financial Wellness Seminars
Corporate Discounted Programs + Wellness Program
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for our employees and their families!




At Teranet, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we live and serve. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.




Come As You Are. We Like You that Way!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Business System Analyst

Location: Toronto, Canada




Note: We need strong SQL, Data Mapping experience. Please look for candidates with Data experience. This is not a regular/functional Bas.




Looking for candidates with 10+ years exp minimum.




Description:

10+yrs of experience strong in SQL, Data Mapping, Data Model and strong in writing SQL Queries with strong Banking background.

Primary Skills

Experience in Finance (Mgmt reporting, Risk Reporting, Capital and Forecasting areas, Risk or Finance Models) area

Exposure of working in a financial institution with business, technology and enterprise stakeholders

Experience of working with Business users for Requirements Elicitation and Data Requirements.

Understanding of Data Modeling concepts

Requirements Gathering in the context of mapping business requirements to technology sources, interactions with source systems and business users

Working in a SaFE Agile or Product oriented environment with focus on functional mapping, TSDs, RTMs and Estimation techniques

Strong SQL knowledge, involving complex joins and analytical functions.

Good understanding of Data Flow, Data Model, and database applications

working knowledge of Databases like Oracle and Netezza

Strong Comms and Documentation skills

Working with users who are predominantly based in EST timezone

Secondary Skills

Conceptual knowledge of ETL and data warehousing, working knowledge is added advantage

Finance CFA or related certifications is a plus.

Exposure to tools like Manta, Neo4J, Data Bricks, Collibra, EDM , Data Lineage tools is plus.

Experience of working with Business users for Requirements Elicitation and Data Requirements.

Understanding of Data Modeling concepts

Requirements Gathering in the context of mapping business requirements to technology sources, interactions with source systems and business users

Working in a SaFE Agile or Product oriented environment with focus on functional mapping, TSDs, RTMs and Estimation techniques

Strong SQL knowledge, involving complex joins and analytical functions.

Good understanding of Data Flow, Data Model, and database applications

working knowledge of Databases like Oracle and Netezza

Strong Comms and Documentation skills

Working with users who are predominantly based in EST timezone

Secondary Skills

Conceptual knowledge of ETL and data warehousing, working knowledge is added advantage

Finance CFA or related certifications is a plus.

Exposure to tools like Manta, Neo4J, Data Bricks, Collibra, EDM , Data Lineage tools is plus.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst/Business Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities

Lead end-to-end data analysis initiatives for KYC/AML compliance and client onboarding systems.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and transform them into functional specifications.
Drive data migration efforts, ensuring accuracy, harmonization, and adherence to data survivor rules.
Support Fenergo platform implementation and enhancements by mapping and transforming legacy data sources.
Create clear and concise documentation including user stories, EPICs, process flows, and use cases.
Contribute to agile scrum ceremonies, sprint planning, and retrospectives to ensure project alignment and velocity.







Required Skills:

Domain Expertise
Strong working knowledge of KYC/AML policies and client lifecycle management frameworks.
Hands-on experience with Fenergo platform and onboarding solutions.




Technical Skills
Proficient in SQL for querying and analyzing complex relational data schemas.
Capable of data mapping, transformation, and migration between legacy and target systems.
Skilled in process documentation, gap analysis, and converting business requirements into technical specs.




Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Finance, Business, or related field.
Previous experience in a banking or fintech environment.
Familiarity with project management and documentation tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inclusion without Exception




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer, and embraces diversity in race, nationality, ethnicity, gender, age, physical ability, neurodiversity, and sexual orientation, to create a workforce that reflects the societies we operate in. Our continued commitment to Culture and Diversity is reflected in our people‚Äôs stories across our workforce and implemented through equitable workplace policies and processes.




TCS is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world‚Äôs largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive-powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile‚Ñ¢ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS operates in 55 countries and employs over 607,000 highly skilled individuals, including more than 10,000 in Canada. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $30 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2025, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Job Description:




Must Have Technical/Functional Skills

Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. Information Systems, Business Analytics, Data Science).
7+ years of experience in data analysis and/or business analysis, with a focus on data governance.
Proven experience working with senior management (executive team) and leading data governance initiatives.
Deep understanding of data governance principles, frameworks, and best practices.
Extensive experience with data quality management, data profiling, and metadata management tools.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and data analysis tools (e.g Python with Pandas, R).
Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, with the ability to tailor communication to different audiences.
Experience with data governance tools (e.g., Collibra, Alation) is highly preferred.
Industry-recognized data governance certifications (e.g. CDMP) are a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities

"We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled individual for a Senior Data Analyst / Business Analyst role with a strong focus on data governance. This senior role requires a unique blend of advanced technical data analysis capabilities, exceptional business acumen, and strong communication skills to effectively bridge the gap between technical teams and senior business stakeholders, including the executive team. Candidate will be responsible for leading data governance initiatives, conducting complex data analysis, gathering and documentation of requirements, facilitating communication across teams, and ensuring data governance compliance."




Data Governance Leadership :
Lead and facilitate meetings with senior business stakeholders (executive team) and technical teams to define and implement data governance strategies.
Drive the development and implementation of data governance policies, standards, and procedures.
Champion data governance best practices and promote a data-driven culture within the organization.
Business Analysis :
Elicit, analyze, and document complex data governance requirements from business stakeholders at all levels, including the executive team.
Translate business needs into clear and concise technical specifications for data governance solutions.
Facilitate workshops and presentations to gather feedback, build consensus, and communicate data governance principles.
Create high-quality documentation, including meeting minutes, presentations, and reports for the executive team.
Data Analysis:
Conduct in-depth analysis of complex data to identify data quality issues, inconsistencies, and gaps.
Understanding of data quality dashboards and reports to monitor data governance metrics and provide insights to the executive team.
Perform data lineage analysis to understand data flow, dependencies, and potential impacts of data governance changes.
Develop a deep understanding of Critical Data Elements (CDEs), Metadata management, and data lineage within the Organization's data landscape.
Analyze data requirements for applications and reporting, ensuring alignment with data governance policies.
Communication and Collaboration :
Communicate effectively with technical and business stakeholders at all levels, including the executive team.
Build strong relationships with cross-functional teams, including data architects, engineers, and business users.
Present findings and recommendations to diverse audiences, tailoring communication style and content as needed.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualifications for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Senior Data Analyst ‚Äì Wealth & Asset Management




The Opportunity

We are on a journey to become a customer-centered digital leader. We‚Äôre looking for a driven, collaborative, and motivated Senior Data Analyst who is passionate about delivering strategic priorities, enabling business value, and seeing their projects/products come to life successfully.




What you‚Äôll be doing

Lead sessions with business stakeholders to gather, validate, and document requirements.
Develop and maintain Business Requirement Documents (BRD), source-to-target mappings (STM), and other data analysis documentation.
Ensure delivery of data assets that meet business needs and align with enterprise strategy.
Conduct data analysis, profiling, and metadata collection.
Drive UAT activities with the business and secure sign-off.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to ensure alignment and successful delivery.




Must-Have Qualifications

7‚Äì10 years of Data Analyst experience, ideally in Wealth Management (Retail, Retirement, Institutional, or General Accounts).
2‚Äì3 years of GenAI experience with Azure Cloud.
Proven experience in data-centric projects: Master Data Management, Data Integration, Data Warehousing, Reporting, and Big Data analytics.
Strong SQL skills ‚Äì ability to write and optimize complex queries.
Hands-on experience delivering data documentation artifacts under tight deadlines.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì both written and verbal ‚Äì across all levels.
Experience with major trading and performance platforms: Bloomberg Polar Lake, SimCorp Dimension, Findur, Apex, Eagle, Charles River, Sylvan, Calypso.
Experience building data infrastructure (data lakes, data warehouses).
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data profiling, and validation.
Deep understanding of integrating new data sources into enterprise data platforms.

Title: Analyst, Data and Analytics, Temporary full-time
Description:
Temporary Full Time

We are looking for an Analyst Data & Analytics on a temporary full-time basis for 12-months.

As an Analyst Data & Analytics, you will join Canada Life‚Äôs Canada Operations & Business Enablement, Data Analytics and Reporting team. In this role you will support all Canada Operations teams with the development, implementation, and maintenance of analytics solutions ranging from descriptive and diagnostic to predictive.

The Analyst, Data & Analytics supports decision making, monitors business performance, and provides actionable insights using analytics and statistical techniques.

In this role, you will assist in modelling, analysing, and predicting business processes. You will translate business requirements into data, reporting, and analytics projects, which you will support throughout their entire lifecycle.

This position requires the successful candidate to obtain Reliability Status security clearance. This is a personnel security status that is required before an employee can gain access to‚ÄØProtected B‚ÄØinformation, assets or work sites as outlined by the Government of Canada website.

What you will do:


Translate business needs into data requirements, collect, integrate, clean, explore, model, and analyze large datasets and visualize results and present to business leaders
Build, implement and maintain data models, custom reports, and dashboards
Work with large datasets that are not consistent, clean, or fully modelled
Communicate effectively and demonstrate critical thinking and business acumen.
Define, implement, and monitor metrics and KPIs and ensure ongoing strategic alignment with short and long-term business objectives
Enable effective, efficient working relationships with business partners
Work closely with senior leaders to understand business drivers and enable them to make decisions based on data
Support projects throughout the entire analytics lifecycle
Present and communicate insights and recommendations in a visual and simplified manner


What you will bring:


1-3 years of relevant experience and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field of study, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate (PL-300) certification is preferred
Demonstrated experience in working with data analytics tools (SQL, Python), Databases (SQL Server), Cloud (Azure, Databricks), data visualisation tools (Power BI) with experience at creating interactive dashboards
Ability to write efficient SQL and Python queries to extract, integrate, and transform data from multiple sources, and to automate data pipelines
Proficiency in Power BI, Data Modelling, Power Query, and DAX
Experience working with raw data and manipulating large datasets
Good knowledge in data analytics and statistical modelling
Strong communication and presentation skills
Proven ability to learn quickly and independently and handle multiple priorities in a challenging work environment
Experience within the Financial Services sector would be an asset


The base salary for this position is between $52,800.00 - $97,700.00 annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today!

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You‚Äôre part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you‚Äôll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It‚Äôs our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that‚Äôs trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves‚ÄØthe financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we‚Äôre one of Canada‚Äôs leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.‚ÄØ

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee‚ÄØhas the opportunity to‚ÄØreach their potential.‚ÄØ

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Canada Life policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com.

Canada Life‚ÄØwould like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD86582

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Canada. This is a hybrid full-time role, reporting to the Sr. Manager of Customer Analytics. As a Business Intelligence Analyst Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to provide valuable insights into user behavior, their product usage patterns, and identifying opportunities for growth. You will help create dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to the stakeholders. Furthermore, you will use your expertise in creating and editing visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, and transforming data sets into visually compelling visuals. You will also provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with teams to understand business needs and requirements for data analysis
Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Create and edit visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, to provide visual representations of data insights
Transform quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals that effectively communicate important information
Use advanced statistical techniques to analyze and interpret complex datasets
Provide expert-level visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data visualization needs and provide recommendations on the most effective visual representation of data
Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines
Communicate complex data insights through visually compelling presentations and reports, tailored to different audiences


Minimum Requirements


Bachelor's/ Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role
Expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation
Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js
Experience working with large datasets and proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Samples / examples showcasing previous data analysis and visualization projects


Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software ‚Äì from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk ‚Äì it‚Äôs at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you‚Äôre an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk‚Äôs competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate‚Äôs experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Sales Careers

Working in sales at Autodesk allows you to build meaningful relationships with customers while growing your career. Join us and help make a better, more sustainable world. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/careers/sales

Diversity & Belonging

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Furthermore, you will use your expertise in creating and editing visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, and transforming data sets into visually compelling visuals. You will also provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with teams to understand business needs and requirements for data analysis
  • Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
  • Create and edit visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, to provide visual representations of data insights
  • Transform quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals that effectively communicate important information
  • Use advanced statistical techniques to analyze and interpret complex datasets
  • Provide expert-level visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations
  • Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data visualization needs and provide recommendations on the most effective visual representation of data
  • Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines
  • Communicate complex data insights through visually compelling presentations and reports, tailored to different audiences

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor's/ Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role
  • Expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation
  • Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js
  • Experience working with large datasets and proficiency in SQL
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
  • Samples / examples showcasing previous data analysis and visualization projects

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software ‚Äì from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk ‚Äì it‚Äôs at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you‚Äôre an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk‚Äôs competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate‚Äôs experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Sales Careers

Working in sales at Autodesk allows you to build meaningful relationships with customers while growing your career. Join us and help make a better, more sustainable world. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/careers/sales

Title: Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Description

Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto‚Äôs subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.

At Metrolinx, equity, diversity and inclusion are essential to living our values of serving with passion, thinking forward and playing as a team.

CPG‚Äôs workforce is made up of driven and dedicated professionals who care deeply about working together to deliver infrastructure and make a positive impact in our communities. Join us as we build a knowledgeable and collaborative team that courageously changes how transit projects will be delivered.

This role is accountable for providing support to the Senior Business Intelligence Developer by assisting with the development of BI tools/applications, reports and transformation of data from source to visualization. This role requires a systematic understanding of the data and the transformation processes which form the foundation of our reporting. It is expected to collaborate with various teams across CPG to establish dynamic reporting, develop KPIs and proactively work towards applying Power Platform tools to enable good-quality data collection, and to improve data transformation/integration efficiency.

What will I be doing?


Lead the design, development, and delivery of Power BI dashboards and reports‚Äîfrom concept to deployment‚Äîensuring alignment with business objectives and stakeholder needs.
Collaborate with Business Analysts and cross-functional teams to gather, analyze, and translate complex business requirements into actionable BI solutions.
Integrate and transform data from multiple sources (on-premises and cloud) using Power Query, DAX, and advanced data modeling techniques to enable effective data visualization and decision-making.
Conduct thorough data profiling, cleansing, and validation to ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity across reports and dashboards.
Develop complex and interactive visuals that provide actionable insights, support KPI tracking, and drive performance improvement.
Prepare and execute user acceptance testing plans and address issues identified during testing to ensure solution quality and reliability.
Document technical solutions, data models, and development standards in alignment with business requirements and SOPs.
Continuously evaluate and implement emerging BI tools, trends, and best practices to optimize solution design, enhance scalability, and drive innovation in analytics delivery.



What Skills and Qualifications Do I Need?


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related STEM discipline ‚Äî or an equivalent combination of education, training, and professional experience.
Minimum of four (4) years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, and solving complex quantitative business challenges, preferably within the transportation, construction, or public sector industries.
Proven track record in developing interactive dashboards and BI solutions that drive actionable insights. Proficiency in Power BI, including DAX and Power Query (M) is preferred.
Strong experience with database management, data modeling, analytical processing, and ETL/ELT frameworks, including integrating and transforming data from multiple sources.
Familiarity with Power Platform tools (Power Apps, Power Automate) and Microsoft Fabric is considered an asset.
High attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills, with a proactive approach to continuous improvement and innovation.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present complex data and insights clearly and effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders, including senior leadership.



Don‚Äôt Meet Every Requirement?

If you‚Äôre excited about working with Metrolinx but your past experience doesn‚Äôt quite align with every qualification of this posting, we encourage you to apply. You just might be the right candidate for this or other roles. We are always looking for great talent to join our team.

We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from members of equity-deserving communities, including those who identify as Indigenous, Black, racialized, women, people with disabilities, and people with diverse gender identities, expressions and sexual orientations.

Accommodation

We value the unique skills and experiences each person brings to Metrolinx and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. We are committed to the requirements of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act so if you require accommodation during the hiring process, please let our Recruitment team know by contacting us at: 416-202-5601 or email hr.recruitment@metrolinx.com .

Application Process

All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time-sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate.

For Internal applicants, with the recent implementation of the Internal Mobility Policy, the internal recruitment process has changed for non-union roles. Candidates must be in their current role for 12 months prior to applying for another role and each applicant must be in good standing (not participating in a Performance Improvement Plan). Please review all provisions of the policy before submitting your application.

Should it be determined that any background information provided is misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

WE ARE AN EQUITABLE AND INCLUSIVE EMPLOYER.

Title: Digital & Data Business Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Digital & Data Business Analyst

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 36535

In every role, McCainers are ambitious, curious, and passionate about creating exceptional work experiences - together. With a customer-first mindset, we make doing business with McCain easy.

About The Role.

McCain has embarked on a digital transformation journey. In the past 3-5 years, global digital systems have been implemented and enable to capture lots of data from our growers and their fields. As part of this transformation, we are elevating the way that we use digital & data to drive value and enhance decision-making across our global agriculture business. Our key objective is to transform data into actionable insights and effective action plans.

McCain is an international company with a world-wide presence, with sourcing taking place in multiple key regions such as North America, South America, Europe, India, Australia-New Zealand, South Africa. Within agriculture, there are some regional specificities and nuances which make the work more challenging. This position of Global Digital & Data Business analyst will focus on McCain Grower Relationship and Sourcing activity pillar, working closely with our internal regional teams and their grower partners.

We are seeking a curious, creative and innovative data-driven individual with a proven background in analytical thinking, problem solving, and communication skills.

The Global Agriculture Digital & Data Business Analyst will play a key role in integrating a data perspective into our agriculture business processes to drive sustainable raw supply, cultivate grower relationships, and enhance sustainability and re-generative practices. This role will be key to transform our agriculture business to be a data-led business around the world. You will work with cross-functional and - regional teams, as well as our technology team to support the digital transformation roadmap. This role will focus on building operational metrics, operational reports and processes to leverage data for actionable insights and ensure decision-makers in Grower relationship and Sourcing can make data-driven decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing.


Define the right process indicators to drive improvement actions that are aligned with McCain‚Äôs Agriculture efficiency goals.
Map the data points that are required to calculate performance indicators.
Act as a global GRM (Grower Relationship Management) data lead to ensure consistency and standardization of key business data. Be the custodian of the GRM business data model.
Serve as a data subject-matter expert on GRM & sourcing business processes.
When global digital systems are implemented collaborate with the global technology and analytics team to identify data sources and ensure a seamless process for accessing the right data points.
When global digital systems are not implemented, collaborate with our regional teams to define ways to track data points in a business acceptable manner.
Propose with the Global Product Manager in charge of this pillar, the analytics and reporting strategy through PowerBI dashboards and standard reporting tools.
Design and oversee the development of intuitive, user-friendly operational dashboards that meet business needs and drive continuous improvements to increase user engagement and adoption.
Develop wireframes of analytics outputs to ensure alignment of business requirements.
Support user training and adoption of reporting tools.
Build regional business relationships to identify value-driven analytics.
Distill data to share actionable operational insights with global and regional Ag stakeholders, including GRM agriculture scorecards. Be prepared to improve data literacy across all regions.
Work with the Data Governance team to identify and support resolving data quality issues at the source and in a timely manner.
Lead medium-scale data-driven projects, in its scope of responsibility, closely collaborating with the technology, analytics and regional teams.


What You‚Äôll Need To Be Successful.


Educational background: a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data & Analytics, or a related field. A master's degree can be a plus.
Data Analysis: experience with data analysis, business data modeling, and data visualization tools. Familiarity with SQL and other data query languages is an asset.
Power BI: 2+ years of hands-on experience with Power Bi will be a plus.
Project Management: experience in project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.
Communication: excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels. Comfortable working with business stakeholders across a range of data and analytics experience.
Experience in conducting business process owner interviews, facilitating requirement gathering sessions, documenting functional data model, and creating user stories.
Ability to translate technical concepts into business language.
Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking to identify business needs and propose effective solutions.
Experience working in a regional (multi-country) or global role.
Familiarity with the food/agriculture industry, as this can help in understanding specific business requirements and processes.
Customer focused, collaborative, entrepreneurial, and have a result driven mindset.
Aware of data best practices and able to identify areas of opportunity.
An excellent communicator, with the ability to translate business needs into data solutions.
Accountable and have a ‚Äúget things done‚Äù attitude. This role is about supporting change, finding solutions and getting your business leaders the data they need to make informed decisions.
‚ÄúHands-on‚Äù with data mapping, dashboard design, and working with the technology team to deliver on data initiatives.


About McCain.

Click Here to learn more about McCain and how we provide you with opportunities to make an impact that matters.

Leadership principles.

At McCain, our leadership principles guide how we engage with customers, collaborate as a team, and achieve success. We focus on understanding customer needs, driving innovation, empowering people, and taking ownership to clear obstacles and deliver results.

The McCain Experience.

We are McCain. This statement is a testament to our collective strength and our individual value. Your contributions play a vital role in our success. Our winning culture is rooted in authenticity and trust, empowering us to bring out the best in one another. Here, you‚Äôll find opportunities to learn, grow, and thrive. Join us and experience why we‚Äôre better together.

Compensation Package: $58,800.00 - $78,500.00 CAD annually + bonus eligibility

The above reflects the target compensation range for the position at the time of posting. Hiring compensation will be determined based on experience, skill set, education/training, and other organizational needs.

Benefits: At McCain, we‚Äôre on a mission to create a winning culture that puts employee safety and wellbeing at the heart of what we do, every day. We understand and appreciate that each person‚Äôs needs are unique and ensure our benefits & wellbeing programs reflect that. Employees are eligible for the following benefits: health coverage (medical, dental, vision, prescription drug), retirement savings benefits, and leave support including medical, family and bereavement. Wellbeing programs include vacation and holidays, company-supported volunteering time, and mental health resources. Coverages are aligned to country, provincial and state governing plans and can vary by work level, location and nature of the role. Additional benefit details available during the application process.

Your well-being matters to us, and we‚Äôre here to provide you with the necessary resources to support you in being your best self at work ‚Äî and at home.

McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. As a global family-owned company, we strive to be the employer of choice in the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that inclusion drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to find appropriate solutions.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with McCain‚Äôs Global Privacy Policy and Global Employee Privacy Policy, as applicable. You can understand how your personal information is being handled here.
