Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Join our Global Technology Strategy team!

This role offers a unique opportunity to lead data analytics initiatives that directly influence strategy and enterprise enablement. As a key contributor to the executive team to provide reporting and strategic reviews, you‚Äôll help shape data-driven decisions across technology, finance, procurement, and operations.

This position will drive data processes to enhance through reporting automation and advanced analytics, while collaborating with multi-functional teams. You‚Äôll gain exposure to high-impact projects and develop insights that support the organization‚Äôs mission to deliver smarter, more efficient outcomes.

Position Responsibilities


Design and maintain executive-level dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI, SQL, Excel, and Planview to deliver actionable insights.
Drive process automation and continuous improvement in analytics workflows to improve efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.
Collaborate with team members across departments to define critical metrics, scope analytics projects, and align data strategies with business goals.
Apply advanced analytics techniques, including machine learning and predictive modelling, to uncover trends to facilitate business and operational planning.
Communicate complex data findings clearly and effectively to senior leadership and business partners to support data-driven decisions.


Required Qualifications


Demonstrated ability in data analytics, business intelligence, or technology strategy roles.
Experience in leading and driving data presentation; discussions with executive leaders and present clear data stories.
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with tools such as Power BI, SQL, Excel, JIRA, and Planview for data analysis, reporting, and process automation.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business Analytics, or a related field; Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
Familiarity with enterprise data environments, including data warehousing, ETL processes, and executive-level reporting.


Preferred Qualifications


Other certifications in analytics and/or project management.


When You Join Our Team


We‚Äôll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.
We‚Äôll recognize and support you in a flexible environment where well-being and inclusion are more than just words.
As part of our global team, we‚Äôll support you in shaping the future you want to see.


About Manulife And John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Referenced Salary Location

Toronto, Ontario

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Salary range is expected to be between

$71,925.00 CAD - $119,875.00 CAD

If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.

Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
SATOV Consultants¬†‚Äì¬†Toronto, ON M5H 3B3




POSTING DATE: August 13, 2025




Company Overview




SATOV is a growing management consulting firm based in Toronto. Founded in 2002, the firm is recognized as the leading boutique strategy consultancy in Canada. Our work spans growth strategy, operational excellence and M&A advisory. In addition to a group of recurring corporate clients, we have a strong and growing private equity practice with funds in Canada and the United States.¬†




The SATOV value proposition is based on providing top-tier expertise with a practical edge: advice is valuable, but help is better.




Our internal culture is intense and performance-driven, but also close-knit and familial. Employees at all levels work together very closely on projects. The leadership of the firm is transparent about the strategy and operations of the firm. Team members are expected to participate frequently in business development and other firm-building activities.¬†¬†




Our in-house research team plays a pivotal role in driving insight-led strategies that guide major investment and business decisions. Our clients are in the consumer goods and retail sectors along with chain healthcare, and real estate. We also partner with our strategy clients to serve private equity firms and their portfolio companies.




Responsibility Overview




As a Consumer Insights Analyst at SATOV, you will play a crucial role in our projects, taking ownership of substantial research workstreams and demonstrating proficiency in storytelling and insights related to critical consumer research, including social trends, statistics, and modeling. You will work closely with other analysts, managers, or partners to set project parameters and touch points, gradually working more independently to deliver comprehensive solutions to our clients.




You will be responsible for hands-on, end-to-end project involvement, from proposal or brief to final report. We prioritize providing practical advice based on strong analytics.




Additionally, you will engage in qualitative research, including IDIs, focus groups, and ethnographies. This will involve project design, recruiting, moderating, engaging participants, analyzing and reporting findings.




What You‚Äôll Bring

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience working in a consumer research company

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good understanding of consumer research process

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Undergraduate or postgraduate degree

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong competency in Excel, PowerPoint, Displayr (or SPSS)

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong organizational skills, especially in self-organization and time management

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong analytical skills and the ability to craft compelling narratives

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey complex analyses and insights effectively

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Perseverance and goal orientation, with a focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for clients and the firm

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong research capabilities to gather and synthesize relevant information

If you are ready to make an impact and contribute to transformative strategies for leading organizations, we invite you to apply and join our passionate team at SATOV Consultants!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Competitive, plus participation in company-wide bonus program

Benefits:

Dental care
Long Term Disability insurance
Extended health care
Paid time off

Work Location: In person. You will be expected to be in the office 3 or more days per week




Application deadline: August 29, 2025

Expected start date: TBD




Application requirements

SATOV WEBSITE POSTING

Send application materials to: insights@satovconsultants.com




Resume
Cover letter that outlines why you want to join our firm and answers one or both of the following:
Client Project: Describe one project you have worked on over the past 12-18 months that was interesting to you. What was the problem, the research path and outcome? Why was this interesting to you?
Future of Consumer Insight Research: What 2-3 changes, if any, do you see in the consumer insight industry in the short-term? Beyond or considering aggregators, DIY platforms, growing AI capabilities what is next for our industry?

Responsibility Overview


As a Consumer Insights Analyst at SATOV, you will play a crucial role in our projects, taking ownership of substantial research workstreams and demonstrating proficiency in storytelling and insights related to critical consumer research, including social trends, statistics, and modeling. You will work closely with other analysts, managers, or partners to set project parameters and touch points, gradually working more independently to deliver comprehensive solutions to our clients.


You will be responsible for hands-on, end-to-end project involvement, from proposal or brief to final report. We prioritize providing practical advice based on strong analytics.


Additionally, you will engage in qualitative research, including IDIs, focus groups, and ethnographies. This will involve project design, recruiting, moderating, engaging participants, analyzing and reporting findings.


What You‚Äôll Bring

¬∑      Experience working in a consumer research company

¬∑      Good understanding of consumer research process

¬∑      Undergraduate or postgraduate degree

¬∑      Strong competency in Excel, PowerPoint, Displayr (or SPSS)

¬∑      Strong organizational skills, especially in self-organization and time management

¬∑      Strong analytical skills and the ability to craft compelling narratives

¬∑      Excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey complex analyses and insights effectively

¬∑      Perseverance and goal orientation, with a focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for clients and the firm

¬∑      Strong research capabilities to gather and synthesize relevant information

If you are ready to make an impact and contribute to transformative strategies for leading organizations, we invite you to apply and join our passionate team at SATOV Consultants!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Competitive, plus participation in company-wide bonus program

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Long Term Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Work Location: In person. You will be expected to be in the office 3 or more days per week


Application deadline: August 29, 2025

Expected start date: TBD


Application requirements

SATOV WEBSITE POSTING

Send application materials to: insights@satovconsultants.com


  1. Resume
  2. Cover letter that outlines why you want to join our firm and answers one or both of the following:
  3. Client Project: Describe one project you have worked on over the past 12-18 months that was interesting to you. What was the problem, the research path and outcome? Why was this interesting to you?
  4. Future of Consumer Insight Research: What 2-3 changes, if any, do you see in the consumer insight industry in the short-term? Beyond or considering aggregators, DIY platforms, growing AI capabilities what is next for our industry?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team, responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on field technical data to support business stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have experience in data management, analysis, and visualization, with a strong technical foundation and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.




Key Responsibilities:




Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to support business stakeholders
Design and implement data management systems and processes to ensure data quality and integrity
Collaborate with teams to identify data requirements and develop solutions to meet business needs
Provide technical support and training to end-users on data management systems and tools
Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data management and analytics




Requirements:




2+ years of experience in data management, analysis, or a related field
Strong technical skills, including proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, QuickBase)
Experience with database management systems and data governance principles
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a combination of education and experience
Experience with QuickBase, programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, C#), Agile development methodologies, or certifications in data management or data science can be an asset.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:




The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use of hands or fingers to handle, or feel objects, tools or controls and keyboarding; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs and ladders; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk and hear.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
Description:
MaintainX is the world leading mobile-first workflow management platform for industrial and frontline workers. We are a modern IoT enabled cloud based tool for maintenance, safety, and operations on equipment and facilities. MaintainX powers operational excellence for 12,000+ businesses including Duracell, Univar Solutions Inc., Titan America, McDonalds, Brenntag, Cintas, Michaels, and Shell.

We recently completed a $150 million Series D round, bringing our total funding to $254 million and valuing the company at $2.5 billion.

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst you will lead the development and optimization of our BI systems and reporting infrastructure. In this role, you will be responsible for designing data models, creating insightful dashboards, and analyzing large datasets to provide actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements, translate them into analytical solutions, and deliver clear, data-backed recommendations.

What You‚Äôll Do


Develop, implement, and maintain business intelligence reports and dashboards.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into BI requirements and solutions.
Design and implement dashboards to provide actionable insights for our sales and marketing teams.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data governance and quality standards.
Develop new metrics to better measure the performance of the business.
Stay up-to-date with the latest BI technologies and trends to ensure the company utilizes the best tools and practices.
Manage BI projects, including resource allocation, timelines, and deliverables.


About You


Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. A Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst or in a similar role.
Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Excellent SQL skills and experience with database management systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience building executive-level dashboards and full-funnel reporting.
Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of industry best practices and trends in business intelligence.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Competitive salary and meaningful equity opportunities.
Healthcare, dental, and vision coverage.
401(k) / RRSP enrollment program.
Take what you need PTO.
A Work Culture where:
You‚Äôll work alongside folks across the globe that reflect the MaintainX values, Smart Humble Optimist.
We believe in meritocracy, where ideas and effort are publicly celebrated.

About Us

Our mission is to make the life of blue-collar workers easier worldwide by creating software that meets their needs and realities. Our product is truly life-changing for 80% of the workforce that doesn‚Äôt work behind a desk and needs enterprise-grade software at their fingertips.

MaintainX is committed to creating a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst 0370-1212
Description:
HM Note: This hybrid contract role is three (3) days in office. Candidates resume must include first and last name.

Description

Background Information

The resources being requested will hold the business title of Lead, Data Specialist and will be responsible for the review, evaluation and readiness of data contributed to the Agency's Immunization Repository (IR).

The development and population of an Immunization Repository is a cornerstone within MOHs √¢one immunization record (Immunization Repository)' priority and is in line with Ontario's desired immunization future state. This work will be one of the forthcoming projects in the Immunization Repository Optimization Program, one of the key components of the Public Health Digital Platform (under Clinical Care Service delivery).

Must Haves


5 √¢ 7 years of experience in data analysis, data management and business intelligence
5 - 7 years working and applied knowledge of healthcare systems, healthcare integration standards such as HL7/FHIR, XML messaging principles, techniques and technologies
3 √¢ 5 years of demonstrated clinical data expertise in both project based and operational responsibilities.
3-5 years of demonstrated experience working with health system technologies (e.g. HIS technologies, LIS, EMR); including Integration Engines or Interface technologies.
Knowledge or experience with immunization workflows and associated business processes within pharmacies, hospitals or health records, preferred


Responsibilities


Works in partnership with clients, advising them on information technology in order to meet their business objectives or overcome problems, work to improve structure and efficiency of an organization's I&IT systems.
The I&IT Consultant may be used to provide strategic guidance to organizations with regard to Information Management & IT technology, IT infrastructures and the enablement of major business processes through enhancements to IT.
Provides subject matter expertise in their field and highly expert technical assistance.


General Skills


Acts as the technical advisor/expert on all aspects of a specific deliverable
Provide the quality assurance/quality control of specific deliverables
Anticipates and resolves problems to ensure that the deliverables are completed within budget, to the highest quality, meeting or exceeding expectations
Develops processes and procedures for implementing deliverables
Prepares reports and presentations including options, recommendations, implementation plans, etc.
Works with clients to define the scope of a project and to determine requirements
Defines software, hardware and network requirements
Analyzes I&IT requirements giving independent and objective advice on the use of I&IT
Designs, tests, installs and monitors new systems and develops solutions and implementation of new systems
Familiar with change-management principles and methodology
Knowledge and understanding of Information Management principles, concepts, policies and practices
Demonstrates excellent time management, with the ability to manage tight deadlines and prioritize multiple projects.
Apply knowledge of Health Standard message conformance tooling (e.g., Caristix, XMLSpy, 7Edit, etc.).
Experience managing programs with large complex governance structures and many stakeholders.


Required Experience / Evaluation Criteria


5 √¢ 7 years of experience in data analysis, data management and/or business intelligence.: 25 Points
5 - 7 years working and applied knowledge of healthcare systems, healthcare integration standards such as HL7/FHIR, XML messaging principles, techniques and technologies.: 25 Points
3 √¢ 5 years of demonstrated clinical data expertise in both project based and operational responsibilities.: 20 Points
3-5 years of demonstrated experience working with Health System technologies (e.g. HIS technologies, LIS, EMR); including Integration Engines or Interface technologies.: 20 Points
Knowledge or experience with immunization workflows and associated business processes within pharmacies, hospitals or health records, preferred.: 10 Points


Deliverables


The resource will be responsible for the review, evaluation and readiness of data contributed to the Agency's current and future repositories as well as specific deliverables including:
Working with Ministry to Profile Panorama data, estimate durations, and assess readiness for migration to EHR-IR.
Mapping data fields and transformation logic to EHR-IR.
Aligning and documenting validation rules and business logic across systems.
Defining data quality metrics and reporting requirements for post-migration monitoring.
Documentation deliverables including:
Data migration specification (Proof of Concept)
Implementation Plan (Proof of Concept)
Sample Data Extracts
Data Mapping Specification
Data Quality Monitoring and Reporting Plan
Documentation of all deliverables as well as knowledge transfer at the end of the assignment


Knowledge Transfer Details


The resource will ensure full knowledge transfer is provided to the Ontario Health team before end of engagement. Some of this might occur at the end of the engagement but will also be shared as information is obtained/consolidated. Key deliverables will be shared with team.
The resource must provide all related documentation as part of Knowledge transfer protocol. Documents will be reviewed by the appropriate leads and signed off by manager/director.
The resource will work collaboratively with the Ontario Health team throughout the assignment and ensure key deliverables, milestones, and documentation are shared.
A walkthrough of any demos, development, etc. will be required before the end of the engagement.


Must Haves


5 √¢ 7 years of experience in data analysis, data management and business intelligence
5 - 7 years working and applied knowledge of healthcare systems, healthcare integration standards such as HL7/FHIR, XML messaging principles, techniques and technologies
3 √¢ 5 years of demonstrated clinical data expertise in both project based and operational responsibilities.
3-5 years of demonstrated experience working with health system technologies (e.g. HIS technologies, LIS, EMR); including Integration Engines or Interface technologies.


Nice To Have


Knowledge or experience with immunization workflows and associated business processes within pharmacies, hospitals or health records, preferred

Title: Associate Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
John Hancock Manulife Investment Management is a premier provider of asset management and investment strategies. The Global Business Intelligence Team, as part of the wider Global Retail Sales Enablement Function, responsible for providing in-depth analysis, commentary and reporting solutions that can surface insight for a variety of key customers across the business, including senior management, sales leadership, wholesalers, marketing, product and finance. The team also maintains the integrity of the firm‚Äôs advisor and trade data through a robust data stewardship program, as well as enabling flawless integration of end-to-end reporting processes to ensure the data quality and consistency between source and operational systems.

The Role

This role will be primarily responsible for collaborating with our key partners and technology organizations to scope and analyze requirements and design fit for purpose solutions that fit within our tech stack, owning development from discovery to delivery. Analysts will collaborate with partners to translate business needs into meaningful, analytic solutions. As part of this end-to-end workstream they will also develop detailed sales and CRM reports and use tools like Tableau, Salesforce CRMA and Power BI, to present and visualize findings.

Development will support prescriptive business intelligence by efficiently explaining past performance and driving commercial decision making. This includes building tools that help identify target customer segments, recommend products, and advise on sales strategies ‚Äì drawing on assets, sales, and redemptions data as well as market trends. Regular financial and distribution reporting includes compensation tracking, bonus calculation and goal/target setting and monitoring.

Position Responsibilities

The successful candidate for this position will be an analytical problem solver, have a general understanding of financial services /operations, and strive to deliver solutions that drive commercial impact. You‚Äôll be proactive and adaptable BI professional, with ability to understand the business context of the data and the technical delivery of solutions.

Confident of learning an evolving business environment, where transformation is ongoing and technology can help craft business operations by becoming data driven. Experience across BI tools and data platforms as well as understanding how data flows/used for different use cases is useful. Strong collaborator and a focus on delivering value will be key to prioritizing high impact work, building relationships with our partners and owning projects.

Discovery & Analysis


Business Analysis and Use Case Development
Efficiently collect and develop requirements based on working sessions, interviews, etc. to understand the need.
Skilled at data exploration; able to quickly transform and synthesize data from various sources and identify efficient data structures to support end-state reporting needs.
Comfortable with ambiguity and possess a ‚Äúfigure it out‚Äù mentality.


Design & Development


Understanding of system design, analysis, and user testing.
Hands-on experience crafting, developing, implementing, and supporting dashboard reporting solutions.


Partnering & Collaboration


Collaborate and build strong working relationships with business partners/vendors.
Understand what the various business functions we support need and work with tech on delivering solutions.
Ability to influence and negotiate to meet project deadlines.


Required Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
SQL server and/or business intelligence reporting tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Qliksense, alteryx).
Microsoft Office suite as well as Visio or other process mapping tools
Ability to communicate and interface professionally vertically and horizontally across the organization.


When You Join Our Team


We‚Äôll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.
We‚Äôll recognize and support you in a flexible environment where well-being and inclusion are more than just words.
As part of our global team, we‚Äôll support you in shaping the future you want to see.


About Manulife And John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Referenced Salary Location

Toronto, Ontario

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Salary range is expected to be between

$61,350.00 CAD - $102,250.00 CAD

If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.

Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.

  • As part of our global team, we‚Äôll support you in shaping the future you want to see.

About Manulife And John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Referenced Salary Location

Toronto, Ontario

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Salary range is expected to be between

$61,350.00 CAD - $102,250.00 CAD

If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.

Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Clio is more than just a tech company‚Äìwe are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

What your team does:

The Marketing Analytics and Insights team is responsible for marketing attribution and performance measurement. This team leads marketing efficiency analysis that enables channel and budget optimization. The Marketing organization relies on this team for insights on the full marketing funnel.

As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing marketing performance, developing actionable insights, and supporting data-driven decision-making across the marketing organization. You will collaborate closely with marketing, product, and web teams to drive data-informed decisions that improve the customer journey and maximize marketing ROI.

What you‚Äôll work on:


Website Analytics: Leading in-depth set up of website events, analysis of website traffic, user behavior, and conversion funnels using tools like Google Analytics, Segment, Amplitude similar platforms.
Marketing Performance Analysis: Analyzing marketing program performance metrics to identify areas for optimization and recommend testing methodologies to maximize program effectiveness.
Attribution Modeling: Assisting in developing and refining marketing attribution models to accurately measure the impact of marketing activities across various channels.
Data Reporting & Dashboards: Supporting the creation and maintenance of automated dashboards and reporting mechanisms to track real-time marketing performance.
Collaboration & Insights: Working closely with marketing subteams to assess data needs and provide actionable insights that inform marketing strategies and decisions.
Process Improvement: Contributing to the development and implementation of data collection processes and automation solutions to streamline analysis and reporting workflows
Automation and AI integration


What you bring:


3‚Äì5 years of experience in marketing analytics preferably in Saas, with a significant focus on website analytics and multi-touch attribution.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Looker, Salesforce, and other marketing technology platforms.
Analytical Expertise: Strong ability to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, and translate findings into actionable insights.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present data insights to stakeholders at all levels.
Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio‚Äôs Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:


Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office minimum 2 days per week on our Anchor Days.
Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
$2000 annual counseling benefit
RRSP matching and RESP contribution
Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years


The full salary range* for this role is $80,100 to $94,200 to $108,300 CAD.Please note salary bands may differ based on location and local currency. Additionally, benefit offerings may differ depending on the employee's location.


We aim to hire all candidates between the minimum and the midpoint of the full salary range. We reserve the midpoint to the maximum of the salary band for internal employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on individual experience and skillset of the candidate. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.


Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

Disclaimer: We only communicate with candidates through official @clio.com email addresses.

Title: Analyst, Data Science and Analytics Solutions
Description:
Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here


high-performance, people-focused culture
our commitment that equity, diversity, and inclusion are fundamental to our work environment and business success, which helps employees feel valued and empowered to be their authentic selves
learning and development initiatives, including workshops, Speaker Series events and access to LinkedIn Learning, that support employees‚Äô career growth
membership in HOOPP‚Äôs world class defined benefit pension plan, which can serve as an important part of your retirement security
competitive, 100% company-paid extended health and dental benefits for permanent employees, including coverage supporting our team's diversity and mental health (e.g., gender affirmation, fertility and drug treatment, psychological support benefits of $2,500 per year, parental leave top-up, and a health spending account).
optional post-retirement health and dental benefits subsidized at 50%
yoga classes, meditation workshops, nutritional consultations, and wellness seminars
the opportunity to make a difference and help take care of those who care for us, by providing a financially secure retirement for Ontario healthcare workers


Job Summary

The Plan Operations Analytics Group at HOOPP (Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan) is looking for an experienced individual to fill a permanent, full-time Data Scientist role for the Analytics Team. The team delivers insights, analytics, reporting, data governance and subject matter expertise in data warehouse knowledge.

The team‚Äôs principles are focused on delivering true stakeholder value in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. They value challenging the status quo, innovative solutions, team collaboration and practicality.

What You Will Do


Provides strategic Analytics such as forecasts, projections and high-level overview as well as operational (e.g. processing or phone statistics) reporting to management
Provides daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual or ad hoc reporting as required by utilizing standard reports or builds. Extracts data from sources such as data warehouse, as well as converts operation-specific data into reports.
Undertake broad subject matter expertise in data and perform an in-depth analysis of data to gather insights and communicate results.
Provides analytics support and data solutions to all areas of HOOPP as required by analysis and communication, acting on requests for data and reporting information. Provides guidance on the structure of databases, drafting of queries, compiling of CRM operational type Analytics to all departments.
Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable
Provides statistical analysis and interpretation in clear user language on data information and provides written summary reporting as well as communication on that analysis. Ability to synthesize large datasets into clear actionable decision-making for presentation to Management.
Participates in the integration of multiple data sources (data warehouse, portals, dashboards, reports, systems) into specific solutions to answer reporting needs using all relevant data. This is to meet HOOPP‚Äôs immediate and future information needs in collaboration with IT.
Creates, develops and maintains Analytics platforms.


What You Bring

Analytical


Understands the why (curious, asks probing questions, digs deep, open-minded)
Ability to create clarity and get everyone on the same page
Excellent Requirements documentation (clear, concise)
Has strong trust and confidence in team and business.


Teamwork


Strong 1:1 working experience with Analysts, business leaders, stakeholders and management.
Provides honest, constructive feedback in an empathetic manner
Identifying and engaging in difficult conversations; Ability to table conflict or team tensions
Ability to improve Team Norms/processes by influencing


Additional Skills And Abilities


Able and comfortable in working with all levels of management to understand, and when needed negotiate, requirements and priorities
Solid communication skills to interact across organizations and offer insights to the business.
Knowledge of Excel, R, Python and MS SQL Server; familiarity with Analytics tools specifically Power BI
Knowledge of relational database structures and applications.
Competency in agile software development

Title: Analyst, Data Analytics - Alternate Solutions Group - 12 month term
Description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Who We Are

Within CIBC Global Markets, the Alternate Solutions Group was launched in 2013 with a mandate to develop innovative and creative technology-driven capital markets solutions. This group is an unconventional capital markets organization that combines the innovative spirit and agility of a FinTech startup with the financial strength and strong governance protocol of a major financial institution. ASG has been recognized as a global leader in providing disruptive technological capital markets solutions in several product areas including Cross Border Payments, Dynamic Currency Conversion, Multi-currency pre-paid cards, Foreign Cash & Precious Metals Online and white labeling thereof. ASG‚Äôs client base stretches from some of the largest banks in the world, to corporates to CIBC‚Äôs retail clients.

We are hiring a Data Analyst on the Data Science team within Conversion Services. This role will deliver transformational data capabilities to support business users and enable data-driven growth.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, you‚Äôll be on-site full-time.

How You‚Äôll Succeed


Data Collection & Analysis: You will collect, clean, and analyze data from a variety of sources to support our business objectives. You will play an active part in ensuring data quality through regular checks and thorough documentation. Additionally, you will support ad-hoc data requests and projects as needed, contributing to a collaborative and responsive team environment.
Data Processing & Modeling: You will develop and maintain Python scripts to support data processing, analytics, and modeling activities. You will also build and deploy machine learning models‚Äîsuch as regression, time-series, and classification models‚Äîto deliver predictive insights that drive value for our business groups.
Data Visualization & Reporting: You will create clear and compelling data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Power BI or Python libraries like Plotly Dash and Seaborn. In addition, you will assist in preparing reports and presentations for stakeholders, helping to communicate insights and support informed decision-making across the organization.
Collaboration & Growth: You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights that drive business outcomes. Working closely with senior data scientists, you will help develop and deliver transformational data analytics projects. Throughout your role, you will be encouraged to continuously learn and apply new analytical techniques and technologies, ensuring you stay at the forefront of industry advancements.


Who You Are


You have 1-2 years of experience working in data science, data analytics or in a similar role.
You have a Bachelor‚Äôs / Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
You have advanced knowledge and demonstrated experience working with Python for data analysis, engineering, and manipulation (e.g., pandas, numpy, scipy).
You have practical exposure to common machine learning models and packages (e.g., sklearn, xgboost, lightGBM, pycaret, ARIMA).
You are experienced with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) or Python visualization libraries (e.g., Plotly Dash, Seaborn).
You give meaning to data. You excel at uncovering insights from data, investigating complex problems, and transforming information into meaningful, actionable recommendations. You can communicate complex ideas in simple terms to senior business leaders and non-technical audiences.
You thrive in a fast paced, high pressure environment. You‚Äôre motivated to deliver your best while effectively balancing multiple priorities.
You are eager to learn. You keep pace with the latest trends in data science, technology, and the Capital Markets business.
You're motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values ‚Äì trust, teamwork and accountability.


What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential.


We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive compensation, a banking benefit*, wellbeing support and additional offers such as employee and family assistance programs and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
Subject to program terms and conditions


What You Need To Know


CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
We may ask you to complete an attribute-based assessment and other skills tests (such as simulation, coding, French proficiency, MS Office). Our goal for the application process is to get to know more about you, all that you have to offer, and give you the opportunity to learn more about us.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for candidates with strong technical expertise to fill this role. Below are the details of the position:

üè¶ Industry: IT

üíº Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

üíª Mode of Job: Hybrid

üìç Locations: Toronto ON

üìÖ Contract: 6 months with extension




Job Summary:

We are looking for a motivated and experienced professional who can drive delivery of strategic priorities, is passionate about customers, and takes pride in the successful implementation of data solutions that create real business impact.

Responsibilities / Individual Accountabilities

Lead sessions with business stakeholders to gather requirements and secure sign-offs.
Produce and maintain Business Requirement Documents (BRDs), Source-to-Target Mappings (STMs), and other data analysis documentation.
Ensure project teams deliver data assets that align with business requirements.
Liaise with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to drive alignment and clarity.
Conduct data analysis, data profiling, and metadata collection.
Lead User Acceptance Testing (UAT) activities with business partners and obtain approvals.

Must-Have Requirements

7‚Äì10 years‚Äô experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the Wealth Management domain (Retail, Retirement, Institutional, or General Accounts).
2‚Äì3 years‚Äô hands-on experience with Generative AI (GenAI) and Azure Cloud.
Proven track record delivering data-centric projects, preferably in capital markets or investment banking, including:
Master Data Management (MDM)
Data Integration
Data Warehousing & Reporting
Big Data environments for analytics
Strong ability to write and optimize complex SQL queries for analysis and reporting.
Experience producing high-quality data documentation deliverables within project deadlines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to engage at multiple organizational levels.
Knowledge of major trading platforms and investment systems such as Bloomberg PolarLake, SimCorp Dimension, Findur, Apex, Eagle, Charles River, Sylvan, Calypso.
Business analyst experience building data infrastructure, data lakes, or data warehouses.
Hands-on expertise in data modeling, data loading, data profiling, and data validation using SQL.
In-depth knowledge of integrating new data sources into data lakes or warehouses.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Governance Analyst

Location- Toronto, ON (Hybrid- 3 days onsite)




Job Description:




We are looking for a Data Governance Analyst:

The Data Governance Analyst is part of the Enterprise Data Governance Team at Canada Life and plays an essential role the advancement of our data strategy and maintenance of existing Data Governance Practices. This role provides the opportunity to balance enablement of our business with the governance of our data assets to ensure the trust and protection of the data in our care.

The successful candidate will join a skilled team of like-minded colleagues who are naturally curious, collaborative and strive to make sense of our data, protect it and work to enable the business to advance their data roadmaps.




What you will do

Support the development, maintenance, and enhancement our data governance policy, standards, processes, and practices.
Support the implementation and adoption of data governance across the enterprise
Work with technology and business users to ensure our data is understood and reflected in our Data Inventory to enable people to find what they need when they need it.
Support requirement definition and analysis as we build out our Connected Data Platform, connecting people to the data they need.
Identify opportunities to improve effectiveness of the data governance organization with focus on operational efficiency and collaboration
Provide front line support to our data community and translate complex topics into simple and effective statements that have impact
Support strategic decisions, issues, risks, and milestones related to data initiatives




What you will bring

1-4 years of applied data governance experience
Strong organizational Skills
Expert in Microsoft products (PowerPoint and Excel)
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Agile, practical, customer service-oriented mindset (doesn‚Äôt over complicate processes)
Passionately curious and excited to learn new things
Ability to work in a fast paced highly focused team
Experience in financial services and insurance is an asset
Data certification in Data Management or Data Governance an asset (e.g. DGSP or CDMP)
Working knowledge of data governance and management technology an asset (e.g. Collibra, Microsoft Purview)




Any specific tools/skillset:

Understanding of data governance principals.
Attention to detail.
Time management
Handling ambiguous information.
Analyzing and problem solving,
Metadata analysis and tagging
Microsoft products excel, Purview and using minimal SQL coding via Databricks to assist with developing regular expressions.
Utilizing Collibra or other data governance toolset
Ability to communicate technical details to a business user.
Monitoring and testing functionalities and environments




Role profile description:

Using Microsoft Purview Data Catalog Portal, work with the team to create a POC that aligns to the metadata strategy and establishing the cataloging/business glossary, tagging, metadata, necessary to meet the standard by working with the business stakeholders.




Cataloging activities include,

Reviewing applied classifications to a data element within Purview Data Catalog, apply sensitivity labels to a data element or data asset to adhere to Canada Life‚Äôs Data Policy, Information classification and handling standard, and Privacy guidelines.
Align the data elements to Canada Life‚Äôs Information Model for personal information.
Expansion of business glossary in publication




Tagging

Sensitivity levels as applicable Privacy guidelines, (example, Personal information sensitivity)
Data classification as applicable by Information
Data elements criticality




Metadata

Technical metadata
Business metadata
Operational metadata




Data Quality

Understands the concepts
Ability to promote DQ within the business
Execute DQ testing, monitoring and reporting
Assist business in resolving DQ issues

Title: Decision Support Analyst
Description:
Competition Number: 2025-032

Functional Area: Data & Digital

Location: 200 Front Street W, Toronto Ontario

Job Term: Permanent full-time

Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week

Bargaining Unit: AMAPCEO

Job Code: 5A004

Salary Range: $76,231 - $109,842 per year

Posting Status: Open

Posting Date: August 5, 2025




As a Decision Support Analyst, you will be accountable for conducting in-depth analysis of data to provide advice and interpretation for decision-making for an assigned supply chain category.




Other key responsibilities include:

Determining how decision support systems and approach (methodological and technical) will provide information required to make effective business decisions.
Translating requirements into applications that employ appropriate decision support and reporting tools.
Applying knowledge of quantitative and qualitative methods to identify opportunities for strategic sourcing.
Identifying key data elements needed to advance sourcing strategies and other initiatives in collaboration with the category management and supply chain operation teams.
Preparing complex and specialized documentation, reports, dashboards, and statistical analysis on a regular or ad hoc basis to support decision making.
Developing, codifying, and monitoring key performance indicators for measuring success of new and existing business and sourcing initiatives.
Providing analytic and consultative support to a broad spectrum of internal and external business partners.
Maintaining a broad understanding of the assigned category and utilizes that understanding to ensure decision support requirements are achieved.
Supporting Supply Ontario‚Äôs customer service standards, enabling client success and business/continuous improvement activities.




Successful candidates will demonstrate the following:

Degree in Computer/Information Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Economics, or related field.
5+ years of experience in writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries for large-scale data environments.
Proficient in building custom data processing logic using SQL and/or Python, including the development of user-defined functions and stored procedures.
Advanced proficiency and experience working with at least one of the following business intelligence, analytics, and reporting tools: Power Bi, Python.
Knowledge of Data Warehousing, ETL, Data Management, Cloud Environments.
Knowledge of Scala/Spark and Agile Methodologies, ideally having worked in an Agile team setting.
Knowledge of analytical techniques including both qualitative and quantitative analysis skills to critically review and analyze complex data and interpret results to identify implications.
Ability to gather, manipulate and analyze high volumes of data from a variety of sources and formulate data into clear, actionable insights and user-friendly visualizations or KPIs
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, VBA etc.).
Ability to present and explain technical information and complex analysis to diverse types of audiences in an easily understood user-friendly manner geared to the target audience.
Excellent consultation and collaboration skills.
Ability to manage work to meet deadlines and manage multiple competing priorities effectively.




Supply Ontario offers a competitive compensation package including benefits and defined benefit pension plan.




The selected candidate will be required to reside and work in Ontario and be legally eligible to work in Canada.

Candidates are required to provide references for verification, and to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

Please apply by August 19, 2025.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Supply Ontario endeavors to promote the principles of diversity and inclusion in all of our policies, practices, and the way we do business while ensuring compliance to the Canadian Human Rights Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code.




We are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve, and to promoting a diverse, inclusive, accessible, respectful, and equitable workplace.

We invite applications from all interested and qualified individuals, from all backgrounds, and walks of life. Your experiences are valuable, and we‚Äôre excited to learn how you might be able to lend your skills to further Supply Ontario‚Äôs mission and achieving its vision.

At Supply Ontario, we recognize and value the exceptional skills, dedication, and diverse perspectives that veterans bring to the workforce. We strongly encourage veterans to apply to join our team.




We are committed to providing employment practices and accommodation that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Human Rights Code. If you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process including in relation to the materials and processes to be used, please notify Human Resources at Talent Acquisition (CSCO) talentacquisition@supplyontario.ca.

If you request accommodation, Human Resources will consult with you to provide or arrange for suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account your accommodation needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
7shifts is a scheduling and payroll platform designed to help restaurant teams thrive. With an easy-to-use app and industry-specific solutions, 7shifts saves time, reduces errors, and helps keep costs in check for over 55,000 restaurants. Our mission is to simplify team management and improve performance for restaurants, with a long-term vision of creating a thriving restaurant industry through the power of connected & engaged teams.




As the Data Analyst at 7shifts, reporting to the Manager of Data & Analytics, you will act as a dedicated partner to our Payroll and Tips teams. You‚Äôll help them measure what matters, uncover meaningful insights, and identify opportunities to drive business impact. Your expertise will guide the development of KPIs, data best practices, research, reporting, and visualizations that inform decisions and move the team forward. You‚Äôll also be supported by a collaborative data team, including other analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, and leaders, who work together to enable data-driven decisions across the company.




What you‚Äôll do:

Conduct in-depth analyses using SQL and BI tools to identify trends, measure performance, and uncover actionable insights
Build, maintain, and enhance dashboards and recurring reports that provide accurate, timely, and business-relevant information
Develop and maintain data models using dbt and SQL to transform raw data into clean, reliable, and scalable datasets for analysis and reporting
Partner with teams across the organization to understand data needs, define analytical approaches, and deliver data-driven recommendations
Provide timely ad hoc analyses and contribute to building self-serve data tools and resources that empower teams to independently explore and use data
Validate, reconcile, and troubleshoot data to ensure accuracy and reliability in reporting and decision-making
Effectively present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and actionable way




What you bring:

Strong proficiency in SQL with the ability to write complex queries and work with large datasets
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (bonus if you‚Äôve used Thoughtspot)
Experience building and maintaining data models using dbt
Background in business, analytics, or a technical field
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Experience working in a SaaS or tech environment




It‚Äôd be even cooler if you had:

Experience working with Snowflake as a data warehouse
Familiarity with event analytics tools like Mixpanel or Amplitude
Experience working with Salesforce or other CRM tools




Our commitment to our Shifties:

Opportunity: Our product is evolving in exciting ways, and we‚Äôre focused on delivering even more value to restaurants. This momentum creates real opportunities to learn and grow. Whether you‚Äôre honing your craft or exploring new paths, you‚Äôll be supported and empowered to own your growth and impact a product shaping the future of the restaurant industry.
Challenge: We‚Äôre tackling real problems in a fast-moving, complex industry. The work is scrappy and ambiguous, but meaningful. You‚Äôll think critically, act with intention, and shape solutions that make a real difference for restaurant teams.
Culture: We‚Äôre proud to be recognized among the best workplaces in North America. Guided by our mission and values, we move fast to solve meaningful problems and celebrate wins together. Whether through in-office and remote events, team offsites like Sparks, or everyday moments of connection, we create space for shared growth, collaboration, and fun.
Equity: We‚Äôre a Series C, VC-backed SaaS company, and we believe everyone should share in the success they help create. When we build together, we grow together.
Health and Wellness: We support Shifties in and outside of work, knowing that what people need can change over time. From day one, you‚Äôll have access to benefits like health and dental, lifestyle spending accounts to a parental leave program built with flexibility in mind, to help you bring your best self to work.
Flexibility: Our team is intentional around how and where we work, whether remotely, in person, or a mix of both. We prioritize candidates who thrive in a hybrid work environment with offices in Saskatoon and Toronto, ensuring in-person collaboration and connection when possible. Plus, we offer a flexible vacation policy to encourage everyone to recharge when needed. Oh, and our ‚Äò90 Day Shift‚Äô program lets Shift work from (almost) anywhere because who wouldn‚Äôt want to trade their desk for a beach view once in a while?
Support: We set Shifties up for success with the tools they need, like the latest Apple tech, a home office setup, and some 7shifts swag to make it official. But support goes beyond day one. We‚Äôre serious about professional growth, offering coaching, feedback, development planning, and opportunities to grow from within.




We know you might not check every box, and that‚Äôs okay. If you‚Äôre excited about this role, inspired to contribute to a meaningful product, and eager to share ideas that drive real change, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. We‚Äôre building an inclusive team that reflects the diverse industry we serve, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds.




We thank you for your interest in joining the 7shifts team! Our privacy policy can be found here.

Title: Analyst, Data Strategy and Analytics
Description:
Proudly Canadian-owned, Enercare is committed to providing the best services, solutions and advice to make customer‚Äôs homes as comfortable as they can be. With Enercare Advantage, we provide affordable clean air and water solutions for homes and workplaces. We are committed to operating in an environmentally responsible way, including keeping as much waste out of landfills as possible, and giving back to the communities where we live and work. Enercare is about putting people first by listening to our customers, continuous improvement and making our organization a destination for building people‚Äôs careers.

Come and join one of North America's largest home and commercial services and energy solutions companies! We offer comprehensive benefits, a DC Pension Plan and savings match plan. If you are passionate about joining an organization committed to delivering 5 Star Customer Service, we would love to hear from you.

Role: Analyst, Data Strategy & Analytics

Reports to: Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Analytics

Status: Permanent, Full-Time

Division: Enercare Home and Commercial Services

Location: Markham

Summary

Reporting to Lead/Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Analytics, you will play a key role in a highly visible team within the organization to advance our business as we execute our data strategy. This is a great opportunity for an individual with a passion for using data to drive insights, presenting key learnings, and delivering transformational outcomes to our business.

You are an inquisitive and intellectually curious individual with analytics experience, excellent communications skills and good business acumen. With an agile-mindset, you are obsessed with data quality, pragmatic algorithms, as well as enjoy learning our business and operations with a go-and-see approach.

Accountabilities


Support ad-hoc analyses and dataset extraction for project support
Monitor business as usual tasks and activities. Detect and fix any issues related to daily reporting
Support and enhance of existing reports and dashboards based on evolving business needs
Have an open mind and a knack to collaborate effectively across internal and external partners to further capitalize on data assets
Handle ambiguity and apply first principles with structured approaches to solving problems


Qualifications

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
About the Role

The Data Governance Analyst will be part of the Enterprise Data Governance Team at Canada Life, playing a critical role in advancing our data strategy and maintaining data governance practices. This role balances enabling the business with ensuring the trust, protection, and discoverability of our data assets.

Key Responsibilities

Support the development, maintenance, and enhancement of data governance policies, standards, and processes.
Work with technology and business stakeholders to ensure data is properly reflected in the Data Inventory for accessibility.
Support requirements gathering and analysis for the Connected Data Platform.
Drive metadata management, cataloging, classification, and business glossary expansion using Microsoft Purview.
Apply sensitivity labels, classifications, and criticality tags to data elements in alignment with privacy and information policies.
Support data quality (DQ) initiatives: testing, monitoring, reporting, and issue resolution.
Provide front-line support to the data community, simplifying governance concepts for business users.
Identify opportunities to improve the efficiency and collaboration of the Data Governance function.

What You Bring

1‚Äì4 years of applied experience in Data Governance or Data Management.
Strong understanding of data governance principles (policy, classification, metadata, DQ).
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Purview (cataloging, tagging, metadata, glossary).
Exposure to Collibra or other governance tools.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint; basic SQL (Databricks preferred) for metadata and regex checks.
Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Ability to communicate technical details to business stakeholders clearly and effectively.
Agile, customer-service-oriented mindset with ability to work in fast-paced environments.

Nice-to-Have

Experience in financial services or insurance industry.
Data governance/management certifications (DGSP, CDMP).
Knowledge of privacy guidelines, information classification, and data handling standards.
Familiarity with data quality monitoring frameworks and operationalizing business glossaries.

Title: Associate, Business Intelligence (12-month contract)
Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you join CPP Investments, you are joining one of the world‚Äôs most admired and respected institutional investors. As a professional investment management organization, CPP Investments invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure its financial sustainability for generations of working and retired Canadians.

CPP Investments invests across regions and asset classes to build a globally diversified portfolio. It holds assets in public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and fixed income, and the CPP Fund is projected to reach $3.6 trillion in assets by 2050. The organization is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, S√£o Paulo, and Sydney.

CPP Investments successfully attracts, selects, and retains talented individuals from top-tier institutions worldwide. Join our team for access to:


Stimulating work in a fast-paced and intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
A hybrid-flexible work environment with an emphasis on in-person collaboration
A culture rooted in principles of integrity, partnership, and high performance
An organization with an important social purpose that positively impacts lives


If you have a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach work with the highest integrity, invest your career here.

Job Description

As an Associate, Business Intelligence, you will gather, analyze, manage, and report on financial related data to provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders, supporting their strategic decision-making processes. You will also deliver visual and dynamic analytical solutions by providing an integrated and independent view of key metrics with self-serve monitoring dashboards and reports.

Team Description

The team plays a vital role in delivering high-impact insights and solutions that support the Fund‚Äôs long-term performance and operational excellence. We sit at the intersection of data, technology, and strategic decision-making - collaborating with investment professionals, functional teams, and senior leaders across the organization. The team fosters a collaborative environment that encourages learning, mentorship, and cross-functional engagement. Whether we're enhancing portfolio analytics, improving operational workflows, or developing new capabilities, our work is grounded in CPP Investments‚Äô core values of integrity, partnership, and high performance.

Accountabilities


Support Product Owners with leading the analysis, prioritization, planning and delivery of new features and capabilities based on user needs.
Business analysis and Data Analysis to support requirement documentation for data extraction, profiling, transformation, and validation tasks.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and actionable insights from large datasets
Design and maintain data validation checks to ensure high-quality and reliable datasets.
Participate in testing of technology deliverables (e.g., user acceptance testing) and support documentation of results.
Partner effectively with multiple stakeholders to deliver effective and compelling presentations, creating advanced visual displays of complex quantitative information.
Independently develop and automate advanced reports, iteratively building and prototyping dashboards to provide insights at scale for complex situations, solving for analytical needs.
Lead and assist in the infrastructure for the storage, integration, and use of data and databases with the team.
Lead conversations with groups inside and outside the department to procure data, resolve technical challenges, and align on data needs, roles & responsibilities.
Manage your own workload to perform time-sensitive requests accurately and on time, while building effective working relationships within your team and across various groups at CPP Investments.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics and reporting to enhance skills and capabilities.


Qualifications


Undergraduate degree or college diploma in related field
5+ year of relevant experience
Relevant professional designation (e.g., MBA, CPA or CFA) or progression toward one considered an asset.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience working with SQL and working knowledge of Python is nice to have
Demonstrated ability to produce insightful analysis of business issues and suggest potential solutions for complex situations.
Knowledge and/or experience of Agile and Product Management concepts considered an asset.
Advanced experience working with large data sets, using superior analytical skills, having a strong attention to detail and ability to communicate complex topics


Additional Information

Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn.

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.
