Title: Finance Data Analyst (6-month Contract)
Description:
Seaspan teams are goal-driven and share a high-performance culture, focusing on building services offerings to become a leading asset manager. Seaspan provides many of the world's major shipping lines with alternatives to vessel ownership by offering long-term leases on large, modern containerships and pure car, truck carriers (PCTCs) combined with industry leading ship management serves. Seaspan's fleet has evolved over time to meet the varying needs of our customer base. We own vessels in a wide range of sizes, from 2,500 TEU to 24,000 TEU vessels. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Atlas Corp, Seaspan delivers on the company's core strategy as a leading asset management and core infrastructure company.

Position Description:

The Business Intelligence department is responsible for enabling the Enterprise Data & Analytics Strategy across the organization by providing unified approaches, tools, and standards for all facets of Seaspan‚Äôs data management and consumption. Within this department, the Finance Intelligence Team work in close partnership with overall finance departments, business units, and technology functions to support data-driven decision-making.

Reporting to the Finance Intelligence Lead, the Finance Data Analyst will play a critical role in developing high-quality, actional insights through robust data preparation, validation, and visualization. This role offers end-to-end ownership of the OpEx and Total Spend Dashboard development, providing hands-on experience across the full lifecycle of a Business Intelligence project ‚Äì from initial design to final delivery. By ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and usability across finance-related dashboards and reports, the Finance Data Analyst will enable the organization to make informed and timely decisions.

Job Responsibilities:


Prepare and validate financial data from NetSuite, Oracle EPM, Excel trackers, and legacy systems.
Standardize financial definitions, KPIs, and metric calculations across dashboards and reports.
Support documentation and drafting of business requirement documents in collaboration with business leads and BI developers.
Design dashboard mockups and layout suggestions using Power BI, aligning with business stakeholder input.
Provide visualization and UX design guidance to ensure business context is clearly reflected.
Assist in documenting business logic and maintaining data dictionaries to support data governance and long-term maintainability.
Reconcile financial data across multiple systems to ensure accuracy and trust in reporting outputs.
Support user acceptance testing (UAT), including feedback collection, bug tracking, and enhancement request documentation.
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and queries to validate dashboard logic and support business decision-making.


Requirements:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of professional experience in a relevant area such as Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Financial Systems support, or Financial Planning & Analysis is preferred.
Foundational understanding of corporate finance concepts, including corporate finance, financial reporting, management reporting and budgeting.
Hands-on experience with Power BI, including Power Query and dashboard design.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying, manipulation, and validation.
Strong visual/UX sensibility and ability to recommend actionable data visualizations.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and automation; experience with libraries such as pandas, numpy is an asset. Knowledge of scripting for financial modeling, process automation, or API-based data integration is preferred.
High attention to data accuracy and integrity, with an analytical and solution-oriented mindset.
Strong communication and documentation skills, with the ability to liaise between technical and business teams.
Self-starter capable of troubleshooting data issues independently and efficiently.


Additional Desired Qualifications:


Experience with financial planning systems or enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems such as NetSuite, Oracle EPM
Understanding data modeling concepts and dashboard lifecycle development.
Knowledge of best practices in data governance, documentation, and process automation.


Job Demands and/or Physical Requirements:


As Seaspan is a global company, occasional work outside of regular office hours may be required.


Compensation and Benefits package:

Seaspan‚Äôs total compensation is based on our pay-for-performance philosophy that rewards team members who deliver on and demonstrate our high-performance culture. The hiring range for this position is $76,000 - $90,000 CAD per annum (pro-rated for contract duration). The exact base salary offered will be commensurate with the incumbent‚Äôs experience, job-related skills and knowledge, and internal pay equity.

Seaspan Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status. We thank all applicants in advance. If your application is shortlisted to be included in the interview process, one of our team will be in contact with you.

Title: Project Analyst
Description:
Insight Global is seeking a Project Analyst for BC's leading health authority to lead the transition of current data in programs to the OnePlan tool across the Capital Projects portfolio. The Project Analyst will also be responsible for change management of the new program to get current teams aligned with the features and utilization of the tool. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in transferring data into OnePlan, analysis of the portfolio, identifying risks and gaps, communicating suggestions to stakeholders, monitoring the quality of the data, and overall optimizing the processes to ensure a smooth transition. Additionally, the Project Analyst will be responsible for adoption of OnePlan, conducting thorough reviews and analyses of the project portfolio, providing one-on-one training and support to Project Managers, and ensuring compliance with established standards and best practices.

Must Haves:

Minimum of 3 years of experience in project analysis coupled with change management
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Analytics, or Health Administration
Experience working with large sets of data or information, and using it to develop requirements for projects
Experience working alongside and supporting functional Project Managers
Experience working with Procore, MS Projects or similar PM software
Strong experience in Excel and SharePoint
Experience working with Power BI

Plusses:

Preferred healthcare or public sector experience
Preferred experience working in construction/engineering/facilities environment

Title: Data Analyst Lead
Description:
Leavitt Industrial Group is a long-term owner and operator of industrial-focused businesses across North America. Formerly known as Venturis Capital, our organization has spent decades building and investing in strong, service-driven businesses. We have grown into a distinct group of aligned companies that support a broad spectrum of industrial sectors.

Our approach is steady and proven. We acquire and support businesses with strong leadership, a people-first culture, and the potential to grow. We believe in growing with our people, not just our numbers. Our group is built on trust, earned through performance, and reinforced through consistency.

With a focus on learning and continuous improvement, we are proud to invest in our people and offer a progressive and flexible work culture where you can develop and advance your career while focusing on meaningful work.

The Opportunity

Leavitt Industrial Group is looking for a Data Analyst Lead to join our team remotely in Coquitlam, British Columbia. As the Data Analyst Lead, you will lead the data migration from our legacy ERP to a modern ERP platform, ensuring timely and accurate delivery across core business domains. This hands-on role includes defining the migration roadmap, coordinating a small team, and resolving data issues.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

As the Data Analyst Lead your key responsibilities will include:


Lead the planning and execution of data migration activities across all ERP domains
Lead and develop a small team to ensure on-time, high-quality data delivery aligned with project milestones
Educate cross functional teams on data quality standards and practices
Define and manage the data migration roadmap, including profiling, mapping, cleansing, and validation
Collaborate with functional and technical stakeholders to align business requirements with migration plans
Support mock runs, cutover planning, and post-load validation and reconciliation
Document data flows, rules, and assumptions for use in future reporting and integration work
Post-migration, lead the ingestion and modeling of ERP data into Microsoft Fabric to support analytics
Collaborate with data engineers and Power BI developers to enable semantic models and data products


Required Skills & Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, knowledge, and competencies:


5+ years of experience in data analysis or migration, with strong delivery ownership
Experience leading small teams or workstreams with accountability for outcomes
Deep understanding of ERP data domains, including finance, inventory, customers, and vendors
Strong SQL skills and experience with ETL tools or scripting for data profiling and transformation
Familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O) is preferred
Previous exposure to or interest in Microsoft Fabric, including Lakehouses, Dataflows, and semantic modeling
Strong communication and documentation skills for technical and non-technical audiences


Benefits & Perks

Leavitt Industrial Group is proud to offer competitive compensation and flexible benefits coverage for all eligible employees, including an employer matching RRSP plan:


Company paid medical health care plan for you and your dependents
Dental plan, vision plan, and prescription drug coverage
Annual health care spending account
Life insurance, disability insurance, and travel insurance ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Sick leave plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Employee assistance programs
RRSP matching
Ongoing professional development opportunities


The base pay range for this role is: $100,000 to $120,000, depending on experience.

This is a remote role based in Coquitlam, British Columbia.

Leavitt Industrial Group would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only qualified applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an interview. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

#LeavittIndustrialGroup

Title: Online Data Analyst (Work from Home/Freelance)
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role; however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in the English language
Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada.
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Organization

Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world‚Äôs most liveable and environmentally sustainable cities. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, reconciliation, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and engaging workplace. Working at the City of Vancouver and within the public service can be a rewarding career where you play a key role in ensuring impartial and equitable access to services, upholding ethical governance, and addressing the needs of citizens with integrity and dedication.

Main Purpose and Function

The Streets Asset Management team, in the Streets Design Branch, stewards the City‚Äôs streets and sidewalks and oversees their rehabilitation. Reporting to the Asset Management Engineer, the Data Specialist serves a critical role in helping track and analyse our street and sidewalk assets, to ensure we are good stewards of the City‚Äôs infrastructure and maintain a street network that supports mobility, accessibility, and a vibrant community.

The Data Specialist is responsible for providing technical oversight of data collection programs for street and sidewalk assets and ensuring that data is maintained in accordance with best practices. This position performs highly complex data analyses using large asset management data sets and produces data visualizations using modern business intelligence (BI) tools. This role requires advanced skills in GIS and database management.

The Data Specialist will support asset management programs for streets and structures in accordance with best-practices including: analysis of large data sets related to pavement, sidewalks and structures, analysis of capital and operating costs for various asset types, and review of consultant and vendor studies related to asset management.

Specific Duties And Responsibilities


Manages the ongoing operation and maintenance of data infrastructure to meet the data analytics and reporting needs of the Streets Design Branch.
Oversees the development of data collection programs related to the Branch‚Äôs asset management programs.
Supports the Branch‚Äôs capital planning work by analysing street asset data, assessing trends and gaps in asset condition, and presenting findings to guide the effective investment of multimillion dollar capital budgets.
Designs and implements sustainable and repeatable data management approaches involving cloud, on-premise, and big data datasets and technologies.
Develops and maintains large asset management data sets from multiple sources (internal, equipment, service providers, outside agencies, etc.)
Develops data visualizations using modern BI tools and/or GIS software.
Designs, develops, and presents metrics and reports to senior management.
Recommends solutions and alternatives related to the accessibility, interaction, and presentation of data.
Directs and reviews the data collection work of manual data collection efforts.
Prepare annual national benchmarking data and appropriate analytics to identify and address gaps in service delivery or performance.
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.


Qualifications

Education and Experience:


Completion of a diploma or certificate from a recognized post-secondary institution in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Geographic Information Systems, Geography, Planning, Engineering, or a related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience applicable to the department.
Sound experience in data analysis; experience in a public sector or large multi-stakeholder organization an asset
Experience supporting business process changes.


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


Skilled in the use of ArcGIS and MS Excel
Knowledge of data management best practices.
Ability to analyze and synthesize data from multiple data sources and formats.
Ability to work with modern business intelligence (BI) software (Tableau or Qlik, PowerBI, etc.)
Ability to work with query languages (SQL, MDX, etc.)
Ability to design and build data warehouses and data marts.
Working knowledge of cloud and on-premise warehouses and query systems.
Ability to communicate effectively, foster high standards, and deliver results in a fast-paced, performance-focused environment.
Strong sense of accountability.
Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities, and respond to requests in a timely manner.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal and external contacts and team members to provide advice, information, and assistance.
Experience visualizing data and creating presentation material; experience working with asset management data an asset
Experience in SQL database and database design schema would be an asset.
Knowledge of Justice, Equity, Decolonization, Diversity, & Inclusion practices and how they inform data collection & analysis would be an asset.


Where operationally appropriate and subject to change, the City of Vancouver has a Flexible Work Program. This program allows staff to work a hybrid work week from locations that are a daily commutable distance from their work at a City worksite. At this time this position is eligible to be part of the Flexible Work Program.

Title: Data Pipeline Developer Co-op
Description:
Application Deadline: We will review applications on a rolling-basis

Duration:‚ÄØ8 months

Positions Available: 1

Start Date:‚ÄØMonday, September 8, 2025

For this exciting position, we are specifically targeting students who have a background in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics and Engineering and who possess coding experience and demonstrate an enthusiastic curiosity towards the following areas: data engineering, data visualization, cloud computing, and mining technologies.‚ÄØDepending on the needs and location of the team, you will need to work PDT or MDT or relocate to a specific office (site-based).‚ÄØYou must also currently be a student enrolled in a Canadian post-secondary institution and will be enrolled throughout the duration of the co-op term (you will also be returning back to the post-secondary institution once the co-op term is completed). Proof of a valid work permit will also be required, if applicable.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Don‚Äôt miss out on this exciting opportunity to be part of one of Canada‚Äôs leading mining companies and join our team!‚ÄØ

Why consider Teck Resources Limited for your Co-op Placement?

At Teck, we offer more than just a job ‚Äì we provide a comprehensive student experience comprised of relevant, hands-on work, vibrant social activities, extensive networking opportunities, and rich professional development. With captivating projects set against stunning backdrops, a culture of inclusivity and collaboration, and boundless opportunities to learn, grow, and have fun, joining us means embracing‚ÄØa fulfilling and dynamic co-op adventure.

In addition to excellent compensation, Teck co-ops receive a variety of advantages including but not limited to:‚ÄØ


Financial assistance to help with travel costs and co-op fees
Opportunity to develop technical skills and gain practical experience while applying academic knowledge to real-world mining operations and projects
Enjoy mentorship and guidance from experienced specialists in their respective fields
Receive primary consideration for professional positions upon graduation


Headquartered in‚ÄØVancouver, British Columbia, Teck Resources Limited is one of Canada‚Äôs leading mining companies committed to innovation and continuous improvement, while ensuring everyone goes home safe and healthy every day. We work with a sense of personal responsibility and genuine care for the people, communities and lands which we are entrusted. We all share a strong sense of purpose at Teck, and each day we are guided by our values in how we operate and conduct ourselves.

Located in the heart of Downtown, Vancouver, and nestled between the mountains and Pacific Ocean, you will find globally-inspired cuisines and world famous natural wonders in one of Canada‚Äôs most culturally diverse cities. Don‚Äôt miss out on this opportunity to work (and adventure) in one of the most sustainable cities in the world!

Salary Range: $4,000 - $5,100 / Month

Salary is commensurate with the number of academic semesters and prior co-op experiences completed.

Responsibilities


Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
Design, build and deploy Data Pipelines on Azure for Operational Data including Historian time series data, SQL server databases and unstructured data sources
Solve sophisticated technical problems with legacy systems to overcome technical roadblocks preventing data migration to the cloud platform
Conduct detailed validation of pipeline data, prioritizing data delivery, security, and quality to maintain integrity and confidentiality
Provide and develop monitoring and performance metrics for data-pipelines to measure and ensure performance KPIs are met
Maintain application and system documentation
Facilitate and support incident response and forensics for pipelines on Azure‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


Qualifications


Preference will be given to students with diverse educational backgrounds, including Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics and Engineering
Coding experience in Python, SQL, C# is an asset
Proven ability to learn new technologies and platforms quickly, accurately, and efficiently
Ability to communicate with precision in a technical environment
Able to articulate sophisticated concepts clearly and in a way a diverse audience would understand
Experience with cloud platforms is an asset and a variety of technology backgrounds is valued
Knowledge and experience with working in Agile is an asset
Proficient in both independent work and collaborative teamwork, encouraging an inclusive and diverse environment


About Teck

Teck is a leading Canadian resource company focused on responsibly providing the metals essential for global development and the energy transition while caring for the people, communities and land that we love.

Teck's two regional business units, North America and Latin America, are responsible for Teck's assets through all phases of safe, sustainable development, operation and closure. The business units are supported by enterprise-wide functions that set strategic direction, establish standards and provide governance, as well as supporting the business through shared services, centres of excellence and business partnering.

Join Teck, a leader in the mining industry, where we hire over 150 students each year across our operations. Our commitment to fostering young talent has earned us recognition as one of Canada‚Äôs Top Employers for Young People and as one of Canada‚Äôs Top 100 Employers. We are also proud to be named one of the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations by Corporate Knights. At Teck, you'll gain valuable experience, contribute to meaningful projects, and be part of a company dedicated to sustainability and innovation. Start your career journey with us!
Show more
HTML:
Application Deadline: We will review applications on a rolling-basis

Duration:‚ÄØ8 months

Positions Available: 1

Start Date:‚ÄØMonday, September 8, 2025

For this exciting position, we are specifically targeting students who have a background in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics and Engineering and who possess coding experience and demonstrate an enthusiastic curiosity towards the following areas: data engineering, data visualization, cloud computing, and mining technologies.‚ÄØDepending on the needs and location of the team, you will need to work PDT or MDT or relocate to a specific office (site-based).‚ÄØYou must also currently be a student enrolled in a Canadian post-secondary institution and will be enrolled throughout the duration of the co-op term (you will also be returning back to the post-secondary institution once the co-op term is completed). Proof of a valid work permit will also be required, if applicable.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Don‚Äôt miss out on this exciting opportunity to be part of one of Canada‚Äôs leading mining companies and join our team!‚ÄØ

Why consider Teck Resources Limited for your Co-op Placement?

At Teck, we offer more than just a job ‚Äì we provide a comprehensive student experience comprised of relevant, hands-on work, vibrant social activities, extensive networking opportunities, and rich professional development. With captivating projects set against stunning backdrops, a culture of inclusivity and collaboration, and boundless opportunities to learn, grow, and have fun, joining us means embracing‚ÄØa fulfilling and dynamic co-op adventure.

In addition to excellent compensation, Teck co-ops receive a variety of advantages including but not limited to:‚ÄØ

  • Financial assistance to help with travel costs and co-op fees
  • Opportunity to develop technical skills and gain practical experience while applying academic knowledge to real-world mining operations and projects
  • Enjoy mentorship and guidance from experienced specialists in their respective fields
  • Receive primary consideration for professional positions upon graduation

Headquartered in‚ÄØVancouver, British Columbia, Teck Resources Limited is one of Canada‚Äôs leading mining companies committed to innovation and continuous improvement, while ensuring everyone goes home safe and healthy every day. We work with a sense of personal responsibility and genuine care for the people, communities and lands which we are entrusted. We all share a strong sense of purpose at Teck, and each day we are guided by our values in how we operate and conduct ourselves.

Located in the heart of Downtown, Vancouver, and nestled between the mountains and Pacific Ocean, you will find globally-inspired cuisines and world famous natural wonders in one of Canada‚Äôs most culturally diverse cities. Don‚Äôt miss out on this opportunity to work (and adventure) in one of the most sustainable cities in the world!

Salary Range: $4,000 - $5,100 / Month

Salary is commensurate with the number of academic semesters and prior co-op experiences completed.

Responsibilities

  • Provide and develop monitoring and performance metrics for data-pipelines to measure and ensure performance KPIs are met
  • Maintain application and system documentation
  • Facilitate and support incident response and forensics for pipelines on Azure‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Qualifications

  • Preference will be given to students with diverse educational backgrounds, including Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics and Engineering
  • Coding experience in Python, SQL, C# is an asset
  • Proven ability to learn new technologies and platforms quickly, accurately, and efficiently
  • Ability to communicate with precision in a technical environment
  • Able to articulate sophisticated concepts clearly and in a way a diverse audience would understand
  • Experience with cloud platforms is an asset and a variety of technology backgrounds is valued
  • Knowledge and experience with working in Agile is an asset
  • Proficient in both independent work and collaborative teamwork, encouraging an inclusive and diverse environment

About Teck

Teck is a leading Canadian resource company focused on responsibly providing the metals essential for global development and the energy transition while caring for the people, communities and land that we love.

Teck's two regional business units, North America and Latin America, are responsible for Teck's assets through all phases of safe, sustainable development, operation and closure. Title: Data Operations Analyst
Description:
About The Company

Cover Genius is a Series D Insurtech that protects the global customers of the world‚Äôs largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com, Intuit, Hopper, Skyscanner, Ryanair, Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We‚Äôre also available at Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Wayfair and SE Asia‚Äôs largest company, Shopee.

Our partners integrate with XCover, our award-winning insurance distribution platform, to embed protection for millions of customers worldwide each year. Our team and products have been recognized sed with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times who ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 20+ countries and many language groups commits itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular ‚ÄúCG Gives‚Äù which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities.

Our People are Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired

Our People are not Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious

About The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Operations Lead to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering data-driven solutions that support business growth, improve operational efficiency, and drive strategic initiatives. This role will play a critical part in ensuring seamless data flow, optimising workflows, and providing data-driven insights to support business decisions.

What will your day look like? You will‚Ä¶


Develop strategic principles and frameworks to support optimal decision making across business functions
Build knowledge of our technology stack and data flows to align data with business context, enabling teams to solve complex business challenges
Work with the broader business functions to evaluate key business drivers and trends, support metric and dashboard development and provide reporting on operational performance
Build strong relationships with a broad set of cross-functional stakeholders , including teams across Insurance, Partner Services, Compliance, Data Science, Partnerships and Pricing teams to streamline processes, optimise workflows, and support efficient use of resources
Work directly with our captive insurance company to support reporting and underwriting performance management
Project manage data driven initiatives and provide support such as facilitating workshops and internal training
Collaborate with and educate stakeholders around data governance policies and procedures enabling consistent and standardised use of data across business functions
Work with our Data Engineering team to enable data driven solutions cross functionally


To Help Us Level Up, You'll Ideally Have


2+ years of experience in a data related role
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Experience in the development and execution of data-related projects
Understanding of data operations, data governance, and data management principles
Experience with data integrations, data validation, and data quality checks
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present the complex clearly and concisely
Strong SQL proficiency and database infrastructure knowledge required. Experience with Python/R or other statistical programming languages is a bonus
Excellent data analysis and visualisation skill
The ability to build effective working relationships with stakeholders from a range of backgrounds and levels of seniority
Strong analytical and problem-solving with an enthusiasm to drive data-driven decision-making
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment managing multiple priorities and deadlines


Why Cover Genius?

Cover Genius not only cares about being the best in our industry, we care about our team. We‚Äôre a business that understands life can be fluid and so we flex to ensure we provide the environment to suit that. What does that mean?


Flexible Work Environment - Our teams are hybrid. We work from home on Wednesdays and Thursday and attend the office on Monday, Tuesday and Friday with flexibility around start/finish times.
Employee Stock Options - we want our people to share in our success, we reward them with ownership for their contribution in creating a world-class company.
Work with like-minded people who are passionate about both the work we're doing and giving back. Our CG Gives programs enable us to all become philanthropists through our peer recognition and rewards system.
Social Initiatives - pictures speak a thousand words!


Sound interesting? If you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your resume and let's chat!


Cover Genius promotes diversity and inclusivity. We don't tolerate discrimination, demeaning treatment of anyone, or harassment due to race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.


By submitting your application, you acknowledge that we may collect, store and process your personal data for recruitment purposes. To ensure a fair evaluation, we may use AI to assist in sorting applications, but all final decisions are made by our hiring team and no candidate dispositions are automated. We will keep your information on file for three years from the date of your application. For detailed information about how we handle your data and our use of AI, please review our full Privacy Policy.

Title: Freelance Online Data Analyst - Canada (English)
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English language
Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada.
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Senior Operations Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Your opportunity

By joining the Kardium team, you can help make a difference in the lives of millions around the world. We have developed a ground-breaking medical device for the minimally invasive diagnosis and treatment of the most common heart rhythm disorder, atrial fibrillation. Atrial fibrillation can cause stroke, heart failure, and other heart-related complications.

Kardium has a fantastic technical team that has developed a product with strong, unique and customer-valued differentiators versus other solutions on the market: The Globe¬Æ Pulsed Field System. We have built connections with key opinion leaders who are already using the Globe System and are helping to tell our story.

As an Operational Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high-impact dashboards, metrics and reporting across various operational teams. You will play a critical role in enabling real-time operational visibility and data-informed decision-making, supporting both daily execution and strategic planning initiatives. The analyst will work cross-functionally with operations, purchasing, and quality teams, with a strong focus on data quality and continuity during our transition to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP system.

Please note, this opportunity is a hybrid work arrangement, located in Burnaby, BC.

Meaningful work you will be part of

‚ÄØ

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Develop and maintain critical operational metrics and key process indicators (KPIs) to support manufacturing, planning, and quality functions
Create and manage visual dashboards to provide real time insight into operational performance using tools such as Power BI and Excel
Provide analytical support for continuous improvement initiatives and projects to identify and prioritize optimization opportunities for cost reduction and performance improvements.
Query and extract relevant data from ERP and other data sources using SQL or other relevant tools.
Partner with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and alignment with operational goals
Collaborate with stakeholders to develop scalable reporting frameworks and templates to support future growth.
Advise on data architecture and structure as systems evolve and new systems introduced, ensuring the right data is collected and accessible.
Lead initiatives to improve data quality and governance, identifying gaps and implementing data validation processes.
Train and support end-users in interpreting dashboard data and utilizing insights for decision-making.
Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations and company policies.


What you bring to the team

Our Kardium team is smart, creative, and passionate about developing cutting-edge medical devices to help improve people‚Äôs lives. We work in a collaborative environment based on trust and respect. We understand that only by working together can we solve what was thought unsolvable.

You are suited to our approach and possess these attributes:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years experience in data analytics or reporting in a manufacturing or supply chain environment.
Advanced skills in Power BI, SQL and Excel.
Highly analytic and data driven with the ability to organize data and derive conclusions
Demonstrated experience building and maintaining dashboards and reporting systems used by cross-functional teams.
Strong understanding of operational process (manufacturing, supply chain) as well as key operations metrics (e.g., OEE, throughput, inventory turns, supplier performance).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experience working with ERP systems (Microsoft D365 or equivalent is a strong asset).
Knowledge and experience working in the regulated manufacturing industry is an asset.


Compensation

Kardium has listed the total cash compensation range that we expect to pay applicants for this role, as of the time of this posting. Pay offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, and business or organizational needs.


$90,000 ‚Äì 120,000 (CAD Annually)


Why work at Kardium

A meaningful career working with a truly innovative technology and an ambitious team, combined with:


Knowing every day that you are making a difference in people‚Äôs lives by helping treat a condition that affects millions worldwide.
A great working environment with opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge.
An opportunity to extend your knowledge by interacting with other team members in a multi-disciplinary environment that includes electrical and mechanical engineers, biologists, and specialists in human factors, and clinical and regulatory affairs.
An engaged leadership team who believes in mentoring and growing employees‚Äô careers.
Supportive and fun colleagues with plenty of social events to encourage people connections.
And our employees think we are great too ‚Äì check out Glassdoor to learn more!


Your Benefits & Well-being

Support for you (and your dependents) overall well-being.

Life at Kardium

What makes us a great place to work?


Our Purpose
Our People
Our Culture


At Kardium, we embrace diversity of background, experience, and perspective and we‚Äôre committed to inclusion and equity at every level. We encourge applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of all communities.

We collaborate with Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), as volunteer-led groups who share a common dimension of diversity and come together to provide support, education, and other opportunities across Kardium. Your opportunity

By joining the Kardium team, you can help make a difference in the lives of millions around the world. We have developed a ground-breaking medical device for the minimally invasive diagnosis and treatment of the most common heart rhythm disorder, atrial fibrillation. Atrial fibrillation can cause stroke, heart failure, and other heart-related complications.

Kardium has a fantastic technical team that has developed a product with strong, unique and customer-valued differentiators versus other solutions on the market: The Globe¬Æ Pulsed Field System. We have built connections with key opinion leaders who are already using the Globe System and are helping to tell our story.

As an Operational Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high-impact dashboards, metrics and reporting across various operational teams. You will play a critical role in enabling real-time operational visibility and data-informed decision-making, supporting both daily execution and strategic planning initiatives. The analyst will work cross-functionally with operations, purchasing, and quality teams, with a strong focus on data quality and continuity during our transition to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP system.

Please note, this opportunity is a hybrid work arrangement, located in Burnaby, BC.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

As a part of our Data and Analytics team, you will support some of our largest game titles by helping us understand player engagement and measure the effectiveness of our marketing efforts. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer with broad technical skills and ability to work with large amounts of data. You will report to the Lead Data Engineer under the Senior Director of Growth Analytics. You will be involved in the entire development life cycle, from brainstorming ideas to implementing elegant solutions to obtain data insights. You will collaborate with data scientists and user-acquisition managers to implement data strategies and develop complex ETL pipelines that support dashboards that promote deeper understanding of our audiences and player behaviour.

This position will evolve into a hybrid work schedule with 3 days in office each week.

Responsibilities


You will work with analysts, understand requirements, and develop technical specifications for ETLs
You will implement efficient, scalable and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data.
You will promote strategies to improve our data modelling, quality and architecture
You will work with big data solutions, ETL pipelines and dashboard tools.


Qualifications


3+ years relevant industry experience in a data engineering role and graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field
Proficiency in writing SQL queries and knowledge of cloud-based databases like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery or other big data solutions
Experience in data modelling, ETL processes, and data warehousing
Experience with Python and data pipeline tools such as Airflow
Experience with version control systems like GitHub / GitLab
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) *$100,000 - $139,500 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

  • Experience with version control systems like GitHub / GitLab
  • Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)

Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES

  • British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) *$100,000 - $139,500 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Come join Pattison Food Group Ltd., a Jim Pattison business, and Canada‚Äôs largest Western-based provider of food and health products.

Pattison Food Group Ltd. consists of Save-On-Foods and other well-known grocery banners. With nearly 300 retail locations, we proudly employ more than 30,000 team members.

We have an exciting opportunity for a full-time Senior Data Analyst to join our More Rewards Loyalty team in Langley, BC.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Customer Data & Insights, you will be responsible for leveraging all aspects of data and analytics to drive large-scale projects and continuous experimentation initiatives that guide decision-making and deliver high-quality insights. You will also support the development and management of customer data and insights using a large and comprehensive data set to support the More Rewards Loyalty Program, Retail Operations, Marketing and Merchandising.

You will be responsible for:


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business questions, processes and KPIs.
Formulating testable hypotheses aligned with business questions and conducting statistical experiments in a live environment.
Writing SQL scripts to automate data pipelines and workflows.
Using Python scripts in a Jupyter Notebook environment for data analysis, data wrangling, statistical testing and predictive modeling.
Mentoring and cross-training data analysts in experimentation best practices and statistical design.
Developing dashboards and visualizations in Power BI to convey insights and report on KPIs and test results.
Working in cloud-based analytics environments and with big data tools to build analytics workflows on large datasets.
Collaborating with IT and Data Scientists to identify technical and data requirements for deploying analytic solutions tailed to business needs.
Becoming an expert in the relevant datasets within your analytics domain.



You have:


A degree in a STEM discipline and at least 5 years of relevant experience in data analytics or data science.
Advanced Python coding skills.
Advanced understanding of SQL.
Experience using experimental design principles, such as A/B and multivariate testing, and working with business stakeholders to formulate testable hypotheses.
Understanding of advanced analytics and data science methods such as anomaly detection, forecasting, and supervised and unsupervised learning.
Experience with visualization and reporting tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Working knowledge of cloud environments such as Azure, GCP, or AWS.
Experience with big data tools, such as Spark and Databricks, and other programming languages is an asset.



You are:


A confident communicator, both verbally and in writing, with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate a story with data and insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Effective in task management and delivering high-quality work.
Capable of multitasking and thriving in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Able to mentor and guide junior team members, fostering their professional growth and enhancing team performance.



What we offer:

In addition to a highly competitive salary, we offer a great range of benefits, a company pension plan, free parking, exclusive team member offers, and opportunities for development and career progression.

If you‚Äôre looking to join a team that puts people first, you‚Äôre in the right place. Apply online today!

Compensation Details:

$92,880.00 - $116,100.00

The compensation offered for this position will take into consideration location, education, skills, experience, and other factors.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer with broad technical skills and ability to work with large amounts of data. You will collaborate with the Game teams to implement data strategies and develop complex ETL pipelines that support dashboards for promoting deeper understanding of our games.

You will have experience developing and establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses. You will work with leaders from an internal Game Studio, providing them with data for understanding game and player insights and report to the Technical Lead for this group.

You will work hybrid from our office in Burnaby.

Key Responsibilities


As a Data Engineer you will be involved in the entire development life cycle, from brainstorming ideas to implementing elegant solutions to obtain data insights.
You will gather requirements, model and design solutions to support reporting analytics, and exploratory analysis.
You will implement efficient, scalable and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data.
You will work with analysts, understand requirements, develop technical specifications for ETLs, including documentation.
You will promote strategies to improve our data modelling, quality and architecture
Explore data and suggest new opportunities to measure and assess the performance of our marketing and commercial actions.


Required Qualifications


4+ years relevant industry experience in a data engineering role and graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field
Proficiency in writing SQL queries and knowledge of cloud-based databases like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery or other big data solutions
Experience in data modelling, ETL processes, and data warehousing
Experience with at least one of the programming languages like Python or Java
Knowledge of latest data pipeline tools such as Airflow
Comfortable working with a multi-functional team, both locally and remote, understanding the perspectives of each partner
Experience in version control tools (Git, Bitbucket, etc.)


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) *$100,000 - $139,500 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading automotive parts retailer, is hiring a Business Systems Analyst (BSA) for a full-time, permanent position based onsite at their Port Coquitlam head office (5 days/week). Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.




This role is ideal for candidates with a programming or software development background who are either currently working as a Business Systems Analyst or are looking to transition into one. Experience within large-scale retail IT environments and an understanding of retail system architecture are essential.

The BSA will be a key contributor to ongoing digital transformation initiatives, serving as the bridge between IT and business operations‚Äîparticularly across supply chain and retail functions. The successful candidate will analyze, plan, and implement technology solutions that enhance business processes and operational efficiency. This includes gathering and translating business requirements, conducting systems and data analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams on enterprise software enhancements. They will also evaluate new tools and platforms, provide insights to support retail strategy, and help guide technical delivery planning.




Qualifications:

Degree or diploma in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field, ideally combined with business studies.
5+ years of professional experience in software development within enterprise environments.
Current or recent experience as a Business Systems Analyst, or a strong interest in transitioning into the role.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Deep understanding of IT systems, relational databases, and data workflows.
Experience with retail systems architecture and operations is strongly preferred.
Proven ability to analyze complex problems and deliver actionable, technical solutions.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical requirements into business outcomes.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
The Business Systems Analyst supports the creation of integrated workflows between business critical systems across the enterprise. This role builds automation systems that allow integration between business systems (ERP, CRM, HRIS, ect) and production systems; reducing the need for manual processes within the business.

Podtech Data Centers Inc., the employing entity, is a proud member of the IREN Group and we are currently looking to hire!

IREN is a leading next-generation data center business powering the future with 100% renewable energy. We build, own and operate our data centers and take pride in being at the forefront of sustainable solutions for the ever-evolving applications of high-performance compute. We believe that human progress is invaluable, but it should be done in the right way ‚Äì responsibly, sustainably and having a positive impact on the communities we operate in.

We have grown substantially since 2019, from our inception in Australia to now having several facilities across North America and being listed on NASDAQ‚Ä¶ and we are just getting started! By joining us, you will be contributing to the future of sustainable high-performance compute and the local communities we strive to have a positive impact on.

We value diverse perspectives and believe that skills can be developed. If you‚Äôre passionate about this role, we want to hear from you ‚Äî whether you meet every criteria or not. Your unique experiences might be exactly what we need!

Apply today to be considered for an exciting opportunity with us.

The Business Systems Analyst has a broad remit within our team, supporting the creation of integrated workflows between business critical systems across the enterprise. This role is a critical to the support and enablement of our continued growth by ensuring that teams are enabled to use best in class tools in a seamlessly integrated environment.

By building reusable orchestration systems, your work will build the foundation of how our production and business systems operate together as we continue to grow. You will gain experience with a broad range of systems, from virtual to physical, where bringing your knowledge and drive to enable others to shape how we work at IREN.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the IT Senior Manager, the Business Systems Analyst will:


Be responsible for managing system integrations, data flows, and custom development efforts to ensure interaction between different business applications (e.g., ERP, CRM, HRIS) and other internal systems.
Lead the development of custom solutions, integrations, automations, and enhancements within IT enterprise systems based on business needs
Develop custom applications, scripts, and automations to meet specific business needs that cannot be addressed by out-of-the-box solutions
Ensure data consistency and integrity across all systems by managing data flows, handling data transformations, and applying governance rules
Maintain and manage APIs and middleware solutions to connect systems, reduce manual work, and streamline business processes
Ensure that all integrations and custom developments adhere to the organization's security protocols
Use a ticketing system for tracking issues, troubleshooting, user support and internal communications
Act as the primary point of contact for resolving system integration issues, providing technical support, and maintaining system uptime
Work with a dynamic team where roles are fluid, but goals are unified. Expect to learn skills beyond the role, and continuously improve your craft
Work closely with internal stakeholders to identify and deliver efficiencies between systems.


Desired Qualifications Include


Expertise in system integration technologies (N8N, Workato, Zapier, Boomi, etc.) and/or orchestration (Temporal, Airflow, etc.).
Strong programming skills for developing solutions (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc); Experience integrating with the Microsoft 365 suite and Entra ID a strong asset.
Experience with ERP (NetSuite, Oracle, SAP), HRIS (HiBOB, Workday, etc.), CRM (Hubspot, Salesforce, etc) or other enterprise software platforms a strong asset.
Familiarity with data architecture, data governance, and security best practices.
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent combination of education/experience.


The IREN Package


Salary range: Starting at CAD $100,000/annum, depending on experience
Short-term and Long-term Incentive Programs
Extended Health and Dental Benefits
3 weeks paid vacation
Casual work attire


Podtech Data Centers Inc., the employing entity and proud member of the IREN Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, we are only able to contact candidates under consideration.

By applying for this position and submitting your resume and application materials, you consent to the processing of your personal information in accordance with our Job Applicant Privacy Statement available on our website at www.iren.com.

Title: Analytics & BI Application Specialist
Description:
Responsibilities:


Act as a liaison between QCA's customers and the development team, ensuring effective communication of business requirements.
Conduct comprehensive business analysis and gather technical requirements.
Configure and interface with modern SCADA and industrial historian systems.
Design, develop, and troubleshoot modern database solutions using cloud-based platforms.
Implement robust data integration processes for analytics and data transformation.
Architect and implement scalable, secure cloud-based infrastructures.
Develop advanced BI solutions and dashboards to support client decision-making.
Facilitate seamless data flow between industrial control systems and enterprise applications.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of system architectures, processes, and solutions.


Requirements:


2 to 4 years of relevant experience in Analytics, BI, or similar fields.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Industrial Automation, or a related field.
Proficiency in modern database technologies such as SQL Server, Azure SQL, or PostgreSQL
Hands-on experience with industrial data historians (e.g., OSIsoft PI, Ignition, Canary Labs).
Expertise in data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache NiFi, Azure Data Factory, Talend).
Familiarity with data integration protocols (e.g., OPC UA, MQTT, REST APIs).
Experience with Business Intelligence and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Experience with modern version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD practices.
Analytical thinker with a meticulous eye for detail and a solutions-oriented mindset
Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to convey ideas effectively
Able to build positive relationship within and across teams


Other qualifications (preferred but not required:


Knowledge of industrial automation systems (e.g., SCADA, PLC).
Experience with IIoT platforms and edge computing solutions.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and AI-driven analytics.
Relevant certifications in cloud technologies or data engineering
Experience in cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud).

  • Experience with Business Intelligence and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
  • Experience with modern version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD practices.
  • Analytical thinker with a meticulous eye for detail and a solutions-oriented mindset
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to convey ideas effectively
  • Able to build positive relationship within and across teams

Other qualifications (preferred but not required:

  • Knowledge of industrial automation systems (e.g., SCADA, PLC).
  • Experience with IIoT platforms and edge computing solutions.
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and AI-driven analytics.
  • Relevant certifications in cloud technologies or data engineering
  • Experience in cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud).

Title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Description:
Apply Now

Bangkok, Thailand

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

This role is based in Bangkok, Thailand, and is open to candidates worldwide. We offer a generous relocation package to ensure a smooth transition to living and working in Bangkok.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:


Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:


2‚Äì3 years of experience
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, economics, engineering, statistics or science)
Strong English communication
Solid business acumen
Strong statistical and analytical skills
Proficient in Excel and hands-on with data tools (SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau)
Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests
Works independently on daily analytics tasks and provides business recommendations


It‚Äôs Great if you Have:


Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience
